loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Del Triangulo Group

texts.es:
Telma es una mujer de 30 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 10 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del cantón San Francisco.
Telma para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y refacciones, con este negocio lleva 3 años de realzarlo.
Telma con el afán de mejorar su calidad de servicio hacia sus clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra  de una estufa mejorada que lo utiliza para la preparación de tortillas. Con esta inversión Telma espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida son contar con su propio local de negocio, pagar los estudios de sus hijos y mejorar los ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Telma is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has a lovely family with two daughters aged between 2 and 10 years. This humble family lives in a community in San Francisco canton.

To generate the necessary income and advance her family, Telma sells tortillas and spare parts. She has pursued her business for the last three years.

With hopes of improving the quality of her customer services, Telma has decided to request a loan to purchase an improved stove to be used to prepare tortillas. With this investment, she hopes to generate greater customer satisfaction.

Telma's aspirations in life are to have her own business location, to pay for her daughters' studies, and to improve her income.

loans.use: buy an improved stove for preparing tortillas.

loans.name: Bao

texts.fr:
Bao est une femme courageuse de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et élève 2 enfants dans un quartier animé de la ville. Elle gagne sa vie en vendant des légumes et cela depuis 25 ans. 
Cela fait 2 ans qu’elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Les prêts qu’elle a pris permettaient  de diversifier et d’augmenter le capital de son commerce de légume. Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter 100 Kg de carotte, 150 Kg de pomme de terre, 100 Kg de tomates et 60 Kg d’oignon. 
Bao est très sérieuse dans son activité car l’avenir de ses enfants en dépend. Son rêve est d’élever des vaches laitières en plus de la vente de légume.
texts.en:
Bao is a brave 40-year-old woman. She is married and is raising her two children in an animated area in the city. She has been earning a living by selling vegetables for 25 years.

She has been a Vahatra borrower for 2 years. The loans she has gotten have allowed her to diversify and augment the capital of her vegetable business. With this loan, she is going to buy 100 kg of carrots, 150 kg of potatoes, 100 kg of tomatoes, and 60 kg of onions.

Bao is very serious about her business, as the future of her children depend on it. Her dream is to raise dairy cows in addition to her vegetable business.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of vegetables to diversify and augment her stock.

loans.name: Volatantely Minosoa

texts.fr:
Volatantely est une jeune femme courageuse de 25 ans. Elle vit en concubinage et élève 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle vend des chaussures en ambulant dans les provinces depuis plus de 4 ans. 
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 1 an ou elle a pu augmenter le stock de chaussures à vendre. Elle a aussi embellit son foyer en achetant des meubles avec les bénéfices. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 60 paires de ballerines, 50 paires de tennis et 10 paires de sandales. 
Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices pour pouvoir construire un jour une maison sur le terrain qu’elle a pu acheter avec les bénéfices des prêts précédents.
texts.en:
Volatantely is a brave, young 25-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and is raising two children, who attend school. She has been selling shoes door to door in the provinces for more than 4 years.

She has been a Vahatra borrower for a year, during which she has been able to increase her stock of shoes to sell. She has also beautified her home by buying furniture with her profits. With this loan, she plans to buy 60 pairs of ballet shoes, 50 pairs of tennis shoes, and 10 pairs of sandals.

She hopes to earn a lot of profit to be able to one day build a house on the land she was able to buy with the profits from the previous loans.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of ballet shoes, 50 pairs of tennis shoes, and 10 pairs of sandals to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rumiya

texts.en:
Rumiya, 34 years old, lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family. A mother of a son and a daughter, she loves helping her family and also supports her old parents by visiting them daily and taking care of the farm.

Rumiya is a very hardworking farmer who has some cattle and raises small calves in her own yard. She usually fattens them and sells their meat in the local market. She has been doing this for the last two years but gained a vast amount of experience watching her parents doing it for more than 10 years.

People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods, mostly with meat. Since the existing demand is high in the local bazaar, Rumiya is planning to expand the business and the farm a little. She is therefore requesting this loan of 1900 AZN to buy five more calves.

Rumiya hopes that KIVA lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy five more calves.

loans.name: Mirembe Kawuwa Group

texts.en:
The group is located in a rural area and is comprised of 10 faithful UGAFODE supporters: Sulaina, Florence, Paul, Florence, Alex, Goreth, Oliva, Rosemary, Veronica and Pauline. They carry out different activities including farming, animal rearing, retail shops, arts and crafts, and coffee selling.

Oliva is a 39-year-old married woman with 5 children, 4 of whom are attending different schools in different areas. She is also taking care of 2 children who are orphans. She deals in farming where she grows crops like coffee, maize, beans and bananas. She  also trades in food items as her side business. She works 6 days a week and 10 hours per day. Oliva started her business to improve her income and to get food for the family. She has applied for this loan to purchase food items to sell at her food stall.

Her future hope is to educate all her children, and the challenge she faces is poor weather conditions,
She describes herself as an honest and hardworking woman who encourages lenders to keep up the good job of alleviating poverty.

loans.use: to buy stock of matooke, irish, tomatoes, onions and others to sell

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
A refugee living in the Bilasuvar region, Sanan is a 47-year-old married father of one son and two daughters. He is a very hardworking and diligent person trying to earn enough income for his family as a farmer who raises cattle and sheep.

Sanan is very energetic and passionate about his job, and there are many people in the local market who respect Sanan for his dedication, honesty and principles in his business. He is well-known for doing a great job in meeting customers' needs.

Sanan has a small shop where he sells natural meat in the market. Due to growing demand for traditional foods such as kufta and bozbash, which consist of mutton and beef, Sanan is planning to expand. He is therefore requesting a loan of 1200 AZN to buy two calves. Hopefully, KIVA lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq is 37 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives at the moment in Bilasuvar region which is a settlement for refugees.  Natiq is married but his family isn't large. He has a daughter, son and his wife. He is supporting his family with his farming activities. He is taking care of his family and also his elder parents. Natiq is a well reputed man in the local market. At this young age, he has been successful in the local bazaar. He grows vegetables and fruits. People see him as an honest, intelligent and hard-working person. Natiq's job depends on people who have a high demand for fresh natural fruits and vegetables. There are many traditional dishes which consist of vegetables like potato, cabbage, tomato and also egg-plants. People prepare dolmas,  bozbash and other meals with them. Natiq is very hard-working and energetic. He wants to become a successful person and to meet his family's needs in a better way. For this he plans to improve the business. He is planning to buy new seeds and fertilizers. He requires a 1,200 AZN loan. KIVA lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gunel

texts.en:
Gunel, 23, is a young and passionate person who is an IDP from the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. She is living with her family and takes care of her parents and her younger siblings. At this young age she knows that she has great responsibilities. She is very diligent and knows that success requires dedication.

Gunel farms wheat with the aim of providing more natural products to people. In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat, especially in rural areas where people bake their own bread and make pastries and cakes at home.

Being a refugee in a region where people are more familiar with farming gives Gunel an advantage in the local market. She is more familiar with the area’s people and knows the peoples' needs and demands. The locals know her as an honest person.

Gunel has applied for a 2000 AZN loan through Kiva's field partner Agroinvest Credit Union to buy more fertilizer and seed for her fields. She hopes Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and seed for her fields.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is thanking Kiva and its supporters and CCT for supporting small business owners like her. The previous loan helped sustain her ornamental plant business. She trusts in your continuous help in maintaining her livelihood.

Once again she would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamental plants. Michelle puts her whole heart and best efforts into taking care of her plants as this is her source of income to feed her family and send her child to school.

Michelle dreams of acquiring another lot to expand her ornamental farm. She wants to send her children to high school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, gardening tools and pots for her ornamental plant business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has been selling clothes at the Coronado and Spring Valley swap meets in San Diego since 2003. Due to her divorce from her business partner and husband, she had to re-start her business earlier this year.

Rosario will use her $2,000 Kiva loan to purchase additional inventory from a wholesale business in San Ysidro, CA. Rosario’s goal is to re-establish the business she once had with her husband for many years and make it successful as it once was.

Rosario would like to re-invest in inventory to continue to sell at the swap meet. The inventory will be purchased at a whole sale warehouse so that she can keep her prices low for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory from a wholesale business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
PowerMundo is a Peruvian social enterprise that delivers life-enhancing solar energy solutions to off-grid communities to help people improve their lives. The main challenge PowerMundo faces is the lack of access to capital and the financing needed for solar product inventory. With this support from lenders like you, PowerMundo will be able to purchase an additional 5,000 solar products over the next eighteen months, greatly increasing its inventory, allowing more products to be distributed by micro-entrepreneurs, and ultimately improving the lives of remote customers through access to clean energy. 

Over 4 million Peruvians do not have access to electricity and must use candles, flashlights, and diesel lanterns to light their homes. As a result, many people suffer from burns and respiratory illnesses, and face high energy costs and limited productivity - all of which perpetuate a cycle of poverty. 

Over the last 3 years, Paul, PowerMundo’s General Manager, has led a team to develop a clean energy distribution network throughout Peru by working with existing local businesses and traveling sales agents who can efficiently reach remote customers, increasing their access to energy. PowerMundo trains and empowers Peruvian distributors with marketing and digital pay-as-you-go financing tools, allowing them to develop successful businesses that help people in rural communities save money, live healthier lives, and improve the environment.

PowerMundo’s impact is three-fold. First, the distributors trained by PowerMundo develop successful businesses that enable them to increase their income and thus better support their families. Second, the end-users gain access to clean energy, saving money and living healthier, more productive lives. For each solar lamp, end-users benefit from approximately 4 additional hours per night of improved lighting for work and educational purposes and can charge their cell phones. A family can save more than US$900 over 5 years by using a solar light instead of spending an average of $16 per month on other energy sources. Third, solar lights improve the environment; for each solar light, over 430 liters of diesel fuel and over 1,600 kgs of CO2 emissions will be replaced by clean energy. 

One of PowerMundo’s successful distributors is Diana who, with her husband, runs a basic necessities store in the town of Yurimaguas in the Loreto Region of Peru. Through this store, Diana supplies a small network of shops in the nearby rural communities. Seeing huge demand for improved lighting services, Diana received training from PowerMundo on the use and benefits of solar products, and she purchased an initial stock of 10 solar lights. With access to PowerMundo’s product inventory, marketing support, and business training, she gradually built up her business; within two years, Diana has expanded her distribution network to other areas of Loreto and now purchases over 150 solar lights per month. With the additional income that she earns from selling the solar products, Diana and her husband were able to move to Tarapoto, a larger city, where they can provide better schooling for their child and develop additional business opportunities. After seeing the benefits for both her family and her customers, Diana decided to grow her network and began to help other distributors start their own clean energy businesses; she now works with more than 15 distributors to reach rural, off-grid customers. PowerMundo’s sales have grown by an average of 150% annually for the past 3 years, leading to greater socioeconomic, health, and environmental impact through partners like Diana. 


Thank you for contributing to help PowerMundo increase its positive impact in Peru!

***
This loan is going through a Private Fundraising Period. During this period, the Field Partner and borrower are allowed to tap into their own networks to recruit support of the loan, prior to the loan being posted to the public Kiva website.

loans.use: to purchase approximately 5,000 units of solar products, primarily small solar lamps with charging capabilities

loans.name: Althea

texts.en:
Althea has a strong background in fashion design. She completed her undergraduate fashion program in 2006, and then she attended the Art Institute School of Fashion Design where she graduated in 2010.

When Althea’s son was born, she desired a way to reflect on the outside how special he was on the inside. With her fashion design background, she was able to find designer clothes for her son and even created his own clothes.

She began receiving compliments on his wardrobe, and decided that this was an untapped market with extreme interest in her products, so she launched her business, Drummerboy Apparel, for the first time in 2011.

Drummerboy Apparel is an online clothing boutique for boys only, selling unique and fashionable items including shirts, pants, shoes, little boy’s bowties, and their unique products.

She has been operating this business on and off for the past four years, but it wasn’t until she completed the Accion Academy for Entrepreneurial Success business training that she had the confidence to once again launch her business.

Althea will use her Kiva loan for to purchase inventory to sell through her website. Previously she has made all her products herself, but in an effort to scale the business she will be supplementing her handmade goods with the inventory she will purchase.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell through her website

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is 32 years old. She is a refugee from the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. Arzu has a large family. Her family consists of three children, her husband and her parents-in-law. She is a farmer and her children are supporting her. She knows that she must work hard for her family's needs. For this she wakes up very early each morning and takes care of the animals like cattle and sheep in her yard. She fattens them and then sells their meat in the market. Arzu has 10 years' experience and that has made her a great expert in this field. Meat is in high demand in Azerbaijan. People like meat for traditional food like kufta, bozbash and kebabs. Arzu sells her animals' natural meat in the local bazaar. Her kids and husband also support her in daily activities. Currently she is planning to buy four calves and needs a 2,000 AZN loan. Hopefully KIVA lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida is a 39-year-old IDP from Bilasuvar region. She is married and lives with her two sons, two daughters and her husband in the refugee settlement. She grows vegetables and fruits in the yard of her family. She loves this job. Saida with support of her family, especially her husband is running quite a successful farming business. Her husband is a teacher at school but helps her with great passion. She has more than five years of experience. She relies for managing the farm on her children's support, who help her by watering, cleaning the yard and other related works. They support each other very well. Saida is running the farm with great passion and love, because she wants to take care of family. Saida sells fruits and vegetables in the local market. In Azerbaijan there is a great demand for vegetables to make traditional foods like dolma, bozbash and also fruits for after dinner deserts. She is currently planning to expand the business. She requires 2,000 AZN to buy new fruit trees and fertilizers for the vegetables.  She hopes that KIVA lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees and fertilizers for vegetables

loans.name: Latesha

texts.en:
The initials in Latesha’s business name, T.H.I.S. Apparel, stand for To Help Inspire Someone and that is exactly what she aims to do with her business. Latesha is a youth minster and her congregation was looking for an empowering apparel line that echoed their values, which led her to start her company.

Latesha graduated from Accion Academy Entrepreneurial Success program, which is an eight-week series of practical, hands-on training accompanied by one-on-one business counseling to help individuals to start businesses.

She comes into this business from a good deal of hardship, a phase in her life which she is actively working out of.

“I love to help people and put a smile on their face when they wear my clothing,” says Latesha.

Latesha plans to sell her product to her congregation and she understands how to promote, network, and engage with her consumers. She already has a strong relationship with some relevant figures in her community, who have committed to help her promote her product.

Latesha will start her business by selling her product online. She will use her loan to expand her inventory and market her business.

loans.use: to expand her inventory and market her business online.

loans.name: Etoile (Mc)

texts.en:
In the interview with Augustave, she stated: "Haitian women play a key role in the economy. Fighting against poverty normally passes through women's financial inclusion."

In fact, Augustave is a young Haitian nurse who put her career aside to launch her own business. By talking to her, one will clearly see that she is literate. Like many Zafen borrowers, she is leading a group of 24 women that are all retailers.

Thanks to Augustave's leadership, the neighborhood has built five drinking fountains and one cistern to provide drinking water for the whole community. That's why she turns to Zafen to apply for a loan to buy maintenance tools for the drinking fountains.

Augustave will use her profit to grow her small drinking water business and support her group as well.

The committee board is pictured as below:

Dieumise (far left) is the bookkeeper in the group.
Mikel-Angel (second from left) is the secretary.
Rodnet (third from left) works as an advisor.
Augustave wears a white shirt-dress.
Anne (right) is the treasurer.

loans.use: to buy tools to maintain their drinking fountains

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan is a 41-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She is married, energetic and hardworking and raises dozens of cows for a living. She knows that being a successful farmer in the rural area requires lots of dedication and expertise, and wants to expand her business so she has more meat to sell to clients in the local market to make traditional foods like kebabs. Natavan is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to buy four more cows.

loans.use: to buy four calves.

loans.name: Sriya's Group

texts.en:
Sriya and her family, including her parents and one son, belong to Anandpur in Odisha, India. She is a widow and takes care of her only son single handedly.

She has been contributing to the family's income through her goat rearing business for the past five years. Through this activity, Sriya earn just enough to manage her household expenses.

She started this activity with just one goat but over these two years increased the numbers to more than four. She has been earning by selling goat's milk and its kids at the local market.

Sriya now wishes to further expand the activity, to make it a major source of income to increase family's earnings. Therefore, she along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR.

She will use her portion of the loan amount to add more livestock to the business and grow her earnings to improve her family's financial conditions. Sriya is confident of returning the loan amount within its time frame from her profit earnings.

Your support will help Sriya improve her family's income and bring prosperity to her home. Sriya is standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to add more numbers of livestock to the business and grow her earnings

loans.name: Ratnabati's Group

texts.en:
Ratnabati, a differently abled lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph, hails from a village of Anandpur, Odisha, India. She and her husband grow vegetables in the small parcel of land they own.

She realised long ago that since it was a small parcel, growing traditional crops like wheat and paddy would not be profitable. She started growing vegetables and was rewarded with a rich harvest her first year.

But then, other problems emerged. As vegetables have a low shelf-life, and there being no cold storage facilities in the area, they are difficult to store. A sizable quantity of her produce was lost due to this reason.

But she has learnt her lesson from them since then. She has contacts with a network of traders and will be able to sell her produce faster. In addition to this, she also sells vegetables in the market at retail rates, earning a handsome profit.

Now that all systems are in place, Ratnabati is looking for ways to increase her yield. Therefore she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR.

Ratnabati will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in a high yielding variety of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides which will help in getting more out of her land.

loans.use: to invest in a high yielding variety of seeds, fertilisers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Manorama's Group

texts.en:
Manorama, 26, a differently abled lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph, has only been able to study up to the eighth standard. However, this has not stopped her from working hard to ensure a secure future for her husband and two sons. The family works and lives in Anandpur, Odisha, India.

Manorama’s husband runs a small hair salon. Their sons are too young for school now, but soon their expenses will certainly be increasing once the kids begin to go to school.

In order to be prepared for this scenario, Manorama would like to invest in a sewing machine. She is a skilled tailor, and is looking forward to start a small business from her home.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to pay for a sewing machine, a motor, and its stand, along with a few materials and fabric.

With good demand and next to no overhead costs, she is confident of bringing in good profits.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, a motor, and its stand, along with a few materials and fabric.

loans.name: Sabitri's Group

texts.en:
Sabitri, a divorcee standing to the left in the photograph, comes from a community where she was not allowed to complete her education due to a narrow mindset about women. This restricted her from doing any business on her own for a long time.

Even after her marriage, she couldn't support her husband financially and her family faced financial crisis due to lack of income from her husband’s farming work.

After her divorce, Sabitri became a brave woman and started doing dairy farming four years ago. She believes it is an easy business since she is familiar with animal husbandry, and there is limited technical or professional knowledge needed for this work.

But now, she wants to expand her business to earn more money for her household. To do that, she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum.

Sabitri will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase one more buffalo and sell more milk. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and sell more milk.

loans.name: Aytan

texts.en: Aytan is an 18-year-old Internally Displaced Person who lives in the Bilasuvar region. She is single and lives with her parents and three sibiligs in a refugee settlement. Her father and mother are retired and she earns a living by growing fruits and vegetables. She loves her job because she works in her yard and loves to see her crops grow, especially the healthy natural fruits and vegetables that she takes to the local bazaar to sell. Customers appreciate Aytan's hard work because she is very diligent, honest and kind towards her customers. She is also very smart and intelligent.  She is requesting 2,000 AZN to expand her business by buying fertilizers and new fruit trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and new fruit trees.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Чумагул настоящая дехканка. Она родилась и выросла на районе Хуросон в семье дехканов. Ее муж тоже дехканин. У него имеется четверых детей. Ее дети заботливые и самостоятельные. Они помогает родителям в работе. Чумагул занимается животноводческой деятельностью около 16 лет.  В протяжение 16 лет, Чумагул научилась много чего. Животноводческой деятельностью Чумагулу принесет хороший доход, но для этого она трудиться, не смотря ни на что. Еще она выращивает растение на земельный участок. Чумагул мечтает о расширения животноводческой деятельностью. Она хочет приобрести скота и увеличить их численность, путем увеличения численность скота увеличиться доход. Потом она сможет хорошо обеспечить семью. Чумагул надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Jumagul is a real farmer. She was born and grew up in the region of Khuroson, in a family of farmers. Her husband is also a farmer. They have 4 children, who are caring and independent. They help their parents in their work. Jumagul has worked in animal husbandry for around 16 years. Over the course of the last 16 years, Jumagul has learnt a lot of things. Jumagul's work in animal husbandry brings in a good income, but despite this it is hard work. She also grows crops on a plot of land. Jumagul dreams about expanding her work in animal husbandry. She wants to acquire cattle and increase her number, which in turn will increase her income. Later, she wants to provide well for her family. Jumagul hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to increase her number.

loans.name: Elgushe

texts.en:
Elgushe is 20 years old. She is an internally displaced person currently living in the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. Elgushe is living with her old parents. Currently she is planning to get married.

Elgushe is a farmer. She grows some vegetables and fruits. She works in her own backyard. She loves this job. She does it with great passion and joy. Her old parents also help her in daily farming activities. She appreciates their support and tries her best to meet the needs of the family.

She takes her harvest to the local market. People in the market who are Elgushe's clients like to do business with her because she is honest and her products are of very good quality. She supplies very healthy fresh fruits and vegetables.

In the local market there is a great demand for vegetables to be used in traditional dishes and for fruits, which people like to eat after meals for dessert. To meet the increasing demand, Elgushe is also planning to expand. She plans to buy some fertilizers and new fruit trees. She requires 2,000 AZN. Kiva lenders should help her.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers and new fruit trees

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram is a 27-year-old Internally Displaced Person who lives in the Bilasuvar settlement.  Six years ago, he started farming on a small piece of land he inherited in Bilasuvar. Now, this humble person and his son earn a living by selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. He also raises cows so his family can drink milk. He is a passionate farmer and, because of his immense knowledge of farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart, and every day he wakes up to milk his cow, and that makes him very proud. Although he makes profits by selling milk, he lacks a proper shelter for his cows and is seeking a loan to build one. This shelter will give his cows a place to live and also protect them from diseases that arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain and sun.  Bayram needs 1,200 AZN loan for this purpose.

loans.use: to build a shelter to protect his animals from diseases.

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en: Nahid is a 30-year-old Internally Displaced Person who lives in the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is married, has one daughter, and also supports his parents, who are retired. Nahid is a farmer who earns a living by raising four cows and six sheep in his yard. He loves this job and is a very passionate and honest man. People like to do business with him because he is so nice as well as very frank and honest. Clients also appreciate the fact that he supplies fresh, natural, and very healthy meat. In Azerbaijan most of the families consume more than 10 -15 kgs meat per month, and these numbers are increasing because so many traditional dishes are made with meat. Nahid wants to expand his business so he can improve his family's living conditions and is requesting a 1,200 AZN to buy three calves so he can fatten them and sell their meat. His family will also be able to drink some of the milk they produce.

loans.use: to buy three calves, raise them and sell their meat.

loans.name: Linyon

texts.en:
Many Haitian children in the poor areas suffer health problems related to lack of vitamins. Hermana is a young lady who manufactures peanut butter and guava to sell to families. Recently, she helped some kids find shoes to go to school.

Hermana is also involved in community. She leads a savings group. Last year, her group generated $900 over nine months. She now would like to find more money to buy decoration materials to retail for Christmas.

Thus, she turns to Zafen for a loan with the agreement of the committee board of her group. The picture description is as below:

Jean is the deputy president (far left).
Hermana is the secretary (middle).
Jeudy is a treasurer.

loans.use: to purchase decoration materials to retail.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is a 25-year-old man who is an Internally Displaced Person. He lives in a refugee settlement with his family and earns a living by repairing cars. He is an energetic and passionate man who likes his work and has become an expert by using the Internet to learn new methods of repairing different parts of automobiles. Customers like him because he is honest and trustworthy. Nowadays demand for his services is increasing because more people have started owning cars To meet this demand, he a requesting a loan for 1,200 AZN loan to buy more tools and equipment.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment so he can work more efficiently.

loans.name: Jayanti's Group

texts.en:
Jayanti hails from a low income household from an interior village in Aanandpur, Odisha, India. She is a married lady living with her three daughters. The lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Jayanti. Jayanti has struggled a lot in her life in order to sustain herself and her family. She is a lady with sheer determination and strong willpower. A lack of financial resources has never allowed her to build a hygienic toilet at her home and get access to basic sanitary facilities. This has compelled her and her family to walk long distances in odd hours in order to defecate and urinate. This practice is not safe and feasible in the long run and she feels that her privacy is being hampered.

Therefore, Jayanti along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it. The loan amount will help her to get access to basic sanitation facilities and thereby improve the health of her family.

Jayanti is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting your kind support.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: Alfaqa

texts.en:
Alfaqa is 46 years old. He is a refugee living in the refugee settlement called Bilasuvar in the southern part of the country. He resides with his family, like his father and mother.

Alfaqa has a college education and uses this knowledge in daily farming activities. He has studied agricultural subjects. To provide good income for his family, he is involved in agriculture. Alfaqa started his business 10 years ago and has good experience in it. He has 6 cows and 14 sheep. He raises calves, fattens them and then takes their meat to the local bazaar. He keeps these animals on his own land.

There is a big demand for meat in Azerbaijan. People consume a lot of meat. Most of the traditional dishes like kebabs, kufta and rice consist of meat.

Alfaqa has requested a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale. Alfaqa intends to channel his earnings toward developing his business and improving family conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Makena Single Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ann. She is  a member of Makena single mothers  group in Nakuru. She is married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa in June 2014.
Ann  does maize, beans and poultry. She is grateful to HIH EA for enterprise training and inculcating in her a culture of saving. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase chicken feeds and fertilizers. She hopes to satisfy customers demand for chicken meat and earn more income from her poultry enterprise. Through the income, she will cater for her family needs such as food and save for her old age.
Ann is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and fertilizer that will boost output, thus for more income.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is a 22-year-old refugee from Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He is a very diligent and honest man. People know him as a trustworthy person. He is taking care of his family. He helps his old parents who are retirees.

Vidadi is a highly motivated farmer who's been able to get his business idea ahead through effort and dedication. Sometimes his parents come and support him in the yard for farming activities. For the last six years, and with the goal of generating more income, he has been doing farming activities like growing vegetables and fruits. He sells them in the local bazaar and to clients in the neighbourhood. Vidadi displays his products in a shop located in the bazaar close to his home.

He is now applying for a 1,200 AZN loan for expanding his business activity. With the growing demand for fruits, vegetables, he needs to expand as well. He will uses the funds to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees to meet growing demand for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Ее зовут Шахло. Ей 41 год. Шахло разведена с мужем и воспитывает троих детей одна. Она добрая и понимающая женщина. Для нее главное это образование здоровье и счастье детей - вот эти главные вещи ради чего она живет. Дочка Шахло поступила в Университет. Она очень тянется к знаниям и имеет большие способности в науке. Шахло конечно поддерживает свою дочь. Но так как ее обучение является платной Шахло не денег на обучения своего ребенка. Но она не позволит, чтобы ее дочь отказалась от своей мечты и обращается за кредитом.
texts.en: Her name is Shahlo. She is 41 years old. Shahlo is divorced from her husband and raising three children by herself. She is a kind and understanding woman. The main things for her are the health and happiness of her children - these are the main reasons she lives for. Shahlo's daughter was just accepted to a university. She strives toward knowledge and has good capabilities in science. Shahlo, of course, supports her daughter, but because paying tuition is involved, Shahlo does not have money to pay for education. However, she will not allow her daughter to walk away from her dream and requested this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Kikore Tazara Group

texts.en:
Gervas, who is in his late 30's, is married with 3 school-going children. He has been running a butcher business for 10 years now. He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Gervas' first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use his loan portion to add another butcher and increase his stock of meat so he can meet his customers' requirements.

Gervas dreams of expanding his butcher business to an international level, with an electric cutter and a location where meat can be stored.

Gervas will share this loan with his loan group Kikore which has 4 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to add another butcher and increase his stock of meat.

loans.name: Meriki

texts.en:
Meriki is 28 years old, single and has one kid. He has been running a motorcycle transport business for four years now. He works from 10 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Meriki's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to service his motorcycle to avoid mechanical problems and has managed to repay his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for the support of their group. He used the profit to take care of his kid, to repay the loan, to pay rent and bought a radio set and fridge. He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He has a dream to buy a Bajaji (motorcycle).

Meriki will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Saidkadam

texts.ru: 26 летный молодой начинающий бизнесмен Саидкадам. Он житель района Хуросон. Ему родителям 87 и 85 лет. Жене 22 года и детям 7 и 8 лет. Саидкадам активный и добродушный парень. Он хочет начать свой новый бизнес. Саидкадам решил взять кредит для закупа молодых телят и корм для скота. Он решил заниматься животноводством. Саидкадам хочет продвигать деятельность родителей. Потому что от дохода животноводческой деятельности обеспечивал семью. Саидкадам не хочет потерять источник доход родителей. С такими планами он просит кредит. Поддержите его достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Saidkadam is a 26-year-old young, starting businessman. He is a resident of the Khuroson district. His parents are 87 and 85 years old. His wife is 22 years old, and children are 7 and 8. Saidkadam is an active and kindhearted young man. He wants to start a new business. He decided to obtain a loan to buy young calves and livestock feed. He wants to get involved in animal husbandry. Saidkadam wants to advance his parents' business because he uses the income from the animal husbandry business to support the family. Saidkadam does not want to lose the parents' income source. He is requesting this loan to achieve this goal. Please support him in achieving his goal.

loans.use: to buy young calves and livestock feed

loans.name: Ulan

texts.ru: Улан, 36 лет, женат, отец двоих сыновей - школьников. Образование у Улана среднее. Он работает водителем по перевозке пассажиров на предприятии. Также занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря своему трудолюбию, целеустремленности и ответственности, Улан на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее хозяйство: 2 коровы, а также обрабатывает 3,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой ежегодно сажает клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль семьи, в том числе от заработной платы составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Улан обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Улан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ulan is 36 years old, married and a father of two sons - school students. Ulan has a secondary education. He works as a driver, transporting passengers to factories. He is also involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to his hard work, drive and responsibility, today Ulan has a good farm, containing 2 cows and 3.0 hectares of irrigated land, where he annually plants clover. His family's monthly profit, inclusive of salary, amounts to about 22,000 som (KGS). To continue developing his business, Ulan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy horses in order to increase his livestock headcount. Ulan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing his business and repairing his house.

loans.use: to buy horses in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abbas is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Abbas would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abbas will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abbas now has the opportunity to actualize his dream, which is to grow his agricultural business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Terence

texts.en:
Terence’s company, Rumble Bros Boxing and Supply Co., sells original sporting goods and apparel showcasing the sport of boxing. Terence started his company after being an amateur boxer for many years. He noticed that there were areas in which the current line of boxing supplies and products could be improved. Based on this need, he developed Rumble Bros Boxing Supply Co. to improve the current products and make the sport better.

Terence was on active military duty from 2005 to 2012 in the medical field. He is currently getting his degree in Business Administration from DeVry University, while raising his son. Terence has experience in managing a business by helping start a clothing line that gave part of their proceeds to charity.

Terence will use his Kiva loan to continue the startup process of the business. He will purchase inventory so that he can began to sell online.

Rumble Bros Boxing Supply Co. will operate online to start, in an effort to reach a wider audience. Being that Terence works a full-time job as a mortgage processor, he will be able to run his business online at all times, but hopes to later open up a specialty shop with a storefront.

loans.use: to pay for inventory to start his boxing apparel and accessories business.

loans.name: Ombeni

texts.en:
Ombeni, who is in his late 30s, is single with four children. One child is still small and the other three are still in school.  He has been selling animals for twelve years now.  He works from 6 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Ombeni's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on cows, goats, chicks and chicken feeds and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees for his children, repay the loan, reinvest in his business and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy cows, goats, chicks, and chicken and animal feeds.  He dreams of owning a hotel.

Ombeni will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats, chicks, and chicken and animal feeds

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Tania continúa dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales en especial pollos. En este negocio va muchos años y le va bien, por eso quiere mejorara su negocio y necesita comprar alimentos para pollos, con el fin de expenderlo en el mercado.
La socia Tania solicito el préstamo para comprar  maíz , para poder alimentar a sus pollos y seguir produciendo más.
La socia está contenta y agradecida con el crédito que le otorgo los inversionistas KIVA.
texts.en:
Tania is continuing to work at her business of raising animals, especially chickens. She has been doing this for many years, and it is going well. Thus, wanting to improve her business, she needs to buy food for the chickens, with the goal of selling them in the market.

Tania is asking for the loan to buy corn to be able to feed the chickens and continue producing more.

Tania is pleased and thankful for the loan from the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy corn to feed her chickens

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is a 34 year old man. He is a refugee. He lives in Bilasuvar, which is in the southern part of Azerbaijan and has a large IDP (Internationally Displaced Persons) settlement. He lives with his family, which consists of a daughter and 2 sons along with his wife, in a small community of refugees, in one of the largest refugee provinces of Azerbaijan. This is a zone that is number one in the national production of fruits and vegetables. It also produces staple grains (rice, beans, corn), including root vegetables and garden vegetables.

For a few months now, Yurik has needed some type of financing to buy seeds and cultivate suitable land for this type of product. With this activity, he will be able to earn more and improve his quality of life. For this reason, Yurik is requesting a loan of AZN 1,200. He wants to buy seeds to grow fruits and fertilizers to obtain a good harvest. Yurik is a member of a farmers club in Bilasuvar and this loan will help him to improve the living conditions. KIVA lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow fruits and fertilizers to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes continúa con su negocio de confección de cortinas, el crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando tela por rollo, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque tuvo buenas ventas. actualmente la demanda aumento por época de fin de año donde los comercios mejoran sus ambientes para mejorar su ventas, Su negocio se especializa en la confección de cortinas estándar y a medida, las estándar las confecciona para vender a tiendas y otros comercios, no siempre entran a cabalidad en la ventana porque las ventanas son de todo tamaño, también las confecciona a medida y esas son a encargo, “generalmente el hueco de ventana, balcón o terraza, sobrepasa las dimensiones estándar, otra opción es comprar una cortina a medida, pero estas son más caras...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor y por encargo, la desventaja es la competencia con precios rebajados. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de cortinas, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial y tela por rollo. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mercedes solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial y tela por rollo para confeccionar cortinas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is continuing with her business of curtain-making. She invested the loan that she received in the purchase of fabric by the roll; the payment of her installments was punctual because she had good sales.

Currently the demand has increased due to the arrival of the end of the year, when businesses improve their atmosphere to improve their sales. He business specializes in curtain-making, both standard and custom-fitted. She makes the standard ones to sell to stores and other businesses, but they don't always fit the window perfectly because the windows are of all sizes. She also makes custom-fitted curtains and these are to order. "Generally the opening of the window, balcony, or terrace exceeds the standard dimensions. The other option is to buy a custom-fitted curtain, but these are more expensive..." she comments.

The advantage of her business is that she sells both wholesale and by order. The disadvantage is the competition with sale prices. Her dream is to open a curtain store. She hopes to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabric by the roll. This is her second sequence of loans with the institution in the 13 years that she has done this work.

It is for these reasons that Mercedes is seeking a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabric by the roll to manufacture curtains.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabric by the roll to make curtains.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella es costurera, y de esa manera se esfuerza para poder tener los medios para solventar sus estudios. Ella estudia la carrera de contabilidad y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino para ser una profesional útil.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fabiana is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is a dressmaker and in this way puts in the effort to be able to have the means to pay for her studies. She is studying accounting, and through her studies she wishes to make her way towards becoming a useful professional.

Fabiana is requesting this loan to be able to buy the supplies she needs for university and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for university

loans.name: Chanchala's Group

texts.en:
Darkness looms with the setting sun in several households in remote parts of India. Chanchala lives in Aanandpur village in Odisha, India. Apart from power outages through the day, there are often several hours in the evenings when the households need to make do with the light from a dim kerosene lamp. Kerosene lamps give out toxic fumes, cause eye problems, and moreover, they are fire hazards. Kerosene is an expensive fuel as well. In order to cut down expenses on kerosene and choose a cheaper, cleaner energy source, Chanchala through her wit and intelligence started making candles and supplying it to the houses in the locality.

Soon her business took a rise as it was hugely adopted by the residents of her locality in order to overcome the problems of erratic power supply.

Chanchala is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples forum to repair her candle-making machine and purchase wax and other raw materials in bulk so that she can increase the level of her output.

Chanchala, a widow,is standing on the left hand side of the photograph and is awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to repair her candle making machine and purchase wax and other raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil was born in 1983. He is a refugee. He is living in Bilasuvar refugee settlement. Kamil lives with his family in a village and he has one son and two daughters. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 7 years. He mainly feeds sheep and goats. He has great experience in this field. Because his parents has been doing this activity over the years and he has been both helping them and observing. In this way he has gained vast knowledge and experience. Kamil's brother and sister help him with feeding sheep and goats. He buys lambs and goats, feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. He lives in the village near to the local bazaar. He bring the meat to the local market and meets the great demand for meat. Currently he is planning to buy 10 sheep. He needs AZN 1,200. KIVA lenders should support. him.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for selling meat

loans.name: Shamshir

texts.en:
Shamshir is 24 years old. He is a very young and passionate person. Shamshir is an IDP (Internationally Displaced Person) from Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is living with his family and takes cares of parents and also his younger siblings. At this young age he knows that he has great responsibilities. He is a farmer and people in his neighborhood call him a young farmer. He is very diligent and he knows that success requires dedication.

Shamshir grows wheat. He enjoys providing more natural products to people. Being a refugee and from the region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him an advantage in the local market. He is familiar with the locals and knows the peoples' needs and demands. In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat. Many people in rural areas bake their own bread and make pastries and cakes at home. Shamshir has another advantage because people know him as an honest person who sells natural wheat. Currently he is planning to buy more fertilizers for this and he needs AZN 1,200. Hopefully KIVA lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to increase efficiency of his farming

loans.name: Ayushmita's Group

texts.en:
Ayushmita, standing to the right, is a single mother and hails from Aanandpur, Odisha, India. She is a blessed mother with two children. Her daughter attends school and her son is involved in a stitching business. Ayushmita has been doing hand embroidery work for many years. She makes beautiful patterns on saree ends and dupattas for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she earns enough through her skill to meet the expenses of her family.

Due to the high cost of the raw materials of her business, she is facing a shortage of material and she is unable to purchase expensive raw material to carry on her embroidery business. To help her to continue her operations, she along with her group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. Ayushmita will use her portion of the loan amount to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, stones, ribbons, fabrics etc. for her business. With this purchase, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful that she will increase her income by attracting more customers.

She conveys her heartiest thanks to her lenders .

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, stones, ribbons, fabrics etc

loans.name: Janina

texts.es:
Janina está cursando el 2do año de Administración de Empresas, tiene 20 años, ella desea terminar sus estudios para ayudar a sus familiares.
Ella quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así como destacarse como una excelente profesional en el área.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Janina is in second year of Business Administration. She is 20 years old. She wants to finish her studies to help her family.

She wants to improve her family's living conditions, and become an excellent professional in her area.

She is requesting a loan to pay the university fees and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 20 years old and a refugee.  He is single, and he lives with his elderly parents and two sisters in refugee settlement called Bilasuvar in southern Azerbaijan. Vusal is young and energetic, and he finished high school two years ago. 

Currently he is a farmer. He grows vegetables and fruits in his yard. Besides farming activities, he is also preparing for college studies. 

After three or four years he wants to continue his education in agricultural sciences. He believes that being involved daily in cultivating fruits and vegetables gives him practical experience. 

He has a good reputation in the local market. Clients are satisfied with him for his honesty, and they like his delicious and natural fruits and vegetables. There is a high demand for natural goods in Azerbaijan. This gives him an advantage. 

Vusal is planning to expand.  He want to buy new fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers. He needs 1,200 AZN and is thankful for every Kiva lender.

loans.use: to buy new fruit  trees, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Royal

texts.en:
Royal is 24 years old. He is a very young and passionate person. Royal is an IDP from the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is living with his family and takes cares of his parents and also his younger siblings. At this young age he knows that he has great responsibilities towards his family and brother and sister.

He has been a farmer for more than 6 years, and the people in his neighborhood call him a young farmer. He is very diligent. He grows some wheat. He knows that success requires dedication. Royal likes to provide more natural products to people. Being a refugee from a region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him an advantage in the local market. He is more familiar with the local area and knows the peoples' needs and demands.

In Azerbaijan, people consume a lot of wheat just like rural area people do, and they bake their own bread and make pastries and cakes at home. Royal has an advantage, because people know him as an honest person, who sells natural wheat. Currently, he is planning to buy more fertilizers, for which he needs 1200 AZN. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 42 years old. He is a very energetic man and already knows more about the difficulties of life. He is a person who was born into a refugee family and lives in the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is living with his family, which consists of a wife and three children. His mother and father also need his support because they are very old.

He is a farmer. He grows some vegetables and fruits. He loves his farming business, because he and his clients respect each other mutually. He brings his natural, delicious fruits and vegetables to the bazaar. In Azerbaijan, people consume a lot of fruits as dessert after their meals. With the increasing demand, Ali is also looking forward to expanding. He is planning to plant more fruit trees and grow some other vegetables.

Ali is a very trustworthy person. People respect him for his principles in the market. He plans to grow his business. He needs a 1200 AZN loan to buy new fruit trees, fertilizers and seeds. Kiva lenders should kindly support him.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, cursando actualmente el cuarto año, comenta que sus padres siempre la ayudan en todo para que pueda seguir con sus estudios.
A la vez que estudia también trabaja, el cual es su medio de obtener los ingresos para poder solventar sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de la universidad, como materiales y cuotas.
texts.en:
Ana is from the city of Pilar. She is now in her fourth year studying business administration. She says that her parents always help her in everything so that she can continue with her studies.

At the same time that she is studying, she is also working, which is her way of obtaining income to be able to pay for her studies.

Ana is asking for this loan to be able to pay for university expenses such as materials and fees.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses, such as materials and fees

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida es de la ciudad e Coronel Oviedo, es madre de dos hijos, trabaja en una serigrafía como costurera como un medio para tener los medios para poder dar a sus hijos una vida digna.
Está estudiando la carrera de criminalística, tiene como meta graduarse y desempeñase en su profesión; ser un profesional reconocido en su carrera, así poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lida is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is the mother of two children, and works for a screen printer, as a seamstress. This job helps her to find the means to give her children a dignified life.

She is studying Criminology. Her goal is to graduate, work as a professional in her area, and become a well-known criminologist, in order to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy school supplies and be able to continue studying as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 25 años, es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, comenta que su sueño es ayudar a los más necesitados y cumplir sus metas para llegar a ser alguien en la vida.
Pone todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is from the city of Paraguarí. She is 25 years old and studies Nursing. She says that her dream is to help those in need, and achieve her goals to become someone in life.

She gives her best to improve her and her family's living conditions. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing.

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees, in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has two children.

Alexander sells good quality leather shoes. He is a hardworking and open person.

Alexander is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase men's shoes for the winter season. The loan will help to increase the assortment of goods to earn a bigger income.

loans.use: to purchase men's shoes for the winter season.

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is a 28-year-old man. He is a refugee. He lives in Bilasuvar, which is in the south part of Azerbaijan and has a large IDP settlement. He lives with his family, which consists of a daughter and two sons along with his wife, in a small community of refugees, in one of the largest refugee provinces of Azerbaijan. This is a zone that is number one in the national production of fruits and vegetables. It also produces staple grains (rice, beans, corn), root vegetables and garden vegetables.

For a few months now, Sanan has needed some type of financing to buy seeds and cultivate suitable land for this type of product. With this activity, he will be able to earn more and improve his quality of life. For this reason, Sanan is requesting a loan of 1200 AZN. He wants to buy seeds to grow fruits and fertilizers to obtain a good harvest. Sanan is a member of the farmers club in Bilasuvar, and this loan will help him to improve his living conditions. Kiva lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow fruits and fertilizers to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco estudia la carrera de contabilidad, está en el segundo año, comenta que su meta es ser un buen profesional, y tener su propia empresa.
Comenta que se está esforzando mucho para poder lograr sus sueños, y quiere poder ayudar también a su familia a través de su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y cubrir otros gastos de universidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is studying accounting. He is in his second year. He says that his goal is to be a good professional and to have his own company.

He says he is making a great effort to achieve his dreams, and he also wants to be able to help his family through his career.

He requests this loan in order to be able to pay his tuition and cover other university expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition and other university expenses.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is 21 years old and a refugee who lost his home in the war.  His parents now live in the Bilasuvar refugee settlement, and  Mahammad is now helping his parents. 

At his age he has taken on great responsibility. He has become an independent small farmer. Like many other farmers in the Bilasuvar refugee settlement, he raises cattle and sheep. He has four years of experience. 

He knows that taking care of animals requires great dedication. But he is very fond of his job and does it with great love and passion. He feeds them daily and uses their milk for household use and sells their meat in the local market.  He buys few calves, fattens them and then takes their meat to the market. 

He is very honest in business transactions because he knows honesty is the key for success in business. His clients call him an honest young farmer. 

Mahammad is planning to expand his business and in the future to study at college. Now he needs a  loan of 1,200 AZN to buy three calves. This will help him to earn more income. Kiva lenders should show him kindness.

loans.use: to buy three calves to fatten for the market

loans.name: Cavid

texts.en:
Cavid  is 27 years old and a refugee. Cavid is married, and he lives with his elderly parents, one son, and his wife in refugee settlement called Bilasuvar in southern Azerbaijan. Cavid is young and energetic.  He has finished his high school education and has a  two-year degree at the college for agricultural development. 

Currently he is a farmer. He grows vegetables and fruits in his yard. He is intelligent and helpful person. He believes that being involved daily in cultivating fruits and vegetables gives him practical experience. 

He is a respected seller in the bazaar. People like to do business with him for his correct principles. Clients are satisfied with his honesty and the delicious natural fruits and vegetables that brings to market. There is a high demand for natural goods like delicious fruits because they are eaten after meals in Azerbaijan. This gives him an advantage.

Currently Cavid is planning to expand. He want to buy new fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers. He needs a  loan of 1,200 AZN, and he is thankful for every Kiva lender.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es: Verónica  tiene 19  años de edad, es de estado civil unión libre, su esposo se dedica al jornal, tiene una hija de un año de edad, ella es una persona muy responsable, se dedica hace 2 años a la venta de comidas rápidas en un sector de su localidad, esta actividad  le ha dado  muy buenos resultados económicos, Verónica solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio de comidas rápidas  y así obtener ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con algunos gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Verónica is 19 years old. She is in a civil union. Her husband is a day worker and she has a one year old daughter. She is a very responsible person. For the last 2 years she has sold fast food in her town. She has had very good financial results from this. Verónica is seeking the loan to grow her fast food business and earn the income to keep covering her household expenses.

loans.use: to grow her fast food business.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abdu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all of his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer from Maidawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Yahuza is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yahuza can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yahuza no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Yahuza hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Geovanni Miguel

texts.es: Geovanni es un albañil por profesión con gran experiencia en el campo que decidió de la mano de una sobrina emprender su propio negocio de comidas rápidas, idea de negocio que surgió al ver potencial por la afluencia de personas que transitan en una calle principal del barrio donde reside al sur de Barranquilla. En cuanto consiguieron el capital para dar inició a su proyecto no tardaron mucho en instalar el puesto de comidas en ese mismo lugar con magníficos resultados. Todos los jueves, viernes, sábados y domingos su clientela degusta de deliciosos perros, hamburguesas, asados, salchipapas, pinchos, desgranados, entre otros, a excelentes precios y calidad.  Hoy en día llevan siete años de funcionamiento y su carro está un poco deteriorado es por ello que Geovanni realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para reparar el carro de comidas y comprar insumos y materias primas; bolsas de papas, vegetales, carnes frías,  panes, carne de res y cerdo. Él se proyecta con mejoras en sus ventas a raíz de la inversión que va a realizar y más cerca de su meta de comprar vivienda.
texts.en:
Geovanni is a very experienced mason who took the advice of a niece and decided to start his own fast food activity. She came up with this idea because of the high number of people passing along the main street of the neighborhood where they live, in southern Barranquilla. Once they got the money they needed to start their project, they almost immediately set up the food stall in that same area, obtaining great results. On Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays their customer can enjoy tasty hot dogs, hamburgers, roast beefs, salchipapas, pinchos and chuzos desgranados*, as well as other products, paying good prices for an excellent quality. They have been engaging in this activity for sever years, and their cart is a bit worn. For this reason, Geovanni saw a chance to enter the financial world and requested a loan to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to repair his cart and to buy ingredients such as bags of potatoes, vegetables, lunch meats, bread, steaks and pork. He imagines he will increase his sales thanks to the loan he is requesting, and consequently getting closet to his goal: buying his own house.

*= Barranquilla's traditional dishes.

loans.use: repair his cart and to buy ingredients such as bags of potatoes, vegetables, lunch meats, bread, steaks and pork.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera sells women's shoes and clothes at the market. From the previous Kiva loan, she purchased clothes for the summer season. Vera is an active and hardworking person. She plans to develop her business further.

Vera is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase shoes and clothes for the winter season. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of goods and receive additional income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married. She has three adult children. Svetlana lives together with her husband. She has her own business.

Svetlana has been selling men's clothes at the market for 25 years. She rents three retail places. Svetlana is a very active and hardworking person. She plans to develop her business further. Additional income will help her to pay for her husband's treatment; he is disabled.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase women's shoes and increase the assortment of men's clothes. Because of the war, sales of men's clothes decreased. Svetlana decided to add women's shoes for the winter season to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes and increase the assortment of men's clothes

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is 17 years old.  He is very young and passionate. Shahin is an internal displaced person from the Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He lives with his family and takes cares of his parents and also his younger siblings. 

At his young age he knows that he has great responsibilities. He just recently finished high school with excellent grades. Now he is planning to study at the university in the city. He must go to Baku, capital of Azerbaijan, and start his studies. He is planning to become a doctor. 

Unfortunately he needs to pay school fees, but he doesn't have any funds. His family's income from daily farming is only enough for family needs. 

Shahin is very eager for a university education. He wants to make himself a career and make his family and circle of relatives and friends proud of him. He needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to pay school fees. He is hoping that Kiva lenders will show him great kindness and give him an opportunity for education.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda continua con sus estudios, poniendo su mayor esfuerzo y de esa forma ser una buena psicóloga, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para el pago de sus clases, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le permitirá poder seguir luchando y creciendo.
texts.en: Amanda continues with her studies, making her best effort so she can be a good psychologist. She says that she used her previous loan to pay for her classes, which was a lot of help to her to be able to continue with her studies. She is asking for this new loan today to be able to invest in paying the fees for her degree, which will allow her to keep striving and growing.

loans.use: to pay for university fees

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is 18 years old. He is young and optimistic about his future. Nizami was born into a refugee family, and he lives in Bilasuvar refugee settlement with his family. His mother and father love him a lot, and he has two brothers younger than him. 

At this young age he knows that many responsibilities have fallen on his shoulders. He just recently finished high school with great scores. Now it is time for him to start university education. Nizami is very interested in the history of his homeland, which is currently under occupation. He wants to study history and contribute to his people like refugees by writing articles and books about their history. 

He needs go to Baku, capital of Azerbaijan, and start his studies. He is planning to be a historian. But education fees are a burden for him and his family. He must pay school fees, but he doesn't have the required funds. His family's income from daily farming is only enough for family needs. 

Nizami is passionate about a university education. This is a great opportunity for him to make his career.  He needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to pay school fees. He is hoping that Kiva lenders will show him great kindness and give him an opportunity for education.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Mahmanazar

texts.ru: Замечательный мужчина Махманазар. Ему 43 лет. Он житель района Хуросон. Махманазар начинающий бизнесмен. Его брат занимается торговлей деятельностью. Махманазар работал с братом и помогал ему в работе. Он сейчас освоил все навыки торговлей деятельностью и решил открыть свой собственный магазин.
