Махманазар решил за счет кредита заполнить свой магазин с продукт питаниями и скорее начать новый деятельность. Для закупа продукт питания ему требуется финансы. С такими планами Махманазар с большими надеждами обратился за кредитом. Поддержите его открыть свой магазин по продаже продукт питания.
texts.en:
Mahmanazar is an admirable man.  He is 43 years old and a resident of the Khuroson district of Tajikistan.  He is also an aspiring businessman.  His brother works in retail, and Mahmanazar used to help him with his business.  He has now mastered all the skills necessary to work in retail and has decided to open his own shop.

Mahmanazar has decided to use his loan to fill his shop with food products and to start his own business as soon as possible.  However, he needs financial help to purchase food products, so with this goal in mind, he is taking a loan.  As Mahmanazar is placing all his hopes in this loan, he needs your support  to open his grocery shop: please help him.

loans.use: to buy food products to open a new store.

loans.name: Nency Roxana

texts.es: Nency es una mujer de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 5 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Ella muestra cada día su tenacidad en su negocio de venta de tortillas, además cuenta con una pequeña granja en la que cría pollos, los cuales vende en su vivienda. Nency desea invertir en maíz por mayor para obtener mejores ganancias, además desea comprar más pollos, ya que en la época navideña la demanda de productos crece, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz por mayor para tortillas y más pollos para su granja y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nency, 28, lives with her life companion and her three children, 12, 10 and 5, who are studying. Every day, she shows her tenacity in her tortilla sales business. In addition, she has a small coop where she raises chickens, which she sells out of her house.

Nency wants to invest in wholesale corn in order to get better earnings. In addition, she wants to buy more chickens, since during the Christmas season the demand for products increases. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wholesale corn for tortillas and more chickens for her coop, and in this way to improve her income.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale corn for tortillas and more chickens for her coop, and in this way to improve her income.

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.en:
Salimjon was born in 1956 year and is married with 2 children who are adults. Salimjon lives with his family in North Tajikistan. Salimjon has worked in a factory for more than 7 years. He is hardworking man and does his job well.

Salimjon recently had surgery and now he must to reestablish his health. Salimjon is asking for a loan of 5500 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora cuenta con 65 años de edad y vive con su grupo familiar y su nieta de 17 años de edad a la que cuida con mucho cariño, ya que es su mayor alegría. Ella es una mujer admirable que se dedica a la venta de platos típicos para sostener la economía de su hogar. La vivienda de Dora es muy humilde y sencilla, ya que está hecha de lámina, pero además es bastante pequeña, por lo que ella desea construir un cuarto para ampliarla y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir un cuarto de lámina que le permita ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 65 years old. She lives with her family and her 17 year old grand-daughter whom she looks after with much affection, since she is her greatest joy. She is an admirable woman who sells typical dishes to support her household.

Dora's home is very humble and simple. It is made of sheet metal, but it is also very small, which is why she wishes to build a room to make it bigger. To this end she is requesting a FUSAI loan to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to build a room of sheet metal that will enable her to make her house bigger.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to build a sheet metal room which will enable her to make her house bigger.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 52 years old and is from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite. She is married to Ronaldo, a lawyer. She is glad that she has learned about the noble cause of Kiva through her membership with CCT.

She thought of going into a direct selling business to earn extra income to be able to help her less fortunate relatives. There is now an increased awareness and consciousness of the importance of taking care of our health. So she decided to become a distributor and dealer of natural health drinks.

To meet the advanced and increasing orders of her customers, she is requesting a PHP 51,000 loan to buy several boxes of "guyabano" (soursop) juice, tea and other natural health drinks. A dealer is entitled to an outright 25% discount from all her products. Her pleasant and friendly personality has earned her regular customers, and she has been referred by most of her clients.

Ailyn trusts that she will reap the fruits of her labor and someday produce and manufacture the health drink herself. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several boxes of "guyabano" (soursop) juice and tea and other natural vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a farm where he grows fruits, vegetables and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be Inadequate Working Capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en: Rodalyn 27 years old, married and had two children. She involved herself in food selling business as source of her income. She wanted to sell more products so she is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy eggs, cooking oil, flour and rice to sell. This will help increase her sales and sell more delicious foods and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cooking oil, flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Melba Odila

texts.es: Melba tiene 33 años, de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos, Magali de 12  y Cristian de 7 años, están estudiando en una escuela cerca de su localidad, ella es una persona tranquila y optimista en su trabajo, ella se dedica a la producción  de leche, Melba empezó en este negocio  hace 5 años atrás transformándose en fuente de ingresos que ayuda alimentar a sus hijos sin descuidarlos. Ella necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca de leche, así podría obtener más ingresos para poder seguir ayudando y cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Melba is 33 years old and single. She has two children, 12-year-old Magali and 7-year-old Cristian. They attend a local school that's in the vicinity. Melba is a laid-back and optimistic person in her line of work. She works in milk production. Melba got her start in this business five years ago and it became a source of income which helps her to feed her children without neglecting them. She needs the loan in order to purchase a dairy cow. That way she'll be able to turn a better proft so that she can continue to support and afford her children's food and education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Thomas has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Thomas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Thomas can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Thomas will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Thomas is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Это мужчина Умедчон. Ему 30 лет. Он из района Хуросон. Умедчон семейный человек. У него имеется 4 и 2 летные детишки. Его жена занимается растениеводством. На районе Хуросон все трудолюбивые и активные жители. Они всегда ищут что-то новое и трудиться. Умедчон один из тех жителей. Он не может сидеть без дел. Умедчон хочет трудиться и имеет собственный и постоянный источник доход. Он имеет большой коровник во дворе, и решил заниматься животноводством. Умедчон уверенный человек, у него такой характер, если он сделает что-то и занимается до конца. У Умедчон есть семья и ему надо их покормить и одевать. Он хочет приобрести пару голов скота и начать бизнес. Для купли скота у него нет денег. С такими планами Умедчон просит Вас дать ему кредит.
texts.en:
Umedjon is 30 and he comes from the Khuroson district of Tajikistan.  He is the father of two children, a 4-year-old and a 2-year-old.  His wife works in crop farming.  The residents of the Khuroson district are all hardworking and dynamic people who always look for new opportunities and are not afraid of labor. Umedjon is one of those people: he can't stay without doing anything.

Umedjon wants to get to work and have a stable source of income.  He owns a large stable next to his house, so he has decided to get involved in animal husbandry.  By nature he is a very confident man and someone who, once he has started a project, takes it to completion.  He has a family, whom he needs to feed and clothe.  He wants to buy a couple head of cattle and start his own business.  However, he doesn't have enough money to buy cattle, so he is turning to you to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy a couple head of cattle and start his own business.

loans.name: Narcilita

texts.en:
Narcilita works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Narcilita requested a PHP 5400 loan through NWTF to buy a sanitary toilet

She is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to avoid future health problem for the spreed of diseases if she cannot implement the sanitation and hygiene in the family.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, sand and gravels, cement, etc for the construction of her sanitary toilet

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 38 years old and married with seven children. With six children in school, Marife works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Marife has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, oil, coffee, sugar and other groceries.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Adelina

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora de 58 años de edad que luego de la pérdida de su esposo, puso todo su esfuerzo para sacar adelante a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad y le apoyan económicamente, el hijo mayor de María tuvo que emigrar al extranjero para apoyar a sus hijos, los cuales viven con ella y tiene 9, 12 y 14 años de edad. Las ventanas de la vivienda de María se han deteriorado, por lo que ella buscando brindar mayor seguridad a su hogar ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ventanas, bisagras y mano de obra para instalar ventanas en su vivienda y brindar mayor seguridad a su hogar.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman of 58 years old who, after the loss of her husband, has made every effort to raise her children. They are now older and help out financially. Her oldest son had to emigrate abroad to support his children who live with her and are 9, 12, and 14 years old.

The windows of her home have deteriorated, and she is looking to provide better security for her home. Therefore, she has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to invest in windows, hinges, and manual labor to install windows in her home and provide better security.

loans.use: to invest in windows, hinges, and labor to install windows in her home and provide better security.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Jessica, la socia continua con su negocio de  internet, la socia es una mujer trabajadora muy entusiasta y espera poder obtener mas ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
Los socios en general  agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los socios que salen en la  foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the communal bank "Los Perseverantes." This bank is in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. Jessica is one of the members. She continues in her internet business. She is a hardworking, very enthusiastic woman. She hopes to be able to obtain more earnings from her business in order to continue supporting her family. She's been at her business for quite a while, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. In this way she moves her family forward.

The borrowers in general are grateful to those who take part in this dream, and promise to make the required payments on time. Jessica seeks a loan in order to make repairs to her car. The members in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive to the meeting late due to work obligations.

loans.use: make repairs to her car.

loans.name: Punta Arena Group

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer de 36 años, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 8 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de horneados.
Ella es buena madre, luchadora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por ser el centro de producción de la ciudad, donde microempresarios de áreas como la costura el diseño y las artesanías, reproducen productos extranjeros para que se comercialicen en los principales mercados locales, es el barrio más poblado de la ciudad.
Lorena es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca y baja estatura (al centro viste pantalón blanco, y blusa negra con puntos blancos), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer de micro y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Las ganas por mejorar su negocio la hicieron liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocio de los socios son; venta de helados artesanales, confección de sábanas, peluquería, venta de comida, venta productos naturales para la salud, venta de ropa de segunda mano y taller de reparación de electrodomésticos. Su negocio es la venta de horneado, ella cuenta con una cocina que tiene un pequeño horno con el que hornea masitas tradicionales como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), y otros, “tengo una pequeña y vieja cocina con la que inicié mi negocio, para continuar necesito un horno industrial…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los horneados se comen a toda hora, la desventaja es la falta de capacidad de su horno actual para producir mayor cantidad. Su sueño es abrir una panadería, ella desea comprar un horno industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lorena solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial para hornear masitas por mayor.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 36 year old woman who is married and has 3 children ages 1, 8, and 14. Her business is the sale of baked goods.

She is a good mother, persistent and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the neighborhood "Plan 3000," characterized as being the production center of the city where there are microbusinesses from areas like sewing and design as well as handicrafts. They reproduce foreign products that are sold in the main local markets. It is the most populated neighborhood in the city.

Lorena is of dark complexion, with long black hair that she ties at the nape of her neck, and is short in stature. (She is seen in the center in white pants and a black blouse with white spots.) Her mother tongue is the Guaraní that she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her husband who works as a bus driver and with her children who are in school. They live in their own home made of bricks and cement that has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

The desire to improve her business led her to lead the communal bank. The businesses of the members are: the sale of ice creams, the production of sheets, a hair salon, the sale of food, the sale of natural health products, the sale of secondhand clothing, and a repair shop for electrical appliances. Her business is the sale of baked goods. She has a kitchen that has a small oven where she bakes traditional pastries like cuñapé (a small sweet bun made with flour and yuca with cheese,) rice empanada (baked from rice and cheese,) wheat bizcochos (hard sweet buns made from wheat flour,) and others.

"I have a small, old kitchen with which I started my business. To continue I need an industrial oven..." she comments. The advantage of her business is that people eat baked goods at all hours of the day. The disadvantage is the lack of space in her current oven to produce a larger quantity. Her dream is to open a bakery, and she hopes to buy an industrial oven. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the 6 years that she has been dedicated to this work.

It is for these reasons that Lorena is seeking a loan to buy an industrial oven to bake pastries wholesale.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to bake pastries wholesale.

loans.name: Maira Ondina

texts.es: A sus 42 años de edad Maira muestra sus deseos de salir adelante, ya que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de pupusas, actividad que realiza con mucho esmero y dedicación además cuenta con un molino de nixtamasa, el cual le permite percibir mejores ingresos económicos. Maira desea mejorar el área de la cocina de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar materiales necesarios y pagar mano de obra para mejorar el área de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en:
At 42 years old, Maira shows her wish to get ahead, since for ten years she has been making a living from the sales of stuffed tortillas, an activity that she pursues with much care and dedication. In addition, she has a corn mill which allows her to earn more economically.

Maira wants to improve the kitchen area of her residence and for this purpose she requests a loan from FUSAI to buy necessary materials and to pay the labor to improve the kitchen area as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials and to pay for the labor to improve the kitchen area as soon as possible.

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenita is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jenita requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, sugar, flour, oil, etc..

Jenita has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Jenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, sugar, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Rolland

texts.fr:
Rolland est un très jeune homme de 27 ans. Il est marié avec 2 enfants à charge. Pour gagner sa vie, il tient un commerce de produits chinois tels que des assiettes, des piles, des torches, des radios au grand marché. Il exerce ce métier depuis 8 ans.
Il a déjà pris plusieurs prêts successifs chez Vahatra, ce qui lui a permis d’acheter un terrain et un salon complet dans sa maison. Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter des panneaux solaires, des radios, des thermos et des lampes.
Rolland a comme objectif, la réussite scolaire de ses enfants et acheter une voiture.
texts.en:
Rolland is still very young.  He is 27, married, with two dependent children.  He makes a living selling goods imported from China (plates, batteries, flash-lights, radios etc...) at the grand market.  He has been involved in this activity for the past eight years.

Rolland has already taken several successive loans with Vahatra.  These loans have allowed him to buy a plot of land and to fully furnish his living room.  He intends to use this new loan to buy solar panels, radios, thermos and lamps.

His goal is to see his children succeed in their studies.  He would also like to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy solar panels, radios, thermos and lamps in order to boost his inventory.

loans.name: Melodyn

texts.en:
Melodyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melodyn is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Melodyn has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Melodyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other supplies for the maintenance in her business.

Melodyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Melodyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other supplies for the maintenance in her business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 60 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Anecita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, straws, coffee, biscuits, and other groceries.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Jalawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Iliya can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Iliya no longer feels the pressure to sell his  maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Iliya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his  additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Santusa sigue  con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia una mujer trabajadora muy entusiasta y espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosita de Lima." The bank is in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. Santusa continues in her business selling clothes. She is a hardworking, very enthusiastic woman.

She hopes to be able to obtain more earnings from her business in order to continue supporting her family. She has had her business for quite a while, and things are going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. In this way she moves her family forward. She seeks the loan to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.name: Anderna

texts.en:
Anderna works hard to support ten children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Anderna requested a PHP 10400 loan through NWTF to buy a sanitary toilet.

She is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to able to protect the family and surrounding for the spreed of sickness and infectious diseases.

loans.use: to purchase of materials for the construction of her sanitary toilet

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina works hard to support her family. Ma. Cristina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Cristina is borrowing PHP 10400 through NWTF to buy a sanitary toilet.

She is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to protect the family and community for the spreed of sickness and infectious diseases.

loans.use: to purchase of sanitary toilet

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rebecca is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rebecca has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as sugar and flour.

Rebecca has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio  Mario pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Mario sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, dvds entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y espera poder obtener mas ganancias en su negocio para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia, él socio desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Mario belongs to the "SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Mario continues to work in his business selling clothing and DVD's amongst others. He has been in this business a long time and things are going well thanks to the determination he puts into his work each day. He is a responsible person and he hopes to be able to obtain more profit from his business and continue with his work. In this way he can continue to support his family.

The member is requesting a loan to buy clothing amongst others.

loans.use: to buy clothing amongst others.

loans.name: Ana Sofia

texts.es:
La socia Ana sigue dedicándose a su actividad de agricultura donde cultiva muchas hortalizas. Su experiencia y  su esfuerzo en esta actividad contribuyen a que  su familia a salga adelante.
La socia necesita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes naturales.
Ana está muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y asegura que pagara sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Ana continues working in agriculture, where she grows lots of vegetables. Her experience and effort in this endeavor contribute to moving her family forward.

She needs a loan to buy seeds and natural fertilizers. Ana is very happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for having confidence in her, and she assures them that she will make the required payments at their scheduled times.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn is 55 years old and has two children.  Welyn is married and has one children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Welyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Welyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Parissin Group

texts.fr:
PARAKUY GILBERT est un agriculteur âgé de 41 ans un bon client solvable du RMCR Il vit dans un petit village au Mali., marié et père de 7 enfants âgés de 2 ans à 20 ans dont 6 sont à l’école. C’est lui qui tient le sac d’arachides dans la photo.
Parakuy Gilbert  fait le stockage des arachides depuis deux ans. Il se réjouit avec la vente des arachides car c’est bénéfique pour lui. 
Son rêve est d’avoir plus d’argent pour acheter beaucoup d’arachides pour augmenter son revenu. Ainsi il espère subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille et assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
Il s’approvisionne dans son village et les villages environnants et vend ses arachides dans les marchés locaux de sa zone. Son bénéfice prévisionnel mensuel s’estime à 45 000F.
Ainsi avec le stockage d'arachide il va contribuer à autosuffisance alimentaire de sa localité car l'arachide occupe une place très importante dans l'alimentation de cette population.
texts.en:
Parakuy Gilbert is a 41-year-old farmer.  He is also a reliable and creditworthy client of the RMCR.  He lives in a small village in Mali; he is married and the father of seven children between the ages of 20 and 2.  Six of his children go to school.  In the photo, he is the man holding a bag of groundnuts.

Parakuy Gilbert has been storing groundnuts for the past two years.  He is happy with his job because this type of activity allows him to make some profits.  His dream is to have more money, which would allow him to buy large quantities of groundnuts and increase his income.  He also wants to be able to cover his family's daily needs and to pay for his children's school fees.

Parakuy Gilbert stocks up in his own village and in the surrounding villages before reselling at local markets.  He makes a monthly provisional profit of 45,000 francs.

His groundnut storing activity contributes to his locality's food self-sufficiency, as groundnut occupies a very important place in the daily diet of the local population.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for storage over a six-month period of time.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nanette is 33 years old and all of her children are in school.

Nanette has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nanette requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, flour, sugar, rice, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nanette has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Nanette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, flour, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 57 years old now.

Angelina has a business selling spices in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Noemy Esmeralda

texts.es: Noemy a sus 26 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos el mayor de 7 años y el más pequeño de 1 año y 6 meses de edad. Ella presta sus servicios domésticos, pero además cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, que le apoya económicamente, ya que su padre trabaja en los barcos, y regresa a los 6 meses. Noemy desea cambiar el techo del corredor y encementar el piso que es de tierra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, polines pines, cemento y arena para realizar mejoras al corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Noemy is a hardworking, 26 year old woman. She lives with her husband and their two children. The older child is 7, and the younger child is 1 year and 6 months. She works as a housekeeper, but she also has the support of her family, who supports her economically. Her father works on the boats, and comes home in 6 months.

Noemy wants to change the roof of the corridor of her home, and cement the floor which is made of dirt. For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to buy laminated sheeting, beams, pins, cement and sand to make improvements to the corridor of her house.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting, beams, pins, cement and sand to make improvements to the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Timbo Group

texts.fr: Alimata, est une femme âgée  de 47 ans, elle est mariée mère de 5 enfants. elle exerce son activité depuis 12 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité la bonne qualité de sa marchandise qu'elle vend, les stocks de sa marchandise sont renouvelés à tout moment le prix abordable de ses marchandises, elle est dynamique. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 4 sacs d'arachide à 25 000 f, pour acheter des céréales (mil, maïs) à 25 000 f. L'utilité du prêt c'est de renforcer son activité. Elle a reçu prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en: Alimata is 47, married, and the mother of five children.  She has been involved in her current activity for the past 12 years.  Her professional success stems from the high quality of the merchandise that she sells, her dynamic personality, the fact that she frequently replenishes her stocks and that she sells at reasonable prices.  She is taking this loan to buy four bags of groundnuts (at 25,000 francs each) and other grains, such as millet and maize (at 25,000 francs each).  This loan will help her to boost her business.  Her first loan was paid back on time.

loans.use: to buy four bags of groundnuts as well as other grains (millet and maize).

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 41 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, junk foods, coffee, diaper, biscuits and other groceries. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Luis José

texts.es: Luis de 21 años es un trabajador independiente que reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un humilde barrio del  sur de Barranquilla y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocicleta, oportunidad de negocio que encontró al analizar la congestión, el déficit y el nulo acceso de rutas de transporte en algunas zonas de la ciudad.  De esta manera Luis gana su sustento diario con el que solventa las necesidades en su hogar, sin embargo él estaba inquieto por realizar alguna actividad alterna al servicio de transporte que le permitiera ganar un dinero extra y hace un año decidió comercializar ropa exclusivamente para dama. Su cónyuge quien labora como operaria en una empresa privada, lo apoya con esta iniciativa y promueve ventas a sus conocidas, así mismo Luis oferta a vecinas, familiares y amigas del sector donde reside. Esta actividad les ha proveído de un ingreso adicional con el que han mejorado sus condiciones de vida  y planea incrementar su surtido para ofertar nuevas tendencias en la temporada más alta del año, diciembre.  Realizó una una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para  comprar vestidos, blusas, leggins, faldas y demás, prendas de vestir de gran demanda por sus clientes. Esta inversión le permitirá tener éxito en su negocio y acercarse a la meta de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis, 21, is an independent worker who lives in the company of his wife in a humble neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla, and he makes a living transporting passengers on his motorcycle, a business opportunity he discovered by analyzing the congestion, the shortage and the lack of access to transportation routes in some zones of the city. In this way, Luis earns his daily sustenance with which he covers the household necessities. Regardless, he is anxious to find an alternative activity to the transport service with which to earn extra money, and a year ago he decided to sell clothing for women exclusively. His wife, who labors as a worker in a private company, supports him in this initiative and promotes sales to her acquaintances. In addition, Luis services his neighbors, family members and friends in the sector where he lives. This activity has provided additional income with which they have improved their life conditions, and he plans to increase his assortment in order to offer new styles in the highest season of the year, December.

He made an application for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to link himself with the financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in order to purchase dresses, blouses, leggings, skirts, and other articles of clothing in great demand by his customers. This investment will allow him to have success in his business and get closer to his goal of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, leggings, skirts and other articles of clothing in great demand by his customers.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 38 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Thelma has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, junk foods, juices, sugar and other groceries.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman and 24 year old now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marife has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, perfumes, etc..

Marife has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Marife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Nishel

texts.en:
Nishel is 26 years old and has one child. Nishel is married and has one child in school.

Nishel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nishel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nishel has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nishel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz sends you her sincere thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan of PHP 30,000 greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy high volume of electronic products and supplies which gave her higher profit. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures. 

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more, if you will allow her to borrow PHP 35,000 this time. She will start selling small appliances like ceiling fans and desk fans. She will also buy emergency lights, flashlights, and TV antennas. This increase in her inventory will help her sustain the needs of her family. Soon her youngest child will be graduating in college and she will be relieved of huge educational expenses. She can give more attention to improving her business.

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to start selling small appliances like ceiling fans and desk fans; buy emergency lights, flashlights, and TV antennas

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Editha is 63 years old now.

Editha has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Editha has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 43 years old and married with three children. Jonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, nooldes and other groceries. 

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending business.

Luisa dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like E-loading business.

Estela dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 50 years old and married with five children. With four children still in school, Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

Marichu runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, bread, etc. to sell.

Marichu has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, bread, etc. 

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, candies, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline works hard to support her family. Angeline is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Angeline requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Angeline has been in this business for 3 years now.

Angeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Precy is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Precy has a general store business in the Philippines. Precy requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Precy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Precy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Consejo

texts.en:
Maria Consejo is 54 years old and married with three children.  

Maria Consejo is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Consejo requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Maria Consejo has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Consejo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Artemia has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Artemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, eggs, sanitary pads, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, sanitary pads, coffee, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, eggs, sanitary pads, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Subasini's Group

texts.en:
Subasini, a 35-year-old homemaker and a differently abled lady, standing on the left is a resident of Aanandpur, Odisha, India. She hails from a poor family. Her husband is engaged in agricultural activities to earn for his family of five, which includes her husband and their three sons. This young couple has no formal education and can only sign their names.

The main source of income for the family is vegetable cultivation. Subasini, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agribusiness. They have a plot of land in which they produce vegetables like eggplant, cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chili, cucumbers, papaya, ladies' finger, and onions. Subasini's husband sells the products in the daily market of the nearest town. They earn 5,000 INR per month from this business, which is not enough to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family.

They have decided to cultivate maize, as the crop has a good acceptability in their region. For this reason, she along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for their maize cultivation. She expects a good return from their business. The loan will serve as a stepping stone for them towards a secure future.

Subasini is in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for their maize cultivation

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta es una de las personas que sean vistos beneficiadas con los créditos que han obtenido en ADICLA, pues ella con su crédito pudo realizar la inversión en su negocio de tortillería y a sus clientes pudo satisfacer mejor pero también sus ingresos mejoraron mucho. Marta nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo que en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de un terreno con construcción, pues está ha sido una de las necesidades más primordiales de su familia. Marta guarda las esperanzas de conseguir este préstamo para adquirir este terreno. Su gran sueño es hacer crecer su negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en: Marta is one of the people who have enjoyed benefits from the loans that they have obtained through ADICLA; because of her previous loan Marta could make an investment in her tortilla making business and she was able to better satisfy her customers, but also her income improved a lot.  Marta again is in need of a loan, which this time will be invested in the purchase of a plot of land with a building, since this has been one of the most primal needs of her family.  Marta guards her hopes of getting this loan to acquire this land.  Her great dream is to grow her business of selling food.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land with a building.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil, coffee, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erneys De Jesús

texts.es: Erneys es un emprendedor que desde joven encontró alternativas para generar recursos y ayudar a sus padres, él instaló un video juego que aún está funcionando y que está siendo administrado por un familiar, mientras él trabaja en una empresa privada y capta recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.  Su cónyuge y él viven en un humilde barrio de la ciudad de Barranquilla y alternamente a su actividad principal comercializa prendas de vestir, actividad que le proporciona un ingreso adicional en pro de una mejor calidad de vida.  Sus metas familiares es adquirir una vivienda propia y tener hijos, así como fortalecer su negocio y algún día poder dedicarse exclusivamente a este. Erneys tiene una serie de encargos que superan su capital de negocio y realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar prendas de vestir; jean, blusas, vestidos, pantalones, busos, camisetas tipo polo y demás. Esta inversión le permitirá tener éxito y ganancias sustanciosas.
texts.en:
Erneys is an entrepreneur who since his youth found alternatives to earn money and help his parents. He installed a video game that is still working and is being run by a relative while he works in a private business and earns money to support his home. He and his spouse live in a humble neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla and his principal work is selling articles of clothing, a job that supplies him with an additional income toward a better quality of life.

His family goals are to acquire his own living space and to have children, and also to strengthen his business and one day be able to dedicate himself exclusively to it. Erneys has a number of orders that exceed the capital of his business. He applied for a Kiva loan as an opportunity to connect to financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the loan to buy articles of clothing like jeans, blouses, dresses, pants, sweatshirts, polos, and more. This loan will allow him to be successful and have substantial gains.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing like jeans, blouses, dresses, pants, sweatshirts, polos, and others.

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en: Meleseke is a 26 year old mother with 5 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. Meleseke requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel,

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende variedad de productos, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos de la casa, anteriormente ya ha solicitado dos creditos con los cuales ha podido surtir con algunos productos su negocio, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sopas, jabón, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, papel higiénico, etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. For 10 years she has had a small store located in her place of residence where she sells a variety of products. Through her sales she manages to get ahead with the household expenses. She has previously requested two loans which she used to stock her business with products.

She is requesting a loan to buy more soup, soap, detergents, candies, soft drinks, toilet paper, etc. in order to be able to have more income and a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soup, soap, detergents, candies, soft drinks, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ema is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ema has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucena is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Lucena has a general store business in the Philippines. Lucena requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for 5 years. Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Emilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Emilyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Emilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Catherine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store, raising pigs and farming vegetables.  Catherine is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers for her buy and sell rice business.

Catherine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Virginia has been in this business for 5 years. Virginia earns more income from farming vegetables.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 43 years old and has one child. Edgar is married and has one child who is in school.

Edgar is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Edgar requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his livestock.

Edgar has been raising livestock for 7 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Edgar would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
Romelie is 33 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Romelie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Romelie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Romelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 57 years old and married with seven children. With one child still in school, Luzviminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like candies, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. 

Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like candies, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es:
Evangelista, de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, está acompañada, es empleada en una farmacia en de la ciudad.
 
Evangelista, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar 2 terneritos e invertir en la venta de pan, especificamente comprará harina, azúcar y queso; ella misma elaborar este producto porque tiene mucho conocimiento acerca de esto y ella misma saldría a vender los fines de semana en su tiempo libre.

Evangelista, sueña con una buena educación para sus hijos.
texts.en: Evangelista is 27 years old. She s a single mother of 3 children and has a domestic partner. She works at a pharmacy in the city. Evangelista is requesting a loan to buy two small calves and to invest in the business of selling bread. Specifically, she will buy flour, sugar and cheese. She will make this product herself because she knows a lot about this, and she will go to sell on weekends in her free time. Evangelista dreams of a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy two small calves and to buy flour, sugar and cheese to make bread.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 53 years old, married with seven children.

Carmen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as biscuits, toothpaste, sanitary pads, sugar, detergent soap, coffee, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Carmen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as biscuits, toothpaste, sanitary pads, sugar, detergent, soap, coffee, juice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Emma

texts.en:
Ma. Emma is a married woman with five children. Ma. Emma is 42 years old and three of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Emma has a fish pond business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Ma. Emma requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fingerlings and feed for her business.

In the future, Ma. Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings and feeds for her fish pond business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu works hard to support her family. Marichu is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Marichu requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marichu would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and is married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Matan's Group

texts.en:
Matan is a 37-year-old woman standing on the left-hand side in the photograph. Her family includes three young children after the demise of her husband. Her children are diligent students; they are in grade 9, grade 6 and grade 4. They live at Aanandpur, a small village in Odisha, India.

She has been running a nursery (plant sale outlet). She started her micro enterprise with a handful of plants but as the time passed, she has made progress in her business and now enjoys a regular list of customers.

For growing fresh flowers and plants, Matan along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to purchase more seeds of different flowers and fruit seeds and seedlings. She hopes this will increase her sales and income. She wishes to use part of the revenue on the expansion of her business and wishes to spend part of the income on her family members, and improve their general standard of living.

She is grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds of different flowers and fruit seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rabiu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Rabiu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aminu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Aminu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Aminu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a taxi driver in Calarasi region, Moldova. He is 34 years old and his biggest passion is cars. That's why he's been working as a cabbie for 13 years. Now Denis has three cars, all of which are used in a taxi company from Calarasi. Two of them are Mercedes and one is a Renault model. But Denis wants to change Renault on Mercedes, because expenses on maintaining this car are lower and it is the best car to use as a taxi. The taxi services bring Denis his main income.

Denis will use this loan to buy a car for taxi services. As a result, the level of life of his family will improve.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand car for taxi service.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muhammed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Muhammed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Muhammed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Muhammed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco vive en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. 
El socio continua con su negocio de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos en base de lana de alpaca y oveja, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y espera poder obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia, él socio desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio pertenece al banco comunal Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the Huayllabamba community in the Huancarani District in the Paucartambo Province of the Cusco Department, Peru.

He continues with his crafts business, such as, for example, cloth woven from alpaca and sheep wood. He has been with his business for a good amount of time which is going well thanks to the effort he applies to his business each day. He is a responsible person, and he hopes to be able to make more profits from his business in order to be able to continue supporting his family.

Francisco belongs to the communal bank Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba.

He is requesting the loan to purchase alpaca wool.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Thạch Bắc Xã Quảng Thạch Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duy is 39 years old, and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making mesh nets for 5 years. Duy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Duy faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2013, Duy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Duy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Duy hopes that her business does well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net to catch fish

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
With grateful appreciation, Leila wants to convey that her previous financial assistance amounting to PHP 30,000 was very helpful. It was utilized in purchasing stocks of ready-to-wear apparel that she sold for additional income. A portion of the loan also provided for her medicines, and she really considers it a great blessing. Together with her husband, Danilo, and five children, they want to say "thank you so much"!

The fast-approaching Christmas season inspires Leila to further improve her business. She knows that more customers are inclined to buy new clothes during this season. This is why she is imploring for your kindness in extending her another loan worth PHP 40,000 to buy more up to date ready-to-wear clothes to resell. This will meet the increasing demands of her customers and will surely give her higher profits, paving the way for her children’s completed education in the near future.

She has been consistent in repaying her previous loans and she can maintain her good record. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more up to date ready-to-wear clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nordecielo

texts.en:
Nordecielo is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Nordecielo is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nordecielo has been in pig-fattening for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nordecielo would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 30 years old and married with 2 children, both of whom are currently in school. Marieta works very hard to provide for them.

Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, shampoo, spices, bread, drinks, sugar, snack foods, and assorted personal care products.

Marieta has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, shampoo, spices, bread, drinks, sugar, snack foods, and assorted personal care products.

loans.name: Basundhara's Group

texts.en:
Water is a fundamental human need. Each person on earth requires at least 20 to 50 litres of clean, safe water a day for drinking, cooking, and simply keeping themselves clean. Fresh water is one of our most vital resources, and when our water is polluted, it is not only devastating to the environment, but also to human health. The quality of our water is directly linked to the quality of our lives.

Basundhara, the lady standing on the left-hand side in the photograph, is a resident of Aanandpur, Odisha, India. The area does not have a proper source of drinking water and people often become ill due to water-borne diseases. In order to avoid unnecessary medical expenses and protect and safeguard her family's health, Basundhara along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier so that she can get clean safe water to drink.

Basundhara is eagerly awaiting your kind help to protect her family's health.
Having clean water is priority one in a survival situation.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier

loans.name: Premalata's Group

texts.en:
Water is a part of everyday life. From the lakes to the skies to the glasses of it we drink every day, it is easy to say that water makes up a huge part of human existence. With that in mind, there is a growing need for proper water filtration in the world, regardless of where you may live or what you may do. Having clean water is priority one in a survival situation.

Premalata, the lady standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a resident of Aanandpur, Odisha, India. She lives with her two daughters and husband who works as a barber in a salon. The area does not have a proper source of drinking water and people often become ill due to water-borne diseases. In order to avoid unnecessary medical expenses and protect and safeguard her family's health, Premalata along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water filter and purifier so that she can get clean safe water to drink.

Premalata is eagerly awaiting your kind help to protect her family's health.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter with purifier.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rowena has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Katherin Johana

texts.es:
Katherin, de 23 años de edad, es madre de una niña de 2 años de edad, está acompañada, no pudo culminar sus estudios y decidió formar su propio hogar. 

Katherin, se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos en el mercado municipal, su negocio le genera muchas ganancias y decidió vender en ese lugar porque es ahí donde tiene a todos sus clientes; ella viaja casi todos los días en bus y su mamá le ayuda con el negocio.

Katherin, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como camarones, langostas y pescado blanco; porque estos son los productos que mas apetecen sus clientes.

Su sueño es mejorar más su negocio y darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en: Katherin is 23 years old. She is the mother of a 2 year old daughter. She has a domestic partner. She was not able to finish her studies and decided to form her own home. Katherin works in the business of buying and selling seafood at the municipal market. Her business generates a lot of earnings, and she decided to sell from that place because this is where she has all her customers. She travels almost every day by bus and her mother helps her with the business. Katherin needs the loan to buy more merchandise, such as shrimp, lobster and white fish, because these are the products that her customers like best. Her dream is to improve her business and give her small daughter all the best.
