loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as shrimp, lobster and white fish.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marigen has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Marigen requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to sell.

Marigen has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marigen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Muh'd

texts.en:
Muh'd is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muh'd has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muh'd would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Muh'd can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Muh'd will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Muh'd is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tasty Fish Group

texts.en:
Rích is 54 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.
Rích lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village.  Also this job is unstable. 
The main hardship that Rích faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to process for sale.
In 2013, Rích joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Rích has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
She is the group leader of the Tasty Fish, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Rích hopes that her business does well, that her children find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to process for sale

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
For ten years now, Isidoro has been selling clothes using his movable cart or stall. He's been chasing the crowd to get higher sales. Despite the fatigue of walking and pushing his cart, he persists in order to provide for the daily needs of his family. All of his sacrifices will be rewarded as his children will finish their college degrees soon.

Isidoro is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT), in partnership with Kiva, had granted his previous loan request of PHP 25,000 and he considered it as God’s blessing to his family. The loan was used to buy more clothing products so he was able to provide a variety of options to customers.

Since it’s his only source of income, Isidoro is persistent in becoming successful in his chosen industry. He wants to have enough savings for the future and is praying that God will continually bless his business to attract more customers.

He is working towards his goal to get a permanent space inside the market so his customers can easily locate him. He has to save enough to pay for the permit to operate. For now he is requesting your kindness in lending him PHP 15,000. This additional capital will bring him more ready-to-wear apparels so customers will have a variety of choices.

Isidoro regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony and experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear apparel.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 64 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Amparo has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Amparo requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Amparo has been in this business for five years. Amparo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Linda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Linda has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers for her business buying and selling bananas.

Rosemarie has been in this business for four years. Rosemarie earns more income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 34 years old and has two children. Maria Cristina is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Maria Cristina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Cristina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maria Cristina has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 46 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma Xiomara

texts.es:
Vilma, de 35 años de edad, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y juntos tienen 3 hijos, los cuales están estudiando. 

Vilma, ha sido una mujer emprendedora, que lucha cada día por sacar adelante a su familia, ella apoya a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar; ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace algunos años. 

Vilma, decidió solicitar un préstamo para comprar leña y mejorar el lugar donde está ubicado su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener un mejor negocio que le permita mejores ganancias y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Vilma is 35 year old and married. Her husband is a farmer, and they have 3 children who attend school. Vilma has been an enterprising woman who works hard every day to move her family ahead. She helps her husband with the household's income. She has worked for many years selling tortillas. Vilma decided to request a loan to buy firewood and improve the place where her business is located. Her dreams are to have a better business that allows her to have better earnings, and be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to improve the place where her business is located.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancara ni dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. 
El socio Mario tiene 28 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al  negocio de agricultura, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y espera poder obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia, a la vez el socio se dedica a la crianza de animales, él socio desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba". The bank is located in the community of Huayllabamba of the district of Huancara in the province of Paucartambo of the department of Cusco, Peru.

The partner Mario, 28, has one son and is single. He alternates his daily activities making a living from agriculture. The partner is having a good time with his business which goes well because of the effort he puts into his business every day. He is a responsible person and hopes to be able to get more earnings from his business so as to be able in this way to continue supporting his family. At the same time, the partner makes a living raising animals. He wishes to be able to continue working so as to continue supporting his family in this way.

The partner requests a loan in order to buy manure and seeds amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds amongst other things.

loans.name: Let Children Go To School Group

texts.en:
Tuyết is 33 years old and she is married with 3 children.
 She has had a retail business selling gas for 5 years.
Tuyết lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. Also this job is unstable . 
The main hardship that Tuyết faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more gas to resell.
In 2015, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
She is the group leader of the Let Children Go to School group, which consists of 5 members.
With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more gas to resell

loans.name: Anna Lee

texts.en:
Anna Lee works hard to support her family. Anna Lee is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Anna Lee requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Anna Lee has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Anna Lee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rodilla

texts.en:
Rodilla is 34 years old and has three children. Rodilla is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Rodilla is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rodilla requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rodilla has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rodilla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 39 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jesusa has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jesusa has been in this business for three years. Jesusa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 23-year-old single man living in Irbid. Yazan`s problem is financial difficulties. He comes from a big family.  ‎Yazan is studying for his bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering in his third year. His future plan is to get his degree and ‎to work in his field of study. He is applying for a loan to help him cover his semester fees.‎

loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Salsabeela

texts.en: Salsabeela is a 56-year-old divorced woman. She is retired and has a low income. She is a conservative woman and asked ‎her daughter Farah to appear in the photo instead of her. Salsabeela lives in a refugee camp named Baqaa. She has ‎two kids and she is working hard to provide them with a good life. Farah is one of her children, and is a student in university, ‎majoring in English language. Her mother helps in paying her university fees. Therefore, Salsabeela is applying for the loan ‎so she can help Farah to pay her university fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for her daughter`s university fees.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a maize farmer from Isiyaku Magadda II village. As a Babban Gona member, Yau is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yau can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yau no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yau hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 33 years old and she is married.
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years.
Thu lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village.  Also the market need is low in this region. 
Her family has no latrine.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
With her business profit, Thu hopes that her business does well, her family is healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build toilet.

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en:
Ermina is 58 years old and married with five children. Ermina works very hard to provide for them.

Ermina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sugar, fabric conditioner, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, beers, etc. to sell.

Ermina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, fabric conditioner, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, beers, etc.

Ermina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sugar, fabric conditioner, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricel is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Maricel has a business buying and selling spare parts in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more spare parts to sell to her customers.

Maricel has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is a 20-year-old single lady living in Mafraq city, which suffers from the impact of the Syrian asylum‎. She is studying to get her bachelor's degree in accounting, and she is now in her third year. The income that comes from ‎her father is the only source of income to her family of 15 members, which means that her father cannot help Haya to pay ‎for her university fees. That led Haya to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees. Haya's ‎future plan is to get a master's degree in the same field.‎

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jumily

texts.en: Jumily works hard to support her family. Jumily is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Jumily requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. Jumily has been in this business for 12 years now. Jumily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Noravic

texts.en:
Noravic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Noravic is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Noravic has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Noravic requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell.

Noravic has been in this business for six years. In the future, Noravic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 37 years old and married with six children.

Josefina is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefina has been farming sugarcane for 50 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is a 72-year-old mother with eight children. She is strong and fit to run her business with the help of her children. She runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Pepe requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves,.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 31-year-old mother with 5 children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei-printed (Samoan design) materials at the market to earn a living. Pauline requested a loan to buy paint, rollers, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy paint, rollers, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Tofiga

texts.en: Tofiga is a 36-year-old mother with four children. She has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tofiga has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her in running the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots.

loans.name: Faaseseina

texts.en: Faaseseina is a 44-year-old mother with three children. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. Faaseseina requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, frying pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, frying pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Cristina Suyapa

texts.es: Cristina de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 5 años inicio gracias a la ayuda de su hijo, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de manera ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Cristina is 45 years old and lives in her home with her son.  She makes a living selling personal products, beginning five years ago with the help of her son.  Her business is located in her place of residence and she also sells her products walking through the different suburbs.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, and deodorants, etc., all wholesale; so that she can continue her work to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, and deodorants, etc., all wholesale.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha is 55 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Ha Trung district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Her household was recognized by the local government as poor; moreover this job is unstable. The main hardship that Pha faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Pha's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of Pha's group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Pha hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancara ni dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. 
La socia es la Sra. Paulina tiene 28 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de crianza de animales menores,  la socia es una mujer trabajadora muy entusiasta y espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar animales entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to communal bank "Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba". The bank is located in the community of Huayllabamba of the district of Huancara in the province of Paucartambo of the province of Cusco, Peru.

The partner Paulina, 28, is single. She alternates her daily activities making a living in the business of raising small animals. The partner is hard-working and very enthusiastic, and she hopes to be able to get more earnings from her business so as to continue supporting her family in this way. She has been having a good time with her business which goes well thanks to the effort that she puts into the business every day, this being the way that she gets her family ahead.

The partner requests the loan to buy animals amongst other things.

The partner is grateful for the loan offered and promises to make her established repayments.

loans.use: to buy animals amongst other things.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan works in agriculture, farming food. Lan is 31 years old and she is married with two children in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Lan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Lan has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 29 years old, with four children. Glenda works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Glenda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, shampoo, soap, junk foods, candies and other groceries.

In the future, Glenda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Ivy

texts.en:
Ma. Ivy is 28 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ma. Ivy works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Ivy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Ivy has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, can goods, beverages, ketchup, straw, cotton and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Ivy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 38 years old and married with six children. With six children in school, Marife works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, condiments, junk foods, and other groceries.

Marife has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, milk, coffee, junk foods, oil, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, condiments, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merly is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Merly has a buy and sell condiments business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of condiments to sell.

Merly has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of condiments to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 57 years old and has three children who are in school.

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Gemma dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

Marissa dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lina dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling fish.

Emma dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has an oyster farm in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her oyster farm.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store business.

Neonita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her oyster farm

loans.name: Marjolyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marjolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marjolyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Marjolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Saturnina es una joven estudiosa y trabajadora, ella es la nueva socia del banco comunal "QORICHUSPA", la socia solicito el préstamo para poder continuar solventando sus estudios de cosmetología.
La socia necesita comprar tintes, peines y tijeras.la cual le ayuden a terminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente y salga adelante.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de farmacia, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de bisutería, entre otras actividades.
Los socios agradecen a inversionistas de KIVA, y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
los tres socios que están agregados en la foto, tenían permiso por motivos de trabajo y llegaron tarde.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Qorichuspa communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Saturnina is a studious and hardworking young woman. She is a new member of the Qorichuspa communal bank. She is requesting a loan to pay for her cosmetology schooling. She needs to buy dyes, combs, and scissors, which will help her adequately finish her studies and move forward.

The other members earn a living in a pharmacy business, selling clothes, a grocery store, selling jewelry and other activities. The members are thankful to the Kiva lenders and are committed to making the payments in the established schedule. The three members that are posted in the photo were given permission for work reasons, and they arrived late.

loans.use: to buy dyes, combs, and scissors.

loans.name: Sonia Guadalupe

texts.es: Sonia de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y papas fritas desde hace mas de 2 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y papas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, papas, aceite, entre otros ingredientes para poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en: Sonia is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their daughter.  For more than two years, she has had a business selling sandwiches and fried potatoes.  She has a very good clientele and she sells her food at a good price.  With the income she's earned, she can cover some household expenses.  She is requesting a loan that allows her to purchase everything necessary to make her sandwiches and fried potatoes such as: bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, bologna, potatoes, and oil, among other ingredients in order to be able to have better earnings and continue helping her household with expenses that could come up.

loans.use: to purchase bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, bologna, potatoes, and oil, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Nidia Irlanda

texts.es: Nidia vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de granos basicos y pan dulce su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 3 años tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esya solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi generar buenos ingreos economicos.
texts.en: Nidia lives in her own home with her two children.  She makes her living selling staple grains and sweet breads in the municipal market.  She has done this for the last three years, and she has a lot of customers because of her good prices.  With the earnings from her sales, Nidia is able to meet some of her household expenses.  She is requesting the loan to purchase more wholesale products so she can keep up with her sales and generate a decent income.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains and sweet breads.

loans.name: Funny Fisherwomen Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 33 years old and married with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising marine aquaculture for one year. Huệ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp, etc. This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Funny Fisherwomen, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp, etc.

loans.name: Fresh Cuttle Fish Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hảo is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant, selling fish for two years. Hảo lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

The main hardship that Hảo faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase seafood to resell. In 2014, Hảo joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hảo has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Fresh Cuttle Fish group, which consists of five members. With her business profit, Hảo hopes to build a new house, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 53 years old and married with four children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Thanh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase seafood to resell. This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of Thanh's Group, which consists of three members. With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell.

loans.name: Mother's Love Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phương is 34 years old and married with three children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for five years. Phương lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Phương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase seafood to resell.

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Mother's Love Group, which consists of three members. With her business profit, Phương hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a buying and selling spices in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell to customers.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store business.

Arlene dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 52 years old, married with three children.

Jovita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jovita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Jovita aspires to save enough money to expand her business in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Coca

texts.en:
Coca is 29 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Coca works very hard to provide for them.

Coca has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Coca has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other personal care products. 

In the future Coca would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a fruit vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Araceli dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 55 years old, married with one child who is in school. 

Ruth is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ruth has been farming vegetables for twelve years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
As a married mother of 5 children, Rhodora works hard to support her family. She has a personal care products retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from dressmaking.

Rhodora is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more inventory of personal care products to offer for sale.

Rhodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of personal care products to offer for resale.

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina is a 36-year-old mother with 6 children. To earn her living, she owns and operates a small business selling pancake, pork cake, and buns in her community. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Rolina has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and frying pans to assist her in running her business.

Rolina will expand her business using her profits. She joined South Pacific Business Development in 2013.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and frying pans.

loans.name: Sandra Marlene

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer trabajadora de 34 años de edad que muestra sus deseos de salir adelante cada día, por lo que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, pero además desde hace un tiempo vende platos típicos por las tardes. Ella es madre soltera y está sacando adelante a sus hijos, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Sandra desea construir el cuarto de la cocina de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y mano de  obra para construir el cuarto de la cocina y tener un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos. Con el crédito anterior Sandra logro incrementar sus productos de venta al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hard-working, 34-year old woman who demonstrates her desire to get ahead each day. For the last ten years, she has made her living selling beauty products and clothing. In addition, a while ago she started selling local fare in the afternoons.
Sandra is a single mother and is getting her children ahead through a lot of effort and dedication.
She wants to build a room for a kitchen onto her home. Her current one is deteriorated. Sandra is requesting a loan from FUSAI so she can purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails and pay for labor to build a room for her kitchen. Then she will have a suitable place to prepare the food she sells.
With the previous loan, Sandra was able to increase the amount of products she sold and her earnings as well.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails and to pay for labor to build a room for her kitchen.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 65 years old and married with three children. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Fe has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with two children. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 30 years old and has 2 children. She is married, and both of her children attend school.

Anabelle earns a living with her fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Anabelle has been fishing for 6 years now, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain it.

In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a married mothert of two children, Marjorie works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and married with  children. Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Grace has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Olidia

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, la clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 30 años, la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She is a hardworking person who is fully devoted to her business, all with the sole desire of getting ahead and ultimately providing a better life for her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable stand that is located in a market that is close to where she has lived for 30 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale since in this way she will be able to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa ella solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 51-years old.  She lives in her own home with her family.  Maria has had a boiled corn mill set up in her home for the last seven years.  She has a lot of customers, especially the ladies who make tortillas.  They come to Maria to have their corn ground.  With what she earns from her sales, Maria is able to cover some of her household expenses.  She is requesting the loan to purchase some necessary items for her mill, such as cloths, discs, knives etc. so she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies for her mill, such as cloths, discs, knives etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 48 years old and both of her children are attend in school.

Alma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

Alma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Olivia works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running her general store.

Olivia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more bananas to sell at her local market.

Olivia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Maria Angel

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza cada día para poder sacar adelante a su familia con su negocio de venta de frutas y refrescos naturales, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es una mujer luchadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos menores de 15, 14 y 5 años de edad. María desea invertir en más fruta para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, además desea comprar por mayoreo para mejorar sus ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papayas, sandias, mango, jocotes, melón, jícama, entre otras frutas por mayoreo para su venta.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, and is an admirable woman that strives each day to move her family ahead with her business selling fruits and fruit drinks. This occupation allows her to move her family ahead. She is a determined woman that lives in her own home together with her life partner and their three young children ages 15, 14 and 5.

Maria wants to buy more fruit in order to offer more variety to her customers. She also wants to buy at wholesale for greater profits. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy papayas, watermelon, mango, jocote, melon, jicama, and other fruits at wholesale for her sales.

loans.use: to buy papayas, watermelon, mango, jocotes, melon, jicama, and other fruits at wholesale for her sales.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancara ni dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. 
La socia es la Sra. Isabela tiene 42  años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de crianza de animales menores,  la socia es una mujer trabajadora muy entusiasta y espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar animales entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba" communal bank. The communal bank is located in the community of Huayllabamba, which is in Huancara District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Perú.

This member is Sra. Isabela. She is 42-years old and single. She spends her days taking care of her business raising small animals. Sra. Isabela is a very hard-working woman. She is very enthusiastic and hopes to earn more from her business so she can keep helping her family. Sra. Isablela has had her busienss for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. That is how she is able to get her family ahead.

Sra. Isablela is requesting the loan to purchase animals and other items.

Sra. Isabela is happy about the loan she is being offered and promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase animals and other items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman who works hard to support her family. She has a livestock business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Evelyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nancy has a rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice.

loans.name: Zoila Damari

texts.es:
Zoila, de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y es por ellos que lucha día a día por salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su familia. 

Zoila, se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote todos los días, ella los elabora y los comercializa en el mercado de su ciudad, ella está satisfecha con su negocio porque le genera muy buenos resultados, porque sus clientes siempre la esperan para poder comprarles sus tamales.

Zoila, necesita el préstamo para comprar más elotes para poder aumentar la producción de tamales, porque el número de clientes ha aumentado. 

Su sueño es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean persona de bien.
texts.en:
27-year-old Zoila is a single mother who has two children. It is for them that she fights day to day to get ahead and give the best to her family.

Zoila earns a living selling corn tamales every day. She produces and sells them in her city's market. She is satisfied with her business--it produces very good results for her, as her clients are always waiting to be able to buy her tamales.

Zoila needs the loan in order to buy more corn to be able to increase her tamale production, because the number of clients has grown.

Her dream is to be able to give a good education to her children so that they may be good people.

loans.use: to buy more corn to be able to increase her tamale production.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es:
María, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudio hasta primer grado, pero eso no le dificulta para poder salir adelante, es madre de 8 hijos que están estudiando y vive junto a su pareja y sus hijos. 

María, tiene una tienda en la playa que está cerca de su casa y es de ahí de donde obtiene los ingresos diarios para su familia.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, pan, azúcar, entre otros productos para su tienda, porque ah aumentado la clientela.

María, sueña con tener un negocio más surtido, porque de ahí obtiene todos sus ingresos y poder seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 46 years old, is an enterprising woman. She studied until first grade, but this doesn't cause her difficulty in getting ahead. She is the mother of 8 children who are studying and she lives with her partner and their children. María has a store on the beach that's near her house and that's where she obtains the daily income for her family.

María needs the loan to buy rice, beans, bread, sugar, among other products for her store, because she's increased her clientele. María dreams of having a more stocked business, because from that she obtains all of her income, and to be able to continue providing education to her children so that they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, sugar, among other products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de plátanos, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, el joven vive en casa propia con compañera de vida, anteriormente ya habia solicitado un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia y asi puedo aumentar sus ventas hoy nuevamente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas plátano por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose had his face pixellated because of being 28 years old and living in a high risk zone has worked for the past 3 years selling plantains. His business is located near his house in the a very busy area and he has many clients. The young man lives in his own house with a life partner.

Before, he had applied for a loan for the purchase of more merchandise and therefore could increase his sales. Today, again, he is applying for a loan for the purchase of more plantains in bulk to be able to continue with his sales and to therefore have better income.

loans.use: to buy more plantains in bulk.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 33 years old, married, and has two children, both currently in school. She is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Cheryll has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed six times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain it.

Cheryll requested a 27,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, Cheryll would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es un joven de 21 años que reside con sus padres en el municipio de Soledad, sus aspiraciones y proyectos son muchos, él está estudiando en la universidad contaduría pública y su meta principal es terminar sus estudios y aperturar un almacén que le permita proyectarse a futuro como un hombre exitoso.  Él labora en una empresa privada y aprovecha sus habilidades sociales para proponerle prendas de vestir, calzado y electrodomésticos a las personas que conoce, actividad que heredó de su madre quien ha sido comerciante durante toda su vida.  Desde muy chico tuvo el privilegio de ayudar a su madre en su negocio; entregaba mercancías a los clientes y realizaba labores de cobro.   Su madre observó en él un gran potencial para las ventas y le entregó unos recursos para que iniciara su propio negocio, así empezó a venderles suéteres y bermudas a sus compañeros de bachillerato, y cuando ingresó a la universidad, ya tenía una variedad mucho más amplia que proponer y con ello una clientela mayor.  Hoy en día necesita un capital para responder a encargos de su clientela, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar un televisor, ropa para dama y caballero, calzado y una mecedora. Esta financiación lo acercará a su meta y apóyalo.
texts.en:
Luis is a 21-year old young man who lives with his parents in Soledad. He has many hopes and projects. Luis is studying Public Accounting at the university. His main goal is to finish his studies and open a store, which will allow him to move into the future as a successful man.
Luis works for a private company. He uses his social skills to his advantage by selling clothing, footwear and electrical appliances to the people he knows. He learned the sales business from his mother, who has been a saleswoman her whole life long.
Since he was young, Luis has had the privilege of helping his mother with her business. He would deliver merchandise to the customers and collect payments. His mother saw that he had great potential in sales, and she gave him some resources with which to start his own business. And so Luis began selling sweaters and Bermuda shorts to his high school friends. When he got to college, Luis already had a greater variety of stock to offer for sale, and with that a greater clientele.
Currently, Luis needs capital so he can make good on his customers' orders. That is why made a loan request, a credikiva, which was an opportunity to connect himself to the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will purchase a television, women's and men's clothing, footwear and a rocking chair. This financing will bring Luis closer to goal and help him out.

loans.use: to purchase a television, women's and men's clothing, footwear and a rocking chair.

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en: Thoun, a farmer and also a government officer assistant, lives in O Tasek village with her mother and six siblings. Thoun is a hard-working person. She does family farming and also owns a feeding farm. She wants her mother to live in more comfortable conditions. Currently her old mother is still farming and helps her business. Her mother has difficulty in using a battery to supply energy for their home. She needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using the car battery, Thoun decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a home solar-energy system. She believes solar home energy will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar-energy system.

location.town: O Tasek Village, Kouk Banteay Commune, Rolea Pe Ea

loans.name: Abraham Isaac

texts.es:
Abraham, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casado y vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija.

Abraham, tiene una sorbeteria desde hace 8 años, de la cual obtiene ingresos diarios para poder mantener a su familia. 

Abraham, esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar más variedad de sorbetes para ampliar su negocio y tener más clientes.

Abraham, sueña con tener la mejor sorbeteria de la comunidad donde vive y generar buenos ingresos para poder darle a su hijia una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
24-year-old Abraham studied until the eighth grade. He is married and lives with his wife and small daughter.

Abraham has had an ice cream parlor for 8 years, from which he gains daily income to be able to support his family.

Abraham is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of sherbets to expand his business and have more clients.

Abraham dreams of having a better ice cream parlor in the community where he lives, and generating a good income to be able to give his daughter a very good education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of sherbet to expand his business and have more clients.

loans.name: Luzlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luzlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Luzlyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Luzlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yurika Esther

texts.es: Yurika de 31 años es una valerosa mujer que en medio de una situación económica poco favorable para su familia, decidió iniciar su negocio con pequeños ahorros que lograba adquirir con los recursos que su cónyuge le aportaba para el sostenimiento del hogar. Apenas logró tener un monto suficiente, compró mercancías varias y víveres para la elaboración de hayacas, postres, pasabocas congelados y carnes frías, que promocionó entre sus vecinos de un barrio de Barranquilla, quienes la apoyaron en su iniciativa.  Hoy en día cuenta con dos años en esta actividad y ha logrado mejorar el ingreso y la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que está tan entusiasmada y desea continuar luchando por un mejor futuro.  A través de su negocio considera que tendrá la oportunidad de crecer y cumplir con su sueño de adecuar en su vivienda una miscelánea, pero eso se dará con el paso del tiempo, mientras tanto encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar sus surtido de carnes frías que son muy apetecidas por sus clientes y mucho más en las festividades que se aproximan.
texts.en:
Yurika, 31 years old, is a courageous woman who, in the middle of an unfavorable economic situation for her family, decided to start her business with small savings that she achieved acquiring with the resources that her partner contributed for the sustenance of the home. She hardly achieved having a sufficient amount, she bought various merchandise and supplies for making hayacas, desserts, frozen snacks and cold cuts that she sold among her neighbors in a neighborhood of Barranquilla, who supported her with her initiative.

Today, she has two years' experience in this activity and she's achieved improving the income and quality of life of her family. This is why she's so enthusiastic and wishes to continue fighting for a better future. Through her business, she considers that she will have the opportunity to grow and fulfill her dream of proportioning a general store in her home, but this will happen with the passing of time. Meanwhile she found in a Kiva loan the opportunity to link herself to the financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to improve her stock of cold cuts that are highly prized by her clients and much more so in the holidays that approach.

loans.use: to improve her stock of cold cuts that are highly prized by her customers.

loans.name: Kaliypa

texts.ru: Калийпа успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 4 коровы, 5 овец. На 1,68 Га земли выращивает люцерну и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход Калийпы составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калийпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Kaliypa successfully paid off her previous loan, having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her financially. She currently has four cows and five sheep on her farm as well as 1.68 hectares of land where she grows alfalfa and clover for her own use and for sale. Her monthly income is about 6,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Kaliypa has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase two cows to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to help bolster her income

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 27 membres fait partie du banc villageois  qui a été crée en mai 2011. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village qui sont très solidaires et très dynamiques. Elles s’activent dans le commerce et l’embouche.
SATOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et  mère de 5 enfants dont  deux garçons et trois  filles. Elle s’active dans le commerce. Elle tient une boutique dans son village.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter des biscuits, du thé, et du sucre pour 35 000 FCFA. Elle fait ça hebdomadairement pour renouveler son stock et satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec le reste, elle compte acheter des chaussures et des boucles d’oreilles pour une valeur de 50 000 FCFA tous les quinze jours.
Les bénéfices serviront à couvrir les charges familiales et personnelles  mais aussi payer la scolarité de ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group has 27 members and belongs to the banc villageois launched in May 2011. It is composed of women living in the same village. They show solidarity with each other and are very enterprising. They work as vendors and livestock farmers. Satou, the one on the right raising her let hand in the photo is the star borrower. Satou is 40 years old. She is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. She works as a vendor, keeping a store in her village.

With her loan, Satou plans to buy cookies, tea and sugar for 35,000 West African francs. She stocks up weekly in order to meet customer demand. She will use the rest to buy shoes and earring for 50,000 francs every two weeks.  Satou's revenues will help to cover family expenses and also pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy shoes, earrings, cookies, tea, and sugar.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Thanks to you, dear lenders. Romeo's previous loan of 8,000 PHP provided for additional raw ingredients in making "embotidos." Embotido-making is the processing of meat combined with hotdog, cheese, raisins, carrots and other ingredients.

Romeo chose to prepare and sell this delicious food because it's salable in his community in Batasan Hills, Quezon City. And he’s not mistaken. It is indeed a profitable enterprise.

Now he would like to add frozen foods such as sausages, hotdogs, ham and pork tocino. He also plans to buy a second-hand sewing machine to maximize his tailoring skills. He prays that you could lend him again an additional capital of 15,000 PHP. He wishes you more blessings and success in life.

He keeps on working hard to give his family a more secure future. He regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members to strengthen and inspire each other through the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients needed in making embutidos and frozen foods such as sausages, hotdogs, ham and pork tocino.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vivian is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Vivian has a fishing business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Vivian has been in this business for 20 years. Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
For many years now, Silveria has grown corn to cater to the needs and expenses of her household. She is a married woman and has five grown children.

Aside from farming, she also raises and sells pigs, which serves as supplemental income due to the price of commodities now adays. She is 61 years old and a resident in the town of Sierra, Bullones, Bohol.

She would like to improve her earnings and boost her business. She decided to join CEVI to access loans.

Silveria would like to invest in feed and fertilizer for the farm. In that way, she would be able to gain bountiful harvest and sell quality livestock. Therefore, she would be able to settle her obligation and manage her finances wisely. This will enable her to set aside some of the profit for future use.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to invest in feed and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Geralyn Vhie

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Thanks for being a great blessing to Geralyn. With your previous financial support, she has strengthened her buy-and-sell of tarpaulin covers and shoelaces resulting in a more profitable source of income. Also with that, she was able to add reusable shopping bags or tote bags which are in demand nowadays because of the intensive campaign to lessen the use of plastic bags. Plastic bags do not decompose easily, block the waterways, and cause flooding in the cities. These reusable shopping bags are intended to replace plastic bags.

Once again, Geralyn would like to ask your help. She's borrowing PHP 15,000 that will buy her a sufficient quantity of shopping bags in time for the Christmas season. More tarpaulin covers and shoelaces will also be added to her inventory. She hopes that you will trust her again because she has proven once that she's faithful in repaying. 

Geralyn aims to have a permanent place for her business. As of today, she's selling in a temporary space near a footbridge. 

She’s active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to pursue her goals through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a sufficient quantity of shopping bags in time for the Christmas season and to add more tarpaulin covers and shoelaces

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Good day to you lenders! Nenita extends her warm appreciation to you for your previous assistance worth 15,000 PHP. It has been utilized in purchasing an additional Piso Net unit, which consequently gave additional income for her family.

Now she still longs to continue improving her business. This is why she appeals for a 20,000 PHP loan this time. Again, she will buy another Piso Net unit.

In this way, she can gradually expand her business to meet the increasing demand of Internet users. Recently, she also ventured into a mineral water distribution service in her community. This additional endeavor will augment her family's daily expenditures and will surely boost her savings.

She has been consistent in repaying her previous loan, and she’s determined to maintain her integrity. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional Piso Net unit for her internet cafe, plus more containers of mineral water to resell.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is a 33 year old mother with 4 children. She runs and operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns and pork cake in her community to earn a living.
