loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of twistiest, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Sinar Dewi Group

texts.en:
Ida Ayu feels very grateful. She and the Sinar Dewi group successfully made their repayment. As they expected, all the pigs grew healthy, fat and sold out. They earned a satisfactory profit. The profits were used to fullfill their daily needs, school fees and saving.

In this new loan, Ida Ayu was chosen as the head again because she’s a responsible woman. After being evaluated by MUK’s staff, the Sinar Dewi group receives an increasing loan size. Each of them receive 1,500,000 IDR with total loan of 7,500,000 IDR for 5 members.

Ida Ayu will use her loan to purchase superior feed because she already has 2 sows. She bought piglets using her own money taken from the profit at the last loan period. She’s hopes she can increase her savings and later use it as business capital.

The Sinar Dewi group is a group of women and beside a pig breeder, they also have a multiple jobs, such as farming, kiosk, making religious article and services.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed only

loans.name: Kimpov

texts.en:
Kimpov, 40 years old, is a worker; her husband is a construction worker and is far away from his workplace. They live in the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. The daily profit for this couple is (USD) $15 a day.

Kimpov would like to request her first loan through Kiva to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to his work place.

She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
As a farmer from Kang Meas district, Kampong Cham province, Yat, 44 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. She is a hard-working mother of three children. She can earn approximately 5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than ten years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Yat is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and other related materials.

So she hopes that these materials will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Eun's Group

texts.en:
Eun, 43, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province and she has six children, two of whom are in school.

To support her living, she has been growing rice for 10 years. Moreover, she can get additional income via working for others for a fee, and her daughter also helps to earn income to support her family via working at a garment factory.

Her daily income is about 11 USD per day, and she can save around 5 USD each day after her expenses. Recently, her crop has not grown well since it was threatened by insects, which is the main challenge for her business.

She is now leading a group of four to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund and she will use her portion of loan to buy fertilizer and seed to grow her crop well so that she can sell it in higher price. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow her crop well, which will enable her to increase her income to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Marie Ange

texts.fr: Marie Ange, mariée, 46 ans et mère de deux enfants. Elle est dans la vente de vêtements et de chaussures. Elle exerce cette activité au centre-ville de Port-au-Prince depuis une vingtaine d’années. Depuis quelques temps elle a diversifié son stock en vendant aussi des ceintures. Estimant que les ceintures s’écoulent très rapidement, elle souhaite augmenter son stock pour mieux exploiter cette opportunité.
texts.en: Marie Ange is married, 46 years old and the mother of 2 children. She sells clothing and shoes. She has been doing this in the centre of the town of Port-au-Prince for around 20 years. A while back, she diversified her merchandise and started selling belts. As the belts seem to be selling very quickly, she would like to increase her inventory so that she can better exploit this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy shoes and belts for men.

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en:
Fuifui is 36 years old and has two children.

She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living.

Fuifui requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals, to help her run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Several months have passed and Triwana Sari Group was able to pay off its loan on time. In the journey of its business, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they get satisfactory results. Because they get satisfactory results, some of the members of the group got enough money for saving.

During this time their activities are monitored by the loan officer for their achievements and to serve as an example for other farmers. One member resigned after she had enough profit and continues her business with her own money.

Ni Komang sold all of her piglets and earned enough profit after other costs. She is a piglet seller now. From the profit she can fulfill her family's daily needs and save as well. She and all the member of the Triwana Sari send their greetings to all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the prices of feeds are high, the Triwana Sari group took a new loan. At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, two members couldn't attend the meeting because of religious ceremonies at the temple.

Each member gets 1,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed.

Ni Komang will use the loan to buy three superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease.

In the future, if she already has enough savings to venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and quality feed.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut successfully managed her group, Sari Karya. They made the repayments on time, and during the meeting they shared their success stories.

Ni Ketut is a piglet seller. She sold her piglets and earned money (9.500.000 IDR). After deducting the cost for feed, vitamins and other costs, she feels very happy. The profit was greater than before. Because she had enough profit, Ni Ketut continues the pig business with her own money and decided to resign her leadership of the group.

She said she is grateful to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her life. Now she can be independent in term of capital and she can raise pigs in the right way.

The group needed to choose a new head, and they chose Ni Putu as new head of the Sari Karya Group. Two members also decided to resign because they had successfully reached their goal to have their own capital.


With 11 members left, the Sari Karya group continue their loan, now with decreasing loan size. Ni Putu, the new head, was the Treasure of the group, use her portion of loan to purchase 3 piglets and feed. Ni Putu has 2 children and both of them still in elementary school. Beside as pig breeder, Ni Putu also has a smallkiosk in front of her house. With these 2 businesses, Ni Putu hopes to have more income to support her children education.

One member not in picture because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and feed.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy hails from the rural town of Antequera, Bohol. She makes native baskets and other native decorative items to earn a living. She is married and has two young children. Her husband has work that helps meet the needs of the entire family.

For the past many years now, she has been engaged in weaving baskets, serving a particular client who collects her finished products.

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to purchase materials like buli and nito (a kind of palm) and wicker (material that is pliable). These will help boost her income and continue to improve her financial gain.

These will continue to support her family and provide better living conditions.

Joy is hoping that someday she will be productive in her livelihood and continue to seek ways to make her work more efficient and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like  buli and nito (a kind of palm) and wicker (material that is pliable).

loans.name: Faly Parfait Daniel

texts.fr:
44 ans, Parfait est un brave père de deux enfants. Il est marié et sa femme est marchande de lait de vache. Son ainé, 18 ans, ne va plus à l'école mais l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité tandis que le second, 9 ans, est encore scolarisé.
Il dirige un magasin général depuis janvier 2014, Ledit magasin est ouvert avec l'appui de CEFOR. Le développement et l'extension de l'activité a encore besoin d'un fonds c'est pourquoi la raison de la demande de crédit. Avant 2014, il était instituteur à la campagne et n'habitait pas avec sa femme et ses enfants.
Le magasin se trouve dans un bon emplacement (au bord d'une route principale), il n'y pas de concurrents. La diversification des marchandises  est le moyen sur pour attirer des clients et pour la bonne marche de l'activité.
texts.en:
Parfait is good father to his two children. He is married and his wife sells cow's milk. His eldest son, who is 18, no longer attends school but instead helps Parfait with his business, while his second son, who is 9 years old, still goes to school.

Parfait has been running a general store since January of 2014. He opened his shop with the help of CEFOR. The development and expansion of his business requires more funds which is why he is requesting this loan. Before 2014, he was a teacher in rural areas and did not live with his wife and children.

His shop is in a good location (beside a main road) and he has no competitors. Diversification of his merchandise is the way to draw in customers and ensure good business.

loans.use: to buy flour, maize, pistachios, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria is a businesswoman and she has a kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as candles, noodles, eggs, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, cards, coffee, aqua, sugar, hand lotion, soft drinks and other things to sell.

Gliceria started her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $700. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy candles, noodles, eggs, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, cards, coffee, aqua, sugar, hand lotion, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Evalinda

texts.en:
Evalinda is a 34-year-old hardworking woman and the mother of two children. Deswita 8, is a third-grade elementary student, and Jeneta is 2 years old.

To support her husband in making money for her family, Evalinda initiated a business of selling vegetables at the market. She dreams to provide her children the proper education. Her dream led her to do anything for her children's future, including selling vegetables.

At the moment, she plans to enhance the stock by buying more kinds of vegetables such as water spinach, cabbage, chili, tomato, coriander, turmeric, etc. To do so, she seeks a loan for her business.

She was excited when she got information from a neighbor that TLM focuses on the small entrepreneurs who need business loan assistance. She then applied a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She is grateful that Kiva, via TLM, also cares for those who have a desire to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of vegetables such as water spinach, cabbage, chili, tomato, coriander, turmeric, etc.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a Samoan citizen. She is 68 years old, married, and has four children.

She owns and runs a canteen in her village and at schools. She has been running her business for nine years now. She has excellent repayment records.

Malo requested for a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and a box of sausage to help her run the business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to  buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and a box of sausage.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana was able to sustain her store through the untiring support of Kiva and its lenders. She has availed several loans in the past, which were faithfully paid back. She's very much thankful for your continuous support that encourages her to be more diligent in growing her business.

She aims to renovate and widen her store in order to accommodate more merchandise on display. For now she is asking your kind support amounting to PHP 40,000 to pay for stocks of groceries and beverages. She will also set aside some amount as seed money for her store widening.

Two of Susana's children are now in college while the youngest is still in elementary level. She hopes that her new loan request will be granted so its income can help meet the growing expenses of her family.

She plans to put up another store branch someday. She shares her aspiration with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. Every week, she meets up with them to draw strength and inspiration from sharing of testimonies and study of religion.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 40 years old, married and has three children. Two of her children are still in school. Lucia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lucia has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina sells vegetables. She is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will used this loan to buy more vegetables in another place. After she buys, she will bring the produce to the market to sell.

She started selling vegetables years ago with her own working capital of $25. Now she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, cabbage, leeks, onions and other things to sell.

Everyday her life is selling vegetables because she is earning a good income from it. She also has animals like cow, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, cabbage, leeks, onions and other things to sell.

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en: Loretta is a 50-year-old mother with 9 children. She operates a small business of selling pancake, buns and pork cake in her community to earn a living. Loretta requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags to assist her run the business. She will expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 48 years old and married. She has two children. Dina works very hard to provide for them.

Dina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc.

Dina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell.

Dina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old and married. She has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and she also earns additional income from her general store.

Maricel is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Kimheng

texts.en:
Kimheng is a farmer living in a rural area of Kampong Speu province. She is 39 years old and a mother of six children who are all in school.

She has been growing rice to support her family’s living for 21 years. To earn additional income, she and her husband work as construction workers as well. After offsetting her family’s expenses, Kimheng can save about 7 USD each day.

Because she lacks sufficient capital to support her children’s studying, she is now applying for a loan with VisionFund, and this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund. She fully repaid her past loan, which enabled her to better support her family's living.

She will use this new loan to pay for her son’s school fee. He is pursuing a bachelor's degree in engineering. She hopes that the second loan will enable her to keep sending her son to school until he graduates and gets a good job.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son, who is pursuing a bachelor's degree in engineering.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is 35 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are in school.

Analita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Analita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Analita has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia lives in Oecusse. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $150 USD.

She is requesting a loan of $700 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store: rice, sugar, coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, aqua, eggs, pens and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, aqua, eggs, pens, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maricar works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Maricar is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables like banana, papaya, coconut, sweet potato, etc. Maricar has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables like banana, papaya, coconut, sweet potato, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ES UNA PERSONA MAYOR DE EDAD SUFRE DE UNA ENFERMEDAD CRÓNICA, DEBIDO A ESTA ENFERMEDAD ACTUALMENTE PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES SEVEROS POR LO QUE  REQUIERE DE ALGUNAS INCRUSTACIONES Y CURACIONES PARA ALIVIAR LAS ÁREAS AFECTADAS. EL SEÑOR TRABAJA COMO MECÁNICO EN UNA EMPRESA, SIN EMBARGO SU RECURSOS SON INSUFICIENTES PARA SOLVENTAR EL TRATAMIENTO Y LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES.
texts.en:
He is an elderly man who suffers from a chronic illness. Due to this illness, he now has severe dental problems. He needs some inlays and treatment to relieve the affected areas.

He works as a mechanic for a company. However, he does not have enough resources to pay for the treatment and the family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José es un joven de 24 años de edad apasionado de la fotografía, el cual se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para hacer de su pasión un trabajo.
Es una persona humilde que quiere ayudar a su madre, a su padre a su familia, quiere trabajar para estudiar, por mejorar su situación económica.
Dicho apoyo será usado en la compra de una cámara profesional y demás artículos de fotografía, tales como; trípode, soportes, extensiones, flash, luces.
texts.en:
24-year-old Juan José is a young man, passionate about photography. He is requesting financial support to transform his passion into his job.

He is a humble person who wants to help his mother, his father, and his family. He wants to work to pay for his studies and improve his financial situation.

With this help, he will buy a professional camera and other photography supplies, such as a tripod, supports, extensiones, flashes, and lights.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera, a tripod, supports, extensions, flashes, ligths, etc.

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es:
Juan, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos que están en la escuela.

Juan, se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace ocho años y su esposa le ayuda a vender.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar cocos al por mayor y aprovechar la época de verano en donde obtendrán mayores ingresos.

Juan, sueña con comprar un camión y comprar cocos directamente a los productores.
texts.en:
Juan, 37, studied up to the second grade. He is married and has three children who go to school.

Juan has been selling coconuts for eight years, helped by his wife.

Juan needs the loan to buy coconuts in bulk, and take advantage of the summer season, when his income increases.

Juan dreams of buying a truck, and acquiring the coconuts directly from the producers.

loans.use: to buy coconuts in bulk now that summer is coming, and with it a higher income for him.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora que actualmente trabaja para mantener a su familia, padece de graves problemas dentales los cuales le  provocan fuertes dolores en las encías, así como migraña y mareos. Esto le ha afectado en su trabajo ya que varias veces se ha reporta incapacitada, debido a que el dolor es insoportable. Le preocupa porque no quisiera perder su trabajo ya que es el único sustento de su familia. El tratamiento que requiere le resulta costoso pues sus ingresos son mínimos.
texts.en: She currently works in order to support her family.  She suffers from severe dental problems that cause painful gums, migraines, and dizziness.  This has affected her in her work.  Several time she has been incapacitated for her work because the pain is unbearable.  This worries her because she does not want to lose her job.  She is the sole support of her family.  The treatment that she needs is very expensive, and her earnings are minimal.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre casada de 49 años de edad que todos los días se le levante con una sonrisa dibujada en el rostro, dispuesto a dar lo mejor de sí en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes.
Es un hombre que gusta del trabajo independiente, responsable y atento con su familia, su negocio es el único medio por el cual genera ingresos, por ello pone tanto empeño en sus actividades diarias.
El principal sueño de Jaime es tener salud para salir todos los días a atender su negocio.
Actualmente el cliente se encuentra solicitando para cancelar un crédito anterior y abastecer su negocio con un completo surtido de productos de la canasta familiar principalmente cerveza, quiere tener todo listo para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 49-year-old married man who wakes up every day with a smile on his face, ready to work as hard as he can in his grocery store.

He is a man who enjoys working independently, and he is responsible and attentive to his family. His business is the only means through which he earns an income. This is why he works so hard every day.

His biggest dream is to be healthy so that he can go out and work every day.

He is currently requesting a loan to pay off a loan he had and stock his business with different essential products, especially with beer. He wants to be ready for the end-of-year season.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock his store.

loans.name: Mirna Clalia

texts.es:
Mirna, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos.

Mirna, desde hace cinco años trabaja como asesora de belleza de los productos avon; ella aprendió cuando una amiga le pidió que le ayudara a ofrecer el producto y decidió independizarse.

Mirna, necesita el préstamo para comprar vitrinas y colocar un puesto en el mercado para ofrecer sus productos de belleza.

Mirna, sueña con darles a sus hijos la educación necesario para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 43, went to school through the ninth grade. She is a single mother, and she has three children. Mirna has been working as a beauty consultant selling Avon products for five years. She learned when a friend asked her to help sell the product, and she decided to become independent.

Mirna needs the loan to buy display cases and to set up a stand at the market to sell her beauty products. Mirna dreams of giving her children the education they need to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy display cases and to set up a stand at the market to sell her beauty products.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria has been engaged in basket weaving for many years now. These help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her household. She is 47 years old, a married woman and has two children, of whom one is still attending school.

Her husband's way of living is through farming. He grows and sells rice. Her income goes for food and school fees.

She has requested a loan to buy materials like nito, oway and buli (a variety of palm that is dried and mainly used for weaving baskets). These could help enhance her source of income and slowly enable her to settle her obligation. In that way, she could start to save half of the profit for future use, while the other half would be for business expansion.

Candelaria is thankful for the funds and is determined to improve her current livelihood to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito, oway and buli (a variety of palm that is dried and mainly used for weaving baskets).

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nida is 55 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Nida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business.

Nida has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marieta is 48 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Marieta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Marieta has been in this business for 19 years. Marieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gina is 51 years old, and four of her children are presently in school.

Gina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gina has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yarcelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ella es Yarcelly, es una mujer cabeza de familia que sueña con una mejor vida, ella a pesar de que no tuvo muchas oportunidades laborales nunca se resignó y persevero para trabajar, ahora ella cuenta con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual representa el 100% de los ingresos en su casa y trabaja diariamente 10 horas para conservar ese negocio que con tanto esfuerzo ha ido edificando.
Todos los días sale con el pensamiento de ser mejor empresaria, aumentar sus ventas, clientes, ingresos, posicionarse en el corazón y mente de sus clientes.
La señora Yarcelly solicita un préstamo para mejorar y aumentar el surtido en su tienda, con productos como cervezas, energizantes, panela, arroz, aceite, productos enlatados, carnes frías etc.
texts.en:
This is Yarcelly, who is the head of her family and dreams of a better life. Despite not having many opportunities to work, she persevered and has now a grocery store, which generates 100% of her income. She works ten hours every day to keep her store afloat after having worked so hard to open it.

She leaves home every day thinking of becoming a better entrepreneur, increasing her sales, attracting more customers, increasing her income, and gaining a place in her customers' hearts and minds.

Yarcelly is requesting a loan to improve and increase her offer, with products such as beer, energy drinks, raw sugar, rice, vegetable oil, canned food, and cold cuts.

loans.use: to have more products, such as beer, energy drinks, raw sugar, rice, vegetable oil, canned food, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her three children.

Kiva lenders, meet Aniceta, one of the most hardworking women on planet Earth. She is 46 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Mwimbi, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Aniceta has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 10 years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through a personal business. Aniceta is content with the farming way of life.

Aniceta is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal.

The Nkubu area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being an elderly woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Aniceta feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her.

Aniceta is well disciplined with finances, and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college. Please help Aniceta so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her three children.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 53 years old and married.

Felicidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

Felicidad has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Savorng

texts.en:
Savorng, the village chief of Teab Srov village, lives with his wife and child. His wife is in this picture with him, standing in the backyard of their house. Savorng has three adult children as well who live separately. He is a farmer and spent many days and time raising his four children. Savorng wants to live a comfortable life. His family uses a rechargeable battery for home energy that needs to be charged every week.

Savorng is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. His family has difficulties using a car battery to supply power. Savorng believes solar home energy will enhance his lifestyle so he can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar system

location.town: Teab Srov Village, Banteay Preal Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucely es una mujer soltera cabeza de familia de 41 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ollas, enseres ya artículo de cocina.
Ella siempre ha trabajado muy duro pro sacar su hogar adelante, ahora que tiene una hija de 17 años de edad próxima a entrar a la universidad y como buena madre quiere hacerle realidad ese deseo a su hija que tanto la apoyado, en el hogar incluso en el trabajo.
Por este motivo esta mujer espera recibir el apoyo, quiere crecer como empresaria, todo por su hija y por el futuro de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lucely, 41, is a single mother, head of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy pots, essential items, and kitchen utensils.

She has always worked very hard to get ahead with her family. She has a 17-year-old daughter who will soon start her university studies. As any good mother, she wants to help her achieve her dreams, and has always supported her at home and even at work.

This is why this woman hopes to receive your support. She wants to grow as an entrepreneur, thinking of her daughter and the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy pots, essential items, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Hillaria

texts.en:
A large percentage of the people living in Kenya, particularly the Nkubu area of Kenya, are poor, with the women bearing the brunt of it. Measures to be taken so as to reduce this trend require a concerted effort. It’s against this backdrop that Juhudi Kilimo decided to commit its energy in eradicating poverty by making loans available to women smallholder farmers.

Lenders! The above picture presents to you Hillaria, 45 years of age. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a proud mum, and has been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Her primary source of income is crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Hillaria loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow, and she really takes good care of her dairy cows.

The Nkubu area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming: good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Hillaria wants to take advantage of this and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

Through her improved income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her family. The financial benefits that Hillaria will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits. Support this loan to a farmer from a Kenyan remote area who has great dreams for her family!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en:
Sam Ol, a government officer, lives in Teab Srov with his wife and two children.

Besides working for the government, Sam Ol's family runs many businesses. He owns two hectares of land and also a feeding farm. His wife sells vegetables at home; therefore, they need to get up early to prepare their shop before the sun rises.

Currently, they use a car battery to provide their business with energy; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes a car battery runs out during the nighttime. After getting good recommendations from a neighbour who uses solar home systems, Sam Ol decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve the energy to run his business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Teab Srov Village, Banteay Preal Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with four children. For almost five years, Elizabeth has owned and managed a general store. She earns a net income of 1,000 PHP daily. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, salt, soy sauce, fish sauce, and vinegar to sell. She will use her loan to provide capital for these purchases. Elizabeth is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, salt, soy sauce, fish sauce, and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Eiliene

texts.en:
Eiliene is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eiliene is 42 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Eiliene has a buying and selling of personal collections business in the Philippines. Eiliene requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products like beauty soap, perfume, body lotion, toothpaste and other personal care products.

Eiliene has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products like beauty soap, perfume, body lotion, toothpaste and other personal care products

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is married and works hard to support her family. For the past four years, she has raised livestock in the Philippines. Cristita successfully repaid her previous loan.

Cristita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to further build her livestock business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Floricel

texts.en:
Floricel is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Floricel works very hard to provide for them.

Floricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Floricel has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary pads, biscuits, noodles, eggs, etc.

In the future, Floricel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tani Makmur Group

texts.en:
Ole is 40-year-old farmer who leads the Tani Makmur Group. They are standing in front of a biodigester. Ole has a family with one child and lives in a small village in Rembang, the northern coast region of Central Java, Indonesia.

Ole strives to improve his family's economic conditions. He has a few cows to fatten and resell, and also runs a rice farming business. His business is going quite well. However, he was deeply concerned to see the high price and scarcity of non-renewable cooking gas and to see cow dung pollute their water canal.

After an introduction by Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and At-Tayseer Foundation (a local educational foundation – biogas construction partner of YRE) about the household biogas (BIRU) program, Ole saw that biogas is the best solution for his problem. He saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non-renewable cooking gas and chemical fertilizers. He became more confident after he heard the testimony from members of Trapoh Group, which is also a Kiva borrower group.

In order to make it happen, Ole invited four of his farmer friends to establish a farmer group. He is keen to purchase a biodigester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and the other farmer group members to make it possible.

Ole is optimistic that if he can build a biodigester, he can use the biogas for cooking, and bioslurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He hopes that in the future, he can invite all farmers in his village to use biogas.

loans.use: to build a biodigester facility and to utilize biogas residue as an organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old and a widowed woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. For the past five years, she has run a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. Rose is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of any kind of recycled materials to sell. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy any kind of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old and married with four children. For the past 10 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed two previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Dolores is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with three children. Helen is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a buy-and-sell native mats and broom sticks business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to her customers.

Helen has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zulma Yessenia

texts.es:
Zulma de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta  tercer grado, actualmente esta soltera y no tiene hijos, por lo tanto solo vive con su madre.


Desde los 10 años, Zulma se dedica  a la venta de  tamales, empandas, atol, tablillas, etc. cuenta que su mamá le enseñó todo esto que ahora hace lo cual le sirve para mantenerse, para la elaboración de los tamales ella se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana, durante el día prepara el producto y sale a venderlo en la tarde de casa en casa.

El crédito será invertido para comprar maíz, frijol, pollo, plátanos, aceite, leña y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de los productos comestibles que vende


Sus sueños son tener su propia y tener un puesto donde vender para ya no tener que caminar grandes distancias de casa en casa.
texts.en:
Zulma, 23, studied up to the third grade. She is currently single and has no children, so she lives with her mother.

Zulma has been selling tamales, empanadas, atol [a traditional hot corn- and masa-based beverage], chocolate blocks, etc. since she was ten years old. She says that her mother taught her everything she knows, which is useful for her sustenance. She wakes at 04:00 in the morning to prepare the tamales. She prepares them and sells them, door-to-door, during the day.

She will use this loan to buy corn, beans, chicken, plantains, cooking oil, firewood, and everything she needs to prepare the food she sells.

She dreams of having her own house and a stall where she can sell her food without having to walk long distances from home.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, plantains, cooking oil, firewood, and everything she needs to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 50 years old and married with ten children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

Conchita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell ready-to-wear.

Conchita aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with three children. Hilda is 39 years old and her three children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Hilda has a native bags making business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Hilda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 7 meses, y su negocio es el servicio de internet y juegos en red.
Ella es inteligente, alegre y muy emprendedora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Antonio’ caracterizada por encontrarse entre los barrios más alejados de la urbe y donde recientemente se embovedó el río para construir el camino encima.
Karen es de tez morena, ojos pardos y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español, su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la atención de un cibercafé donde brinda el servicio de internet y juegos en red, “si bien el negocio ya no es como antes, existe un mercado adulto que no usa smartfones y tablets, ellos son mis clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de impresora y equipos de computación. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y mejorar su calidad de vida, ella desea comprar 2 equipos de computación y una impresora multifunción. Esta es la 1secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Karen solicita un préstamo para comprar una impresora y computadoras para su cibercafé.
texts.en:
Karen is a 19-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, and has a seven-month-old son. She offers internet and online-gaming services.

She is a smart, joyful, and enterprising woman. Her business is located in San Antonio, an area located far from the city. The river was recently channelized, and a road will be build over it.

Karen has dark complexion, brown eyes, and is thin. Her mother tongue is Aymará, and she speaks it at home. She speaks Spanish at work. She lives with her parents, who work, in a brick and cement house with a corrugated iron roof, served with drinking water, electricity, and sewage.

She has an internet café where she offers internet and online-gaming services. "Although the business is not what it used to be, there is a market for adults who use smartphones and tablets; those are my clients..." she says. The advantage is that she has a fixed client base. The disadvantage is that she does not have a printer and some desktop computers. She dreams of having her own house, and improving her living conditions.

She wants to buy two computers and a multi-function printer. This the first loan she requests at the institution since she started her business one year ago. This is why Karen is requesting a loan to buy a printer and computers for her internet café.

loans.use: to buy a printer and computers for her internet café.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 45 años de edad,  casada, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 18 años y 2 hijas de 10 y 15 años, y su negocio es la producción de queso.
Ella es humilde, fuerte y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Huatajata’ dónde los pobladores viven de la agricultura y la pesca, ubicado en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca.
Maria es de baja estatura, tez morena y cabello largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como empleado de la fuerza naval y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que sólo cuenta con energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la producción de queso. Actividad que inició hace más de 10 años cuando se construyó el mercado del lugar, “vendemos desde la madrugada, los días de feria me despierto a las 3 de la mañana para transportar los quesos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es independiente y puede atender a sus hijos al mismo tiempo, la desventaja es la falta de leche para producir constantemente. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella desea comprar 2 teneros para criarlos y mejorar la producción de leche. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en más de 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar 2 terneros para criarlos y aumentar su producción de leche.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old, married, and has two sons aged 13 and 18, and two daughters aged 10 and 15. She earns her living making cheese. Maria is a simple woman, strong and hardworking. Her business is located in the Huatajata area where the local people live off agriculture and fishing around the sacred lake Titicaca.

Maria is short, with a dark complexion, and has long plaited hair. She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl, skirt) and her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish for other purposes. Her husband works for the navy; her children attend school. They live in their own house made of adobe which has electricity.

Maria began her cheese-making business more than ten years ago when the local market was built. She starts selling in the early morning. On market days she gets up at 3 am to transport the cheese. The good thing about her business is that she is independent and can look after her children at the same time. One problem is the lack of a constant milk supply. Her dream is to improve her standard of living.

For this reason, Maria wishes to buy two calves to raise and thus increase milk production.

This is her first loan with the institution in the ten years she's had her business.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise and increase milk production

loans.name: Piramide Group

texts.en:
Eight women in the department of Quetzaltenango decided to get together and form the “Pirámede,” or “Pyramid” trust bank, determined to build up their dreams, making them a reality. These women range from 47 to 52 years old, and some sell tortillas, others sell beauty products, or run convenience stores, and others embroider and embellish clothing.

Blanca, a 47-year-old mother of four children, is serving as the elected group treasurer. She has a business fabricating skirts, blouses, bedspreads, and bags. To meet the demand for her product, she has joined Friendship Bridge in search of a loan that will enable her to buy many rolls of fabric so that she can produce her clothing on a grander scale, taking advantage of this festive season at the end of the year to increase her sales.

On behalf of her group, Blanca thanks the trusting Kiva lenders, and assures them that their investments are well-used for the growth of micro-businesses and the development of determined women and their families. Thanks, Kiva!

loans.use: to buy many rolls of fabric so that she can produce her clothing on a grander scale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Hello! This is Pauline, a happy, humble, hard-working, 42-year-old woman. She gets up every day at 5 o’clock in the morning to go and till her farm. She also has a side, hustle business (cyber cafe and printing shop).

Pauline lives in Kagumo, a remote village in Kerugoya. She is happily married and has two children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, Pauline will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, to permanently change her living conditions, and to secure the future of her school-going children.

Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Stella, who is 31 years of age. She is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Itagururu, a remote village in Chuka. She is happily married and has two children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Ukux Kem Group

texts.en:
Marisela, a young woman of 19 years of age, was only able to complete a third-grade education due to the poverty she grew up in. She began working at an early age to support her parents and contribute to the costs in her home. Now, she has found the opportunity to join “Ukux Kem” trust bank in the department of Totonicapán, where she lives, receiving her first micro-loan.

With the desire to transcend the limitations she has come up against in her life, and the constant support of her mother, Marisela has started a business embroidering beautiful “cortes,” or skirts traditional to Totonicapán. Right now, she is resorting to Friendship Bridge, soliciting a loan with which she plans to buy two tying tools for her loom, so that she can continue embroidering more products, increasing her capacity, taking advantage of this festive season when customers tend to buy her products for their graduation and end-of- the-year parties.

All of the women of Ukux Kem, like Marisela, feel fortunate to be considered by Kiva lenders who believe in them and support them in the progress of their businesses. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy two tying tools for her loom so that she can continue embroidering more products.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.en:
In San Juan el Mirador, a rural community on the outskirts of the municipality of San Lucas Tolimán, Sololá in Western Guatemala, live the women of “Golondrinas” Trust Bank. San Juan is an area between Lago Atitlán and the coastal region of Guatemala, with a hot climate, on the edge of a deep canyon, refreshed by a rushing river below. Most of the Golondrinas between the ages of 25 and 65 years old, grew up in this beautiful place and the majority of them did not have access to education.

Brenda is 29 years old and has been with Friendship Bridge for 3 years. She is a motivated single mother who completed her high school degree in pedagogy and now manages her own store, selling items for daily consumption, snacks such as tamales, and also has a meat and vegetable market.

With her new loan, Brenda plans to invest in Christmas merchandise for her store such as apples, grapes and sweets, as well as dishes and other party supplies to sell. She will also buy basic daily items such as rice, beans and soda to restock her supply and satisfy the demands of her customers.

This woman is happy to be part of Friendship Bridge and now Kiva. During these years she was able to use her profit to buy a new stove for her home, improving the life of her 5-year-old daughter, who is now starting school. Brenda dreams of gaining more business and sales in her store, expanding with each loan she receives.

The ladies of “Golondrinas” Trust Bank are mothers of between one and five children who are in school. Some have husbands, and others are single mothers, taking care of their families on their own, with strength and determination. To provide for their needs and create better opportunities for their children, the women have a variety of businesses, selling snacks such as chuchitos, little tamales, ice cream and cold drinks, running tortillerías, buying and selling clothes, managing convenience stores and markets selling chicken, vegetables and dairy products.

Thanks to Kiva investors, this dream is tangible!

loans.use: to invest in Christmas merchandise for her store such as apples, grapes and sweets, as well as dishes and other party supplies to sell.

loans.name: Union Maya Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Union Maya” is located in Panimache, a rural area of Chichicastenango, and is composed of eight women. Trust Banks, groups of 7-30 women, help the women overcome obstacles together, learn valuable life skills and share what they learn with each other and their families. They agree to take responsibility for each other’s loans and there is a 99% payback rate! The ladies of “Union Maya” have small businesses including the sale of chickens and pigs, vegetables and fruits, textiles and a bakery. They all have large families.

Lucia is the 39-year-old secretary of “Union Maya”. She is married with five children. Lucia has a textile business and weaves traditional blouses called “huipiles” that are hand-woven and sometimes heavily decorated with embroidered designs. Each town has its own unique design and they are quite beautiful. Lucia also has an animal husbandry business and raises pigs and chickens.

She is requesting a loan to purchase various colors of high quality thread (some silk and wool) as well as other supplies for the business.

The vision of these women is to generate enough income to sustain and expand their small businesses, invest in the education of their children and take care of the needs of their families. They also want to empower themselves.

KIVA investors are highly valued by these women in providing capital for these much needed loans. They have begun their journey toward a better future for themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase various colors of high quality thread (some silk and wool) as well as other supplies for the business.

loans.name: Claudia Yovanna

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de vísceras e intestinos de res.
Ella es amable, conversadora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en un mercado muy popular de la zona central, caracterizado por ser el mercado más antiguo de la ciudad, donde los domingos cierran las calles de su alrededor para dar paso a la feria.
Claudia es de tez morena, cabello corto castaño y usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia, para el comercio habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte interprovincial y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de vísceras de res, ésta son utilizadas para realizar comidas tradicionales como tripitas, milanesa de hígado, ají de lengua, panza rebosada y otros, “las vísceras como las demás carnes tienen ventas continúas, además de ser carne barata son muy populares dentro de la cocina común…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene ventas continuas, la desventaja es la falta de herramientas de trabajo. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ella desea comprar utensilios de carnicería como, cuchillo carnicero, balanza y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar utensilios de carnicería para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 47-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a ten-year-old son. She sells cow innards. She is a kind, talkative, and hardworking woman. She works at a very popular marketplace located in the center of the town. This market is known for being the oldest one in town. The streets that surround it are closed every Sunday to give room to the fair.

Claudia has dark complexion and short brown hair, and uses glasses. Her mother tongue is Aymará. She speaks it at home, while she speaks Spanish at work. She shares her life with her husband, who works as an intermunicipal driver, and her son, who goes to school. Her family owns the house where she lives, which is built with brick and cement, and served with drinking water, electricity, and sewage.

She sells cow innards, which are used to prepare traditional food, such as "tripitas", breaded liver, tongue stew, battered stomach, etc. "Innards, as any other type of meat, are sold continuously. Besides being cheap, they are very popular for traditional cooking..." she says. The advantage is that her sales are continuous, the disadvantage is the lack of tools to do her work. She dreams of having her own house.

She wants to buy butchering tools such as a butchering knife, and a scale. This is the first loan she requests at the institution since she opened her business one year ago. This is why Claudia is requesting a loan to buy butchering tools to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy butchering tools to improve her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Chajnes Group

texts.en:
San Juan Sacatepéquez is a town surrounded by fields of flowers, corn, beans, sugar cane, coffee and vegetables. Many of the farmers, who work hard in these fields, take their cultivated crops to Guatemala City where they can sell them for the most income, especially the beautiful, multi-colored flowers that visitors find to be quite economical.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Luchadoras Chajnes" (shown here) was formed by 12 visionary women who share the common dream of empowering themselves and their families. Their average age is 40 years old and the ladies have large families.

The President of the Trust Bank is Aura, who is 38 years old and has a weaving business. Her parents did not permit her to go to school since school was not necessary for girls. Instead, she stayed home and helped with the household chores.

However, this did not limit Aura because she had a vision of who she wanted to be. She is now a competent weaver of “cortes” (traditional wrap around skirts), and huipiles (ornately embroidered and woven traditional blouses). She also raises chickens and pigs. Aura is requesting a loan to buy various colors and textures of thread as well as more traditional clothing to sell.

A majority of the 22,000 clients of Friendship Bridge have had little or no formal education and are just like Aura. Non-formal education is the backbone of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of the organization (loans + education).

Friendship Bridge is very pleased to collaborate with partners like KIVA to provide loans for these ladies. With their new tools, the women are taking steps toward a brighter and happier future benefitting themselves, their families and their community of San Juan Sacatepequez.

Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to buy various colors and textures of thread as well as more traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hershey Mae

texts.en:
Hershey Mae was able to sustain her processed meat retailing business through Kiva's help and its lenders. It allowed her to provide for her family's daily needs. She thanks everyone for their moral and financial support of her livelihood.

To grow her sales, she is once again seeking your assistance for PHP 30000, which she will use to buy more quantities of marinated pork, marinated beef, hot dogs, bacon etc. Parents send them with their schooling children as their "baon" (packed lunch or packed snack), and they are the favorite breakfast as well of the middle class families in her community. She now has regular customers who patronize her products.

Hershey Mae plans to acquire a big freezer and to have her own place at their town market. She trusts God to bless her undertakings and lives a happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: To buy various kinds of processed meat to sell.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 63 years old and has five children. Amada is a married woman.

Amada is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Amada requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amada has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser's entertainment center is still doing well. Thanks to his first loan, he added a Play-Station machine and two new display screens to the center, which had a very positive impact on his clients and made him very proud. He still lives alone and is relying on himself to see his business grow.

After a first positive experience, Yaser is asking for a new loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. This time, he needs 3,083,000 LBP, to redecorate the center for the first time since he established it. In this way, he will be able to keep his customers satisfied, sustain his business, and see his income increase.

loans.use: to redecorate his entertainment center

loans.name: Lalanirina Prisca

texts.fr:
Prisca est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant (encore bébé) pas encore scolarisé.  Son mari est ouvrier. Elle était ménagère auparavant, et la dureté de la vie la poussait à exercer une activité génératrice de revenu pour aider son mari à entretenir le ménage et supporter la famille.
Elle dirige un taxi-phone depuis 2013 et elle voudrait étendre l'activité, en proposant d'autres articles. Le but de la demande de crédit est pour la vente d'yaourt et de jus naturel pendant cette saison chaude. C'est elle même qui va les préparer et les fabriquer ces nouveaux produits.
texts.en:
Prisca is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has one child (a baby) who is not yet in school. Her husband is a labourer. Previously she was a homemaker, but daily hardship has pushed her to find an income-generating activity to help her husband to maintain the household and support the family. 

She has run a taxi phone [a stall where you can make telephone calls] since 2013 and would like to extend this business by offering other items. The aim for this loan request is to sell yoghurt and natural fruit juice during the hot season. She plans on preparing and making these new products herself.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, fruit, sugar and a cooler.

loans.name: Unidas De Las Ruinas Group

texts.en:
Zaculeu is a pre-Columbian Maya archaeological site in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It was the capital of the Mam kingdom. It is outside of the modern city of Huehuetenango. The area displays a rich collection of Mam and K’iche style architecture.

Eleven entrepreneurial and hard-working women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Unidas de las Ruinas” or “United from the Ruins”. Their average age is 40 and most of them have studied through primary school.

The ladies have various businesses that include a convenience store and a food business making and selling “corn tostadas”. This is a dish that is perfect for both a local or the wandering tourist.

Alicia, a member of the Trust Bank who has this business, reports that it is prospering. Three or four times each week, she sends her delicious tostadas to the local market and other locales in her town. She is requesting a loan for her tostada business to buy corn, oil and other supplies, including containers for them. She wants to increase her clientele.

Alicia is 39 years old and married with has four children who are fortunate to be in elementary school, as well as high school. She is keenly aware of the value of a good education. Most of the ladies in the Trust Bank have gone to elementary school. All of the women benefit from the educational component of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and education. Education is fundamental to helping the women gain empowerment and achieve financial stability.

The ladies of “Unidas de las Ruinas” are taking steps each day toward a more prosperous and brighter future. KIVA investors are valued partners with Friendship Bridge in this effort. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy corn, oil and other supplies including containers for her tostada business

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Thanh is 39 years old and she is married. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a stall to sell fruit for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

In 2013, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 25 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la fabricación de colchones de paja, 
Él es emprendedor, decidido y muy constante, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chuquiaguillo’ caracterizado por encontrarse un bosque del mismo nombre donde se realizan caminatas, excursiones y camping de fin de semana.
Juan es moreno, de cabello negro corto y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español para su negocio, su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que se dedica al comercio, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de colchones de paja, comúnmente llamados ‘payasas’ son muy populares por su bajo costo y se utilizan para descansar y como asiento, la labor comienza cortando la paja para almacenarla y secarla, luego se la junta y se teje a mano hasta darle solidez y anchura, “vendo payasas según el tamaño y la medida, las de una plaza se venden más rápido porque se utilizan para otras cosas como asiento también…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los materiales que utiliza son de bajo costo, la desventaja es la falta de transporte para sus colchones. Su sueño es lograr tener una casa propia, él desea comprar una motocicleta para transportar sus colchones hasta su puesto de venta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta para transportar colchones de paja.
texts.en:
Juan is a 25-year-old man. He is single and has no children. He works making straw mattresses. Juan is an enterprising, determined, and tenacious man. He works in "Chuquiaguillo," an area known for being located in a forest with the same name, where people go to walk, hike, and camp during the weekends.

Juan is dark-skinned, has black short hair, and is short. His mother tongue is Aymará. He speaks it at home, while he speaks Spanish at work. He lives with his parents, who are businesspeople. She lives in a house built with adobe, served with drinking water, electricity, and sewage.

He makes straw mattresses, also called "payasas," which are very popular for being cheap. They are used for resting and sitting. The first thing he does is cutting the straw to store it and dry it. Then, he puts it together and sews it by hand until it is solid and wide. "I sell payasas in different sizes and measures. The ones made for one person are easier to sell, because they are also used for sitting..." he says. The advantage is that the materials he uses are cheap, the disadvantage is that he lacks transport means for his mattresses. He dreams of having his own house.

Juan wants to buy a motorcycle to transport his mattresses to the place where he sells them. This is his first loan with the institution since he started his business one year ago. This is why Juan is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to transport straw mattresses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport straw mattresses.

loans.name: Huệ's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 60 years old and she is married with two children. She has operated a food stall selling vegetables for more than 10 years. Huệ lives in Ha Trung district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables and resell them. In 2014, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Huệ's group, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and resell them.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi is a 22-year-old single man living in Ramtha. Shadi is studying for his bachelor's degree in solar energy technology and is ‎in his fourth year, Shadi`s dad runs his own business. Shadi is applying for a loan to cover the rest of the ‎semester fees. Shadi`s problem is financial difficulties, therefore he applied for an educational loan to pay for his university ‎fees. Shadi has a future plan to work in his field of study.

loans.use: to pay for his university ‎fees

loans.name: Radharani's Group

texts.en:
Water plays a vital role for the sustenance of a human life.No water means no life. 

Gitanjali, the lady standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a resident of Aanandpur, Odisha, India. The area does not have a proper source of drinking water and people often become ill due to water-borne diseases. In order to avoid unnecessary medical expenses and protect and safeguard her family's health, Gitanjali along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier so that she can get clean safe water to drink.

Gitanjali is eagerly awaiting your kind help to protect her family's health.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier

loans.name: Kamini's Group

texts.en:
Water is indispensable for survival. No water means no life.But water from inappropriate sources may be hazardous to life.

Kamini, the lady standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a resident of Aanandpur, Odisha, India. The area does not have a proper source of drinking water and people often become ill due to water-borne diseases.
