In order to avoid unnecessary medical expenses and protect and safeguard her family's health, Kamini along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.

She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier and some water pipes in order to facilitate smooth water supply so that she can get clean safe water to drink.Kamini is eagerly awaiting your kind help to protect her family's health.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier and some water pipes in order to facilitate smooth water supply

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en: In the distant corner of the country lies the village of Aanandpur in Odisha, India where the primary source of occupation remains farming and allied activities. Basanti is one amongst many farmers who fight against erratic weather patterns as well as irrigation difficulties day in and day out while ensuring that a better crop is produced, family needs are met and their children can afford to go to school. She is a widow and is the sole breadwinner in her family.Now, it is that time of the year again when Basanti needs financial support. With the latest paddy crop being harvested in a short span of time, she needs funds to prepare the land, buy quality fertilizers, pay off the labour and buy a disease-resistant variety of seeds for her next year's yield. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.Basanti is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to prepare the land, buy quality fertilizers, pay off the labour and buy a disease-resistant variety of seeds for her next year's yield.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Sita is a simple lady who hails from a very poor and low income household from a small village in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and resides with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is the sole earner in her family and works very hard to be able to make ends meet for her family. The income earned by her husband is only hand to mouth for them. Unfortunately, Sita does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites and she is vulnerable to crimes.In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene, Sita is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR. She will use the loan amount to install a hand pump and build a toilet in her house.Your loan will help Sita to enjoy a healthy and disease-free life.

loans.use: to install a hand pump and build a toilet in her house

loans.name: Bendecido Group

texts.en:
The famous markets of Chichicastenango, held on Thursdays and Sundays, draw tourists from throughout the world. The usually quiet town with adobe houses and cobblestone streets, becomes flooded with tourists, as well as locals. The market has existed for centuries and has been one of the largest and most important in the Maya region. Vendors sell vegetables, fruits, flowers, pottery, dishes, fabrics, wood carvings, machetes, and masks. Beautiful traditional clothing is sold here as well.

Nine women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Bendecido” or “Blessed”. They chose this name as they feel blessed to be alive and healthy and to have their families. They share that they feel blessed twice to have access to a loan.

Gloria is 24 years old, married and a member of the Trust Bank. She has a bakery business and also makes and sells the beautiful embroidered and woven traditional blouses called “huipiles”. Those from Chichicastenango are among the most beautiful in Guatemala. She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, flour and eggs for her bakery business, as well as supplies for her textile business including high quality thread in various colors. She is very hopeful that KIVA investors will fund the loan.

The educational component of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge (small loans + education) is an effective vehicle for the women to create a brighter and more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community. Education is essential in helping the ladies gain empowerment and achieve financial stability

Gloria and her friends in the Trust Bank share a vision of a different future for their children and opportunities. Through the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, they are slowly stepping into a more prosperous future benefiting themselves and their families.

KIVA investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge in this effort! Thank you!

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and eggs for her bakery business, as well as supplies for her textile business.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Maida continúa con su negocio de venta de horneados tradicionales (de pie, la segunda de la izquierda, detrás de la señora con bebe). El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando harina, queso levadura, leche y otros insumos de cocina, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar sin molestias. Actualmente la banca sigue trabajando de manera permanente, los negocios mejoraron, crecieron y se expandieron, Maida preside la banca, “logré comprar bastante harina para que me alcance buen tiempo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina para trabajar a diario. Su sueño es tener una panadería, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina por mayor y una garrafa de gas licuado. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maida solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina y una garrafa para hornear pan tradicional.
texts.en:
Maida continues with her business selling traditional baked products (she is the one standing, second from the left, behind the lady holding the baby).

The loan she received was used to buy flour, cheese, yeast, milk and other cooking supplies. She made her loan payments on time because she was able to work without any problems. Currently, this bank group continues to work full time, the businesses improved, grew and expanded. Maida is president of this bank, "I was able to buy enough flour to use for a long time" she comments. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of cooking supplies to work with each day.

Her dream is to have a bakery. She would like to purchase cooking supplies in bulk and a liquid gas container. This is the fourth loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years she has been working. For this reason Maida is requesting the loan, to purchase cooking supplies and a container to bake traditional breads.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies and a container to bake traditional bread.

loans.name: Dominantes Group

texts.es:
Gueisa es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 12 años y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, conversadora y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores, inmigrantes del oriente y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del lugar y crearon un clúster de producción manufacturera.
Gueisa es de tez morena, cabello castaño y físico robusto (sentada a la izquierda, viste blusa blanca con flores en los hombros), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la hicieron liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; cerrajería, pintura de interiores, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de empanadas, verdulería y frutería. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, una de sus comidas es la ‘patasca’ que es una sopa que se cocina con la cabeza del cerdo y se dice que sirve para curar la resaca, “cocina comida tradicional porque es lo que se hacer desde niña…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida tradicional es muy popular y demandada, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina como carne, aceite, fideo arroz, yuca y otros. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante para vender toda clase de comida, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina.  Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gueisa solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar comida tradicional.
texts.en:
34-year old Gueisa lives with her partner and their two children aged 4 and 12. She earns her living selling meals. She is good mother, traditional and friendly. Her business is located in the Plan 3000 neighbourhood known for its ethnically diverse inhabitants, immigrants from the east and mine workers from the west. They moved to the area and created a manufacturing centre.

Gueisa is dark complexioned and has brown hair. She has a robust build. (She is seated on the left wearing a white blouse with flowers on the shoulders). Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, but she speaks Spanish for business purposes. Her husband works in construction, and her children attend school. They live in a rented house made of brick with a metal roof and a dirt floor. It has water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Because of her great desire to improve her business, she became the leader of the borrowing group. The members work as a locksmith, interior painter, selling cosmetics, selling secondhand clothing, selling natural health products, selling empanadas, selling fruit and vegetables. Gueisa sells traditional food. One of the dishes is 'patasca' which is a soup made from a pig's head. It is said to cure hangovers.

She has enjoyed cooking traditional food since she was a child. The good thing about her business is that traditional food is very popular and sought after. One problem is the lack of ingredients such as meat, oil, rice noodles, yucca etc.

Gueisa's dream is to open a restaurant selling all types of food.

With the loan she wishes to buy ingredients for cooking traditional food. This is her first loan with the institution in the seven years she has had her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making traditional food

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, sugar, sticky rice, etc. for her food production business.

Lilia has been in this business for 30 years now.

Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, sugar, sticky rice, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 50 years old and has three children. Flordeliz is married and has one child still in school.

Flordeliz is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Flordeliz requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Flordeliz has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flordeliz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Sreykeo

texts.en: Sreykeo is 24 years old, married, a garment worker and the mother of one child.  She earns about $5 a day to support her family and lives in a rural area of Tboung Khmum, Tboung Khmum Province, Cambodia. She has been in her current line of work for six years and is requesting this loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy to request this loan, because it will promote her family's health and the environment as well as improve her living standards. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Jhon Carlos

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 31 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años y una hija de 2 meses, y su negocio es la fotografía.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor e independiente. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad Huatajata caracterizada por ser una de las regiones turísticas más importantes del país, ubicado a orillas del Lago sagrado Titicaca.
Jhon es de baja estatura, tez morena y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general, su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la pesca y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y pescan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de vertiente, no tiene alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fotografía, actividad que aprendió por iniciativa propia en busca de una nueva actividad, se especializa en fiestas patronales, cumpleaños, matrimonios y fiestas del pueblo, “aprendí fotografía por mi propia cuenta, soy unos de los pocos fotógrafos del altiplano…” comenta. Paralelamente a su negocio de fotografía también trabaja como pescador ayudando a su esposa en su trabajo. La ventaja de su negocio es que lo llaman a todos los eventos sociales y cuenta con una segunda actividad que es la pesca, la desventaja es que tiene que viajar largas distancias en el altiplano. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, él desea comprar una cámara fotográfica. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jhon solicita un préstamo para  comprar una cámara fotográfica para su estudio de fotografía en el altiplano.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 31-year-old man. He is married and has two sons aged three and five, and a two-month-old daughter. He is a photographer. Jhon is a good father, and an enterprising and independent man. He works in Huatajata, a municipality known for being one of the most important touristic areas in the country. It is located by the sacred Titicaca Lake.

Jhon is short, has dark complexion, and is of medium size. His mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken by locals. He speaks Spanish for cultural reasons. He shares his life with her wife, who is a fisherwoman, and his children, who go to school and fish too. They own the house where they live, which is made of adobe, and is served with electricity and water from a well, but not with sewage.

He is a photographer. He learned on his own, when looking for a new activity. He specializes in patron saint’s festivals, birthdays, weddings, and town festivals. "I learned to take pictures on my own. I am one of the few photographers that work in this area," he says. Besides photography, he also works as a fisherman, helping his wife with her work. The advantage is that people request his services for all kinds of social events, and that he has a second source of income, wich is fishing. The disadvantage is that he has to travel long distances throughout the plateau. He dreams of improving his house.

He wants to buy a camera. This is his first loan with the institution since he started his business five years ago. This is why Jhon is requesting a loan to buy a camera for the photo studio he has.

loans.use: to buy a camera for his photo studio.

loans.name: Francisa

texts.en:
Francisa is 56 years old, is married, and has four children. One child still in school.

Francisa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Francisa requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Francisa has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Maira Guadalupe

texts.es: Maira de 39 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, Maira vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maira, 39 years old, is a very hard working, responsible person.  She is entirely devoted to her business.  Maira lives with her four children in her own house and for five years she has owned a fruit and vegetable stand in the city market located near her house. 

This borrower requests a loan to be able to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables in order to have a better income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and everything she does is for her family's benefit and well being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with a handsome husband and four angelic-looking children. She has always worked hard to give her family a decent life and a good education. She has been in agriculture for ten years and earns an income by selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and produce. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Her main challenges are crop diseases and poor productivity. Consolata is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies, including good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. This will allow her to improve her family's quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about saving and plans to use the increased income she makes to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Helen Marisol

texts.es:
Helen es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de suministros para decoración.
Ella es alegre, divertida y muy optimista, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por agrupar la mayor parte del comercio informal, en este lugar podemos encontrar diferentes puestos de venta donde se comercializan ollas, calderas, cucharones y todo tipo de insumos metálicos, de madera, manufactura y todo lo que necesitemos para la vida diaria.
Helen es de tez morena, cabello rojizo y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que genera. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de suministros para decoración como, cintas de colores, brillos, hilos de todo color, pegamento y otros, “vendo en mi puesto desde mis 16 años porque mi abuelita falleció y me tuve que hacer cargo del negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra en un área muy comercial, la desventaja es la venta al aire libre porque tiene que aguantar las inclemencias del tiempo. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, ella desea comprar un kiosco metálico para vender bajo techo y que no se malogre su mercancía. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Helen solicita un préstamo para comprar un kiosco metálico para vender bajo techo y conservar bien su mercancía.
texts.en:
Helen is a young, 19 year-old woman who is single and has no children.  She has a business selling supplies to make decorations.  She is happy, funny, and very optimistic.  She carries out her business in the "Max Paredes" neighborhood, where there is a lot of informal commerce.  Here, one can find a variety of sales stalls selling pots, kettles, ladles, and all types of products made of metal, wood, and other manufactured products needed for daily living.

Helen has a dark complexion, reddish-brown hair, and a short stature.  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family.  She also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business.  She lives with her parents, who also work.  They live in a home owned by the family that is built of brick and has electricity.  However, the home lacks potable water and has no sewer system.  

Helen has a business selling supplies to make decorations, such as: colored ribbons, glitter, yarn in many colors, glue, and other products.   "I've been selling from my post since I was 16 years old, because my grandmother died and I had to take over her business," she comments.  

The advantage of Helen's business is that it is located in a very commercial area, the disadvantage is that she sells in the open air, and so she has to endure the inclement weather.  Her dream is to stabilize her business and increase her sales.  She wants to buy a metal kiosk so that she can sell under a roof where her merchandise can be protected.  

This is the first loan she has taken with the institution in the 3 years she has had her business.  This is why Helen is requesting a loan to buy a metal kiosk so that she can sell under a roof and protect her merchandise from the elements.

loans.use: to buy a metal kiosk to protect her merchandise

loans.name: Las Marias De Quixaya Group

texts.en:
“Las Marías de Quixaya” trust bank is located in San Lucas Tolimán, Guatemala. Last year, the women of this group received their first loan through Kiva, and the loan has helped them very much with growing their various businesses. They feel confident and accomplished as women and as business owners because of the successes they have had.

Happy for the opportunity to work with Kiva, these women are requesting their second loan in hopes of continued success and growth in their businesses, which range from convenient stores to the sale of snacks and meat.

Silvia is a seasoned businesswoman, with several years running her business of buying and selling steak, chicken, and vegetables from her home and on the road, as well. With her loan, Silvia would like to buy more chickens, as well as steaks and vegetables, as the demand is high in this festive season.

This loan will assist her greatly in her efforts to support her three children, ages 22, 14 and 12, in their secondary school education, something 41-year-old Silvia did not have access to, having only completed a 3rd grade primary school education. Moving forward with strength and motivation, she invests in her business to benefit her family.

The women of “Las Marias de Quixaya” trust bank are beyond grateful for this support, which motivates them to work harder to expand their businesses and impact their communities. Thank you, Kiva!

loans.use: to buy more chickens, as well as steaks and vegetables.

loans.name: La Bendicion Los Brillantes Group

texts.en:
In the folds of the volcano of fire and the high plains of Central Guatemala is the community of San Pedro Yepocapa, the place where “La Bendición Los Brillantes,” or “The Blessing: the Bright Ones,” trust bank was formed by 10 determined women.

Iris is the elected secretary of her trust bank. She is 31 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 14 and 6, for whom she provides education in local schools, something she highly values, as she was only able to study through 6th grade in primary school. She and her children live in the home of her father, and for her income, Iris runs a farm, growing and selling beans, corn, coffee, and bananas. With her Kiva loan, she plans to buy a large quantity of fertilizer that will enable her seeds to reach their full potential, yielding a greater harvest of the best quality fruits and vegetables.

The other members of “La Bendición Los Brillantes” are dedicated to hard work in their various business to forge bright futures for their children, providing them higher education than the women could receive and improving their quality of life with the extra profit they gain through investment in microloans. Thank you, Kiva lenders, for your support in this process!

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fertilizer that will enable her seeds to reach their full potential, yielding a greater harvest.

loans.name: Sonia Emely

texts.es: Sonia de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hijo, la clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and her son.  This borrower is a very hard working person who is fully committed to her business.  Her only desire is to progress and provide a better standard of living to her family.  For 15 years she has owned a fruit and vegetable stand in the market near her house. 

This borrower requests a loan to be able to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables, as this will be enable her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more wholsesale fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rita Casia

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años y una hija de 5 años, y su negocio es la carpintería.
Ella es fuerte, constante y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por ser residencial, grandes casas y comercio de lujo se juntan en este lugar. 
Rita es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de muebles de madera prensada, su principal material de trabajo es la melanina que es un tablero formado por un aglomerado de partículas que están recubiertas de láminas decorativas estas pueden ser de diferentes colores, son duras y resistentes, la principal ventaja es que no se polilla y que se encuentra en una gran variedad de colores, “no existen muebles con materiales mejores o peores, a final de cuentas el mueble que usted compre reflejará lo que usted desea para su hogar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la demanda de este material hizo crecer su taller, la desventaja es la falta de material de trabajo para fabricar a gran escala. Su sueño es tener un taller propio, ella desea comprar melanina por paquetes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que  Rita solicita un préstamo para comprar melanina por paquete para fabricar muebles.
texts.en:
Rita is a 38-year-old married woman with two sons, ages 14 and 17, and a five-year-old daughter. Her business is carpentry.

She is strong, constant, and very determined. And she conducts her business in the southern zone of the city, which can be characterized as residential, with many large houses and luxury commercial businesses clustered there.

Rita is dark in appearance, short in stature, and physically robust. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish. Rita shares her life with her husband who also participates in the business, while their children study in school. They live in a rented room constructed of blocks which has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.

Rita's business is building furniture from plywood. Her principal work material is melanin, a material formed by gluing together sawdust. It can be decorative and comes in different colors. Rita comments, "There is no furniture made from better or worse materials. In the end, the furniture you buy will reflect what you desire for your home."

Her business's advantage is that demand for her products has expanded her shop, but the disadvantage is the lack of work materials to build on a grand scale.

Rita's dream is to have a shop of her own. Also, she wants to buy melanin by the packet. This is her first loan with this institution during the six years she has been making furniture.

It is for these reasons that Rita is requesting a loan -- to purchase melanin by the packet for making furniture.

loans.use: buy melanine by the packet for use in manufacturing furniture.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is 28 years old and a very energetic person who works hard to maintain her household of two children, pay off her debts, and buy medicines and food for her family. She lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in maize plantations. Monicah has been a farmer for the last ten years and earns most of her income by selling milk, eggs and maize. The rising costs of farm supplies, such as fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that she faces. Despite these conditions, Monicah remains positive and passionate about her work and is seeking a loan to buy poultry because this will allow her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Monicah will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business, make more profits, and face the higher costs that are coming next season. This will also mean better quality produce and increase her yields and income.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Ellah

texts.en:
Ellah is a tenacious, hard-working individual who lives in the town of Nkubu, an area which is very affected by poverty and where job opportunities are scarce.

Five years ago, Ellah started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud.

Although Ellah makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. Through the loan, she will have a comfortable time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Ellah believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Ellah eagerly waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Chebonyo, in the Siongiroi region of Kenya. Faith passionately loves farming, has been working in this field for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her large family, which requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are some personal business that she does in order to make sure everyone has enough to eat. Faith faces challenges in her work and would like to overcome them by fully utilizing the free space she has on her farm by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and the price of milk has been going up recently, so Faith, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will raise, and has learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure to boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. Faith said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low. She has also taken training from Juhudi Kilimo and learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. She hopes that through the profit she earns she will be able to add value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Alh. Abdullahi

texts.en:
Alh. Abdullahi is a Babban Gona farmer. Alh. Abdullahi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Alh. Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Alh. Abdullahi can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Alh. Abdullahi has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Alh. Abdullahi is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer independiente y trabajadora de 44 años de edad. Actualmente vive en el Distrito Federal en donde tiene ubicado su negocio de venta de artículos promocionales personalizados.
Hace diez años, Ana inició su negocio con en el fin de tener un ingreso adicional al que recibe con su trabajo fijo como secretaria en el Gobierno del Distrito Federal. Más que un trabajo, Ana concibe su negocio como una vía de distracción para su rutina diaria.
El servicio de venta que Ana ofrece, consiste en que cada uno de sus clientes puede elegir los artículos proporcionales que desea y personalizarlos al momento de la compra. 
Para tener un mayor número de ventas, Ana recorre distintos bazares con su negocio para crear una cartera de clientes más amplia. Motivada por el sueño de ver crecer su negocio y el gusto que la gente tiene por sus productos, ella ha solicitado un crédito que le ha ayudado a comprar más productos para ella poder vender más y satisfacer mejor los deseos de sus clientes.
El saber qué hace lo que le gusta y ver la satisfacción de las personas por su mercancía, le ayuda a Ana a seguir adelante y a hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is an independent, hard working woman who is 44 years old.  She is currently living in Mexico City, where she has her business which consists of selling customized promotional items.  She started her business ten years ago with the aim of having an additional income to the one she earns through her regular job as a secretary for the Mexico City local government.  More than  a job itself, Ana sees her business as a distraction from her daily routine. The service she provides consists of allowing her customers to choose the item they desire which will be customized at the time of the purchase. In order to have a higher number of sales, Ana goes with her business to different markets so that she can expand her client base. 

Driven by her dream of seeing her business grow and the acceptance her products have among her clients, she has requested a loan.  This loan has helped her buy more products so that she can sell more and better fulfill her customers' desires.  

Knowing that she does what she loves and seeing the satisfaction of her customers for her goods helps Ana progress and make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more goods in order to sell more

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL NUESTRA SEÑORA DE GUADALUPE, ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS, ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTOR DE LECHE, ESTAS MUJERES SE HAN CARACTERIZADO POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMTEN POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA BRINDARLES ESTABILIDAD A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES MARTA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QU VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES EN CANTIDADES PEQUEÑAS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTE, ACEITE, JUGOS, GALLETAS ETC. EL HORARIO DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. NUESTRA SEÑORA DE GUADALUPE AGARDECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe community bank is made up of nine members who are single mothers. They are originally from Sauce, which is known for its milk production. These women are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having a desire to improve. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, they could not attend school and started working at an early age to help with the household expenses. They struggle every day to provide stability to their children.

Thanks to her desire to move forward, the group coordinator is Marta. She has a pulperia, which is a small store that sells small quantities of grocery items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, oil, juice, cookies, and others. She works for twelve hours every day selling her products. She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital to stock her store so that in the near future she can earn more income.

Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, and cookies.

loans.name: Javier Hilarion

texts.es:
Javier continúa con su negocio de servicio de transporte urbano e interprovincial, el crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió realizando el mantenimiento y comprando una batería para su vehículo, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar sin problemas. Actualmente trabaja solo y es propietario de su vehículo, “compré las llantas que necesitaba y pude pagar el mantenimiento, mi negocio funciona correctamente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede disponer de su tiempo y elegir las rutas que le conviene, la desventaja es que no cuenta con seguro social ni con un ingreso fijo. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprarse otro vehículo, él desea pagar el cambio de lubricantes y servicio eléctrico de su vehículo. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para pagar el cambio de lubricantes y el servicio eléctrico de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Javier continues with his business offering urban transportation services and transportation services between provinces. He used the loan he received for maintenance and to purchase a battery for his vehicle. The payment of the loan was made on time because he was able to work without problems. Currently, he works alone and he owns his vehicle, "I purchased the tires I needed and I was able to pay the maintenance, my business is functioning correctly" he comments. The advantage of his business is that he can manage his time and select the routes that are convenient for him. The disadvantage is that he does not receive social security or a steady income.

His dream is to improve his business and to buy another vehicle. He wants to pay to change the lubricating oils and the electric service of his vehicle. This is his fourth loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years he has been doing this job.

For this reason Javier is requesting a loan, to pay for the change of lubricant oils and the electric service of his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for the change of lubricating oils and electric system of his vehicle.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Chesoi, Kapsowar, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Veronicah is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps dairy cows. Veronicah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: "I have to do something for my family."

Veronicah joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her.

She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Veronicah is from Chesoi, a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Veronicah to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

For women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle, but Veronicah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Veronicah will never suffer losses due to delays in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase.

Veronicah is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Veronicah will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for timely delivery of farm produce to the market.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is an energetic smallholder farmer, a person who always has a smile drawn on her face. Ten years ago, Magdaline started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Chesoi, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of eight children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Magdaline believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

With your support, this mum will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor se dedica a la música hace más de 2 años es integrante de una agrupación musical, el señor toca el teclado, también cuenta con una segunda actividad laboral de seguridad en la empresa de vigilancia. Hace un año atrás la concubina del señor se encuentra delicada de salud debido a que dio a luz mediante el cuadro de cesárea en el cual se complicó el parto no sabiendo a ciencia cierta los médicos que lo ocasionaba. Pero este tema se complicó debido que la señora sufría de cólico y quistes en la región de la matriz lo cual se complicó y necesita de urgencia una operación para solucionar el problema que le aqueja y el señor necesita una ayuda para la operación y compra de medicamentos en general el cual le costara un monto elevado, que no cuenta por esta situación necesita la ayuda económica lo antes posible. Con la ayuda la señora se mejorara y podrá volver a desarrollar sus actividades cotidianas de manera normal. y el cuidado de su bebe que cuenta con una semana de nacida. Con la ayuda el señor desarrollara de manera normal sus actividades sin una preocupación
texts.en: This man has worked in music for over 2 years and is a member of a musical group. He plays the keyboard and also has a second job in security with company surveillance. A year ago, this man's partner was in ill health due to having given birth through a Cesarean which complicated the birth, the doctors not knowing exactly what happened. But, this situation got complicated because she suffered from cramps and cysts around the uterus which became complicated and she needs an emergency operation to solve the problem that bothers her and he needs help for the operation and to purchase medicines in general which will cost him a lot, which he doesn't have for this situation. He needs a loan as soon as possible. With the help, she will get better and be able to go back to doing her daily work in a normal way and caring for her baby that is one week old. With the help, he will be able to go about his work normally without worry.

loans.use: to pay for an operation and purchase medicine that is concerning his partner and in this way be able to care normally for their recently-born baby.

loans.name: Henitsoa Jeannine

texts.fr:
28 ans,  Henitsoa Jeannine est mariée, son mari est livreur de pains. Le couple a trois enfants de 1, 4 et 11 ans. Deux sont scolarisés. 
La fabrication de fromage est un métier qu'elle hérite de ses parents. C'est une activité familiale. Elle a 7 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine à part  tous ceux qu'elle a déjà acquis quand elle vivait avec ses parents.
Elle voudrait développer son activité et elle demande du crédit pour l'aider à réaliser ce développement. Elle voudrait augmenter le volume de production pour honorer tous les commandes et satisfaire les clients, et pour augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Henitsoa Jeannine is a 28-year-old married woman. Her husband delivers bread and the couple have three children aged one, four and eleven; two of these children are in school. 

Cheese-making is a job that Henitsoa Jeannine inherited from her parents: it is a family business. She has seven years of experience in this trade, not including the years of experience that she already acquired when she lived with her parents. 

She would like to develop her business and is asking for a loan to carry out this development. She would like to increase her production volume to meet all orders and satisfy her clients, and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 350 cheeses and 1000 litres of whole milk.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina, who is 26 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of the value of hard work. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers in the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash-crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Regina earns a commission on sales where she helps get farm produce from local farmers to buyers. She has been doing this for more than a decade and continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because this is everything in her line of work. Because Regina can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Regina’s clients focus on production rather than sales, and help her family earn a better income and improve its life. Her dream is to build a modern house so she no longer needs to live in the mud house that she currently resides in.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un taller mecanico desde hace 4 años e inicio con capital propio, su compañero de vida es quien se encarga del trabajo y ella lo administra, y gracias a ese trabajo es como pueden salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una caja de herramientas para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The youth who has her face pixelated is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She has had a mechanical workshop for 4 years, which she started with her own capital. Her life companion is who takes charge of the work and she administrates the business. Thanks to this work she can get ahead with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy a toolbox to be able to continue with her work and have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy a tool box.

loans.name: Yeni Ibeth

texts.es: Yeni es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 26 años de edad se dedica a atender su tienda de productos básicos, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive con su esposo en vivienda propia desde hace 5 años, por lo que es muy reconocida en su cantón como una mujer trabajadora. Yeni desea invertir en productos para su tienda, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, lácteos, verduras, huevos, detergente, entre otros productos para su tienda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Yeni is a hard-working woman who, at the age of 26, tends her store of basic products, which allows her to raise her family. She has lived with her husband in their own house for 5 years, and for this reason she is very well known in her canton as a hard-working woman.

Yeni wants to invest in products for her store, and so she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in basic grains, milk product, vegetables, eggs, and detergents, among other products for her store of basic products.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, milk products, vegetables, eggs, and detergents, among other products for her basic products store

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, el crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar mercadería por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar con normalidad. Actualmente cuenta con un puesto fijo de venta cercano a su domicilio por eso la mercadería es más fácil de transportar y en mayor cantidad, “se acerca la época navideña y es la mejor época para las ventas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería para ofertar en las fiestas de fin de año. Su sueño es vender por mayor, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Su negocio es exitoso debido a que el precio de la ropa es accesible para la mayoría de las personas. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Candelaria solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para ofertar en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Candelaria is continuing to run her business selling second-hand clothes. She used her loan to buy wholesale merchandise and made her payments on time, because she was able to work normally. She now has a permanent sales stand close to her home, so it is easier to transport the merchandise in greater amounts.

"The Christmas season is drawing closer, and that is the best season for sales," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has constant sales. The disadvantage is the lack of merchandise to have on sale at end-of-year parties. Her dream is to become a wholesale seller and she wants to buy second-hand clothes wholesale. Her business is successful as the price of her clothing is accessible for most people. This is her third loan from the institution in her 10 years of this activity. For these reasons, Candelaria is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing wholesale and sell it at end-of-year parties.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing wholesale and sell it at end-of-year parties.

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia de 35 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en su propia y se dedica a su negocio de venta de pan y rosquillas, realiza su venta de forma ambulante y lo hace en un mercado de San Lorenzo.
Doña Lesbia vende todos los días desde muy temprano y finaliza por la tarde, sus clientes son todas las personas que visitan San Lorenzo y sus alrededores, es una mujer emprendedora que lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña Lesbia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como maíz, cuajada, manteca, leña, etc. para elaborar su producto y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es una clienta con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para terminar de construir su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 35 years old. She is single and has no children who depend on her. Lesbia lives in a home that the owns. She makes a living selling bread and doughnut-like pastries. She sells her products as a street vendor and at a market in San Lorenzo.

Lesbia sells her goods every day, starting very early and finishing in the afternoon. Her customers are those who visit San Lorenzo and its surrounding areas. Lesbia is an enterprising woman who works hard every day to improve her quality of life.

Lesbia is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as corn, cheese curd, butter, firewood and more. She will use these goods to increase her income and her quality of life. Lesbia is a borrower who wants to continue working with Prisma Honduras.

Lesbia's dream is to continue working in order to finish building her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; October 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese curd, butter, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Rafael Augusto

texts.es: Rafael de 42 años es un emprendedor microempresario que inició su propio negocio al considerar que los equipos de cómputo y celulares eran muy rentables y de alto requerimiento por el público en general, de este modo asumió el reto de aperturar un almacén en el año 2012 en el cual ha comercializado este tipo de productos con gran éxito y de los cuales maneja un amplio conocimiento gracias a capacitaciones que ha tomado. Esta actividad le ha permitido solventar económicamente a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y dos hijos menores de edad, así como garantizar un ingreso seguro en aras de la realización personal.  Sus principales clientes son los visitantes del centro comercial quienes llegan hasta sus exhibidores de productos en busca de una solución tecnológica, es por ello que mantener equipos de últimas generaciones es de suma importancia y por ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar equipos celulares e incorporar nuevo surtido; Tablet, accesorios y repuestos de los mismos.  Con esta inversión aprovechará el fin de año una temporada en la que se incrementa la demanda.  Rafael a futuro proyecta abrir una sucursal e inclinarse más por la venta de celulares de alta gama.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 42 year old micro-entrepreneur that started his own business when he realized that computers and mobile phones were in great demand and could generate a good income.
In 2012 he took on the challenge of opening a warehouse to sell these type of products, which he has done with success. He has a great knowledge of these products because of workshops and training he's taken.
This activity has allowed him to support his family economically and have a steady income for his personal growth. He has a wife and 2 children. His main clients are the visitors to the shopping mall who come to his product exhibit looking for technology solutions which is why it is important to have the latest products.
He requested a loan, his first loan through Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy new mobile phones, tablets, accessories, and repair parts for them. With this investment he will take advantage of the end of year sales and demand on new products. Rafael projects opening a store and selling high end cell phones.

loans.use: to buy new mobile phones, tablets, accessories, and repair parts for them.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María de 69  años de edad,  es soltera y vive con sus hijos e hijas vive en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de Carne de Cerdos y Res, Ella junto al apoyo de sus 2 hijos varones realizan esta actividad 2 veces por semana, destazan los cerdos y luego venden la carne a sus todos sus clientes, también cuenta con su propio Molino Eléctrico de quebrar maíz, donde sus clientes llegan todos los días para recibir el servicio, Ella radica en el municipio de San José, Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María esta solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio con más cerdos y también compra 6 sacos de concentrado para los mismos, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña María su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015
texts.en:
María is 69 years old, is single, and lives with her sons and daughters in her own home. She has worked for 20 years in the business of pork and beef sales. With the help of her two sons she does this work twice a week. They butcher the pigs and later sell the meat to all of their customers. She also has her own electric mill to grind corn, where her customers come every day for this service.

She lives in the town of San José, Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with dreams of geting ahead and she fights day by day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business with more pigs and also buy 6 sacks of concentrated feed for the pigs. With the support of this loan she intends to increase her income and also her quality of life. She is a returning client who wishes to work with Prisma and Kiva.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele and at the same time improve her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy pigs and six sacks of concentrated feed for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Meet Gladys, an ambitious woman who, since she was little, has shown a strong passion for independent work. When she became a mother, she left behind many of her dreams to focus completely on taking care of her little ones

Since her children are grown, she wants to take up her dreams again and create work to support herself, since she her husband's income is unsteady. Her primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. She has been a very determined and dedicated farmer for 10 years and has never regretted going into farming.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Glady's upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling woman has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Gladys has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Gladys is quite a visionary and, with her accumulated profits, she hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad, es una mujer que vive con su compañero de vida, con ellos vive uno de sus hijos junto a su pareja, los demás hijos ya han formado su hogar, Trinidad tiene aproximadamente 35 años dedicandose al comercio de tortillas, su jornada laboral la comienza a partir de las 10:00 a.m. y la finaliza a las 8:00 p.m., con esto ella lleva el sustento diario a su grupo familiar.
Trinidad solicita crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de maíz y de un comal para cocer las tortillas, esto le ayudara para poder abastecerse de materia prima  y equipo para trabajar, ya que hay temporadas en la que el maíz se pone a un alto precio, además de poder atraer a más clientes y le generara más ingresos para mejor las condiciones de vida de su  familia.
El mayor sueño de Trinidad es poder generar los ingresos necesarios para poder continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a woman who lives with her life partner. With them, one of their children lives with his partner, the other children have made their own homes. Trinidad has dedicated approximately 35 years to the sale of tortillas. Her work day starts at 10:00 am and finishes at 8:00 pm, with this she brings the daily sustenance to her family.

Trinidad asks for a loan to be able to invest it in corn and a griddle to cook tortillas. This will help her to be able to stock up on raw material and equipment to work, since there are seasons when corn is at a high price, in addition to being able to attract more customers and generate more income to improve her family's life condition.

Trinidad's greatest dream is to be able to generate the income necessary to be able to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn and a griddle to cook tortillas. This will help her to be able to stock up on raw material and equipment to work.

loans.name: Correty

texts.en:
Correty is a practical and hardworking woman. She is a housewife who is loving and is protective of her family. After finishing house chores, she works on her farm and does all this is because she wants to improve her family's living conditions, to show progress, and to give her two children the opportunity to study and prepare themselves for life in a good way. She also does some side hustle business (shop business).

Correty has been farming for the past 10 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and crops. Correty is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy farm implements such as seeds.

Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that Correty could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

She now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with the wonderful KIVA lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Correty believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Correty to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Taplilei

texts.en:
Taplilei is 72 years old (the oldest Juhudi Kilimo client) and lives with her husband in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is blessed with six children who are her greatest motivators. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for her grandchildren and children. Taplilei was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation in her family. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 40 years.

Taplilei has always had an affinity for farming. She has even nicknamed one of her cows and is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day which helps her support her family. Taplilei also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high quality seed, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and high quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits.

Taplilei is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Taplilei believes that through the loan, she will be able to give her grandchildren a solid educational background.

Make a $25 loan or more, and push this granny’s dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, sin hijos y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es paciente, honesta y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad caracterizada por agrupar la mayor parte de la población y donde se realiza la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera. 
Luisa es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y hala español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su negocio es la panadería actividad que inició con un capital mínimo horneando masitas típicas, con el tiempo su negocio fue prosperando hasta convertirse en la única actividad que solventa los gastos de la familia, una de sus especialidades son el ‘cuñapé’ que es una masa a base de harina de yuca y queso, “vendo horneados tradicionales porque son populares y se pueden comer a toda hora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de un horno industrial para hornear por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una panadería en un lugar comercial, ella desea comprar un horno industrial para vender horneados tradicionales por mayor. Su negocio es un éxito porque las ventas son diarias y económicas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luisa solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial para hornear masitas por mayor.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 43 year old unmarried woman who has no children. Her business is a bakery.

She is patient, honest and very consistent. Her business is carried out in the Southern part of the city where the majority of the population is clustered and most of the manufacturing production takes place.

Luisa is dark-skinned, short and robust. Her native language is Guaraní whoch she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business.

Her business is a bakery, an activity that she started with a minimum of capital baking traditional pastries. With time her business prospered until it became the only activity that paid the family expenses. One of her specialties is the 'cuñapé’ which is a pastry made from a base of yucca flour and cheese. "I sell traditional baked goods as they are popular and they can be eaten at any time", she commented. The advantage of her business is the daily sales and her disadvantage is the lack of an industrial oven to bake wholesale.

Her dream is to open a bakery in a commercial space. She wants to buy an industrial ovens to sell traditional baked goods wholesale. Her business is successful because her sales are daily and economical. This is her first loan with the institution in the 12 years she has run this business.

It is for these reasons that Luisa is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven to bake pastries wholesale.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to bake pastries for wholesale.

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
Eustaquia continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional (sentada, la primera de la derecha, viste pollera). El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando un refrigerador para conservar los alimentos frescos, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar normalmente. Actualmente los socios de la banca mejoraron y ampliaron sus negocios, es por eso que la banca sigue unida, “tuvimos la suerte de trabajar y cumplir nuestras metas…” comenta. Su negocio es un éxito porque la comida que vende es muy popular y el precio es accesible a todo bolsillo. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a diario, la desventaja es la falta de mesas y sillas para atender a más personas. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande, ella desea comprar mesas y sillas para vender comida. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eustaquia solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para vender más comida.
texts.en:
Eustaquia continues with her business selling traditional meals (she is sitting, the first one to the right side, wearing a skirt). She used the loan she received to purchase a refrigerator to keep the fresh food items. She made her payments on time because she was able to work as usual.

Currently, the members of the bank group improved and expanded their businesses. For this reason the bank group continues together, "we had the fortune of working and meeting our goals.." she says. Her business is successful because the meals she sells are very popular and the prices are accessible to all pockets. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of tables and chairs to serve more people. Her dream is to have a big restaurant. She wants to buy tables and chairs to sell more meals. This is her second loan cycle with this institution in the 10 years that she has been working on this trade. For this reason Eustaquia is requesting a loan, to purchase more tables and chairs to sell more meals.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to sell more meals.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, estudio hasta bachillerato grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en una finca de café todos los días de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 m.d. juntos tienen un hijo de cuatro años de edad y junto a ellos viven sus suegros, pero su esposo está construyendo un cuarto para independizarse un poco. 

Mirian, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, tuvo que irse para la capital a trabajar durante 6 años y cuando regreso trabajo con sus padres; luego se casó y junto a su esposo decidieron colocar una pequeña tienda, la cual tiene desde hace 2 años; este negocio lo tiene en un corredor de la casa de sus suegros y el horario de venta es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 7:30 p.m. 

Mirian, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas y el resto del dinero será para comprar una vitrina para vender lápices, lapiceros, papel, borradores, sacapuntas y juegos de geometría.- De esa manera ella pretende generar nuevos ingresos para su familia y no depender solo de las ganancias de la tienda. 

Mirian, junto a su esposo sueña con construir su propia vivienda, para vivir junto a su hijo y también sueñan con seguir creciendo en sus negocios y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mirian, at the age of 25, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She graduated from high school. She is married, and her husband works on a coffee plantation every day from 5:00 am to noon. They have a four-year-old son together, and her parents-in-law live with them, but her husband is building a room so that they can become a little independent.

Mirian has done the household tasks since she was a little girll, she had to go out to the capital every day to work for 6 hours, and when she came back she worked with her parents. Then she married, and along with her husband they decided to set up a little store, which they have had for 2 years. She has this business in a hallway of her in-laws' house, and the hours for sales are from 6:00 am to 7:30 pm.

Mirian needs the loan to buy a griddle to make pupusas [thick, filled corn tortillas], and the rest of the money will be to buy a display case so that she can sell pencils, pencil boxes, paper, erasers, pencil sharpeners, and geometry sets. In this way she plans to generate new income for her family and not depend only on the earnings from the store.



Mirian, junto a su esposo sueña con construir su propia vivienda, para vivir junto a su hijo y también sueñan con seguir creciendo en sus negocios y tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make pupusas and a display case so that she can sell pencils, pencil boxes, paper, erasers, pencil sharpeners and geometry sets.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
The above client is a new borrower to UGAFODE's Nakasero Branch. He is married with seven children and a resident of Namuwongo. He is a transporter and he rides a motorcycle to get income to meet the needs of his rather large family.

He has, therefore, applied for a loan of UGX 1,700,000 to own his business. He needs the loan to top up on the purchase of a new motorcycle to boost his income. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Men Nan Men(Mc)

texts.en:
Reginald, aged 38, is leading a group of 36 women. He gathers them together and encourages them to save a small amount of money. Up to a certain amount, the group decides to give credit to its members.

Reginald's group is two years old, and they have not encountered any defaults so far. That group activity is important for Reginald as well as the members. Last month, if he did not find a credit inside the group, he would not find money to buy food for his daughter over the month. In addition to that, Reginald has diversified his economic activity by retailing wheels. Today, he seeks a loan through Zafen to sell to retailers.

Pictured from left to right is Reginald, Guerline (secretary who uses the profit to pay for her school), Magalie (treasurer) and Guerline (advisor).

loans.use: To find cash to buy spare wheels and car accessories to retail

loans.name: Aljadis Paola

texts.es: Aljadis es una mujer ejemplo de superación, ella es madre de dos hijos y vive con su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla. Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a las labores en el hogar pero consideró que podría alternamente buscar una actividad en la que se desempeñara sin afectar sus demás roles y fue así como se incorporó a una empresa multinivel como consultora.  Empezó promocionando la oferta del catálogo a amigos, familiares, vecinos y con el pasar del tiempo su clientela se fue incrementando puesto que sus clientes le referenciaron nuevos prospectos. Posteriormente consideró que abrir un punto directo de venta en el que pudiera ampliar su oferta de productos seria fabuloso, así que solicitó unos recursos con una entidad que usó en la adecuación del local y mercancías.  Su negocio ha sido un éxito y todos los días de la semana está dispuesta a atender a su clientela a partir de las 10 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., sin embargo en la temporada que se avecina su horarios se manejaran más extendidos por la gran afluencia de personal es por ello que Aljadis realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para estar preparada con nuevo surtido de blusas, pantalones, jean, brasieres y demás. Su meta a futuro es ampliar la capacidad de su negocio y en lo personal terminar la carrera técnica que está cursando, así como garantizar una excelente educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aljadis is a woman who exemplifies overcoming difficulties. She is the mother of two children, and she lives with her husband in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. Previously, she only performed domestic tasks, but she decided that she could instead look for work that she could do without affecting her other roles. It was in this way that she started a multilevel business as a sales consultant. She started promoting her catalog offerings to friends, family members, and neighbors. As time passed, her clientele increased, since her customers referred her to new prospects.

Later, she decided that opening a direct point of sale in which she could expand her offering of products would be fabulous. So she requested some resources from an organization, which she used to adapt her venue and merchandise.

Her business has been a success, and every day of the week she is ready to attend to her customers from 10 am to 6 pm. However, during the upcoming season, she will maintain more extended hours due to the large influx of people. For this reason, Aljadis requested a Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to be prepared with a new supply of blouses, pants, jeans, bras, and more.

Her goal for the future is to expand her business’s capacity and, on a personal level, to finish the technical degree for which she is currently studying, as well as to guarantee an excellent education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new supply of blouses, pants, jeans, bras, and more.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 46 años de edad, separada, tiene 1 hijo de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de queso y huevo.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona central, área que acoge la mayor parte de las oficinas públicas y privadas.
Sandra es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto (la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa animal print), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza.
