Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia  en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a liderar la bancad e emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; servicio de limpieza, venta de cereales, venta de medias, venta de pañales, confección de ropa deportiva, venta de carne y venta de refrescos. Su negocio es la venta de queso y huevo, actividad que realiza en su puesto de venta fijo, ella compra queso y huevo de diferentes variedades por mayor para venderlo al menudeo, “vendo queso y huevo ambos son alimentos que se consumen a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra por mayor. Su sueño es ser elegida por los clientes del mercado, ella desea comprar queso y huevo por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada. Esta es la 1 secuenciad e préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sandra solicita un préstamo para comprar queso y huevo por mayor para vender al menudeo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 46 year old woman who is separated and has one child aged 17 years. She works selling cheese and eggs. She is enterprising, independent and very hard-working. She works in the central region, where most of the public and private offices are located.

Sandra is a short, stocky brunette (first on the left, wearing an animal-print shirt). Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish within the general culture and for work. She shares her life with her son, who is in school. They live in a rented brick room with safe drinking water, electric power and sewage services. Her wish to improve her business brought her to lead the communal bank. The members' businesses are: cleaning services, selling cereal, selling stockings, selling nappies, making sports clothes, selling meat and selling snacks. She works selling cheese and eggs from her fixed market stall. She buys different types of cheese and eggs wholesale and sells them at retail prices. "I sell cheese and eggs, both of which are types of food that are eaten every day," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales. The disadvantage is her lack of capital for wholesale purchases. Her dream is to be chosen by the market's customers. She wants to buy cheese and eggs wholesale to supply her seasonal customers. This is her first loan from the institution in 4 years of this activity.

For these reasons, Sandra is requesting a loan to buy cheese and eggs wholesale and sell them at retail prices.

loans.use: to buy cheese and eggs wholesale and sell them at retail prices.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old and a proud mother of three children. She is a very hard-working farmer. She has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Grace practices mixed farming. That is, she grows cabbages, onions, different varieties of crops and keeps dairy cows. Through these activities, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income.

Although Grace has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest lately, because of the lack of fertilizer and good seed, and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seed to expand her farm. Through the use of good seed and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margin. With your loan, Grace will make enough income to take care of her family and cover farming expenses.

She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to tend to her farm and to give her family a decent living and her children a proper education. You can help Grace with a loan that would mean a lot to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and seeds and expand her farm.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her five children, who mean everything to her. Judy enjoys dairy and crop farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years.

Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Judy offers extension services to other farmers who are new to the business.

Being a caring and loving mother, Judy has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Judy has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

Her dream is to generate enough earnings to live comfortably and to be able to pay for her beloved children's education.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Nolvia Yessenia

texts.es:
Nolvia, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y muy carismática, está casada desde hace tres años y tiene un bebe de dos años de edad, ella vive en su propia casa con su esposo y su hijo. 

Nolvia, trabaja como vendedora en un almacén de electrodomésticos, ella lleva tiene varios años de trabajar y se ha ganado el merito de ser una excelente empleada; ella ha pensado en mejorar sus ingresos y por eso ha decidido tener su propio negocio. 

Nolvia, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, detergente, entre otros productos para colocar una tienda en su casa, para que su esposo la administre y este pendiente de su hijo. 

Los sueños de Nolvia, son que su tienda sea un éxito y que su esposo le ayude a manejarla y al mismo tiempo a estar al pendiente de su hijo.
texts.en:
Noliva, 31-years-old, is a hard-working and very charismatic woman. She has been married for three years and has a two-year-old baby. She lives in her own home with her husband and her son.

Nolvia works as a saleswoman at an electrical appliance warehouse. She has spent several years working and has earned the distinction of being an excellent employee. She has thought about improving her income, and for this reason she has decided to have her own business. 

Nolvia needs the loan to to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, bread, detergent, and other products to set up a store in her home, so that her husband can manage it and look after their son.

Nolvia's dream is for her store to be a success and for her husband to help her manage it and, at the same time, to look after their son.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, bread, detergent, and other products to set up a store in her home.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años y con loq eu obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante con sus gastos el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza para realizarlo por eso esta olicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Luis, 64 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has had a store located in his home for a number of years and with what he gets from his earnings is how he manages to get ahead with his expenses. He wants to improve his house building a perimeter wall but with what he earns, he doesn't have enough to do it. For this, he is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary construction materials and, so, to have a more secure house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Greetings from Kenya! This is Priscilla, a 45 year old farmer. She is an extraordinary woman with a great personality. At a time when many farmers in Kenya are abandoning dairy farming and agriculture owing to poor yield and low income, Priscilla, hailing from Kerugoya, is scripting a success story with her dairy farming.

She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her four children as a primary caregiver.

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Priscilla has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After she lost her formal job, the role of primary caregiver has been overwhelming because of the responsibility of feeding the whole family.

“I have to do something for my family," she said. Priscilla is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels.

The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Priscilla is visionary and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it.

She will also start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

Priscilla believes that if women small-holder farmers had the same access to resources as large scale farmers, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced.

Priscilla has the mindset of a winner. She will put forth the maximum effort possible to get her family ahead, and in the future, enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Fifty two year old Faith is happily married and together with her husband, they are blessed with three children.

For the past 15 years she has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Faith has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow.

Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up. Faith, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm.

Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms.

She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Faith hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products.

This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. It is clear that this small-holder farmer is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered. Her positive attitude and desire to get ahead reveals Faith's immense desire to better herself and get a favorable response to her request.

loans.use: to buy another quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es una mujer de 45 años de edad que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos básicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años y en la que se ha apoyado para salir adelante con su familia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que habita al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Esperanza desea terminar de construir el muro de su vivienda por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir el muro de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 45-year-old woman who earns a living with her business selling basic products. She has carried out this business for 4 years and she has relied on it to get her family ahead. She is a hard-working woman who lives aside her life partner and her 17-year-old child.

Esperanza wishes to finish building the wall of her house. Therefore, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to finish constructing her home's wall.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to finish constructing her home's wall.

loans.name: Grupo San Ramon 1 Group

texts.es:
Florinda es una mujer reconocida en su comodidad por ser responsable, amable y culta. Tiene 45 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 18 y 32 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea san Ramon
Florinda (la segunda del derecha a izquierda) para obtener sus ingresos hace 15 decidió dedicarse a la costura, a ella le gusta esta actividad pues lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar y esto le permite cuidar mejor de su familia. Florinda gracias a sus años de experiencia en su comunidad es muy reconocida, por esa razón su máquina se a esta desgastando por muchos años  a raíz de esta necesidad ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar una máquina de coser y así poder coser mejor.
Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Florinda is a woman known for being responsible, kind and educated. She is 45 and married with a beautiful family of six children aged between 18 and 32. The family lives in the village community of San Ramon.

Florinda (second from the right), in order to make a living, decided to become a dressmaker 15 years ago. She likes this activity because she does it from the comfort of her home which allows her to take better care of her family. Florinda, thanks to her years of experience, is well known in her community and for this reason her sewing machine is wearing out after many years of use.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine so she can sew better.
Her hope is to strengthen her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Many people in Kenya are poor and most of them find an opportunity in farming to make a living and progress through practicing mixed farming. Such is the case of Isaac who, at the age of 29, has gone through many adversities but has always put on a brave face.

Isaac resides in a remote village in the Keena, Nkubu area of Kenya. He is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Nkubu area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Isaac has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Isaac started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. His sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. The Nkubu, Keena area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Isaac is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Isaac is very determined to succeed. Because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and for his children through accumulated profits. Isaac's dream is to provide a secure future for his children by paying tuition fees for them. You will help him realize his dream through your loan.

For Isaac, nothing is impossible. He wants to continue working to fulfill his dream of becoming the lead supplier of farm produce in his village.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Judith, a youthful 50-year-old, a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect her as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Kitale, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Judith’s farming experience dates back to 2000.

Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which she has been planting for as long as she can remember. She also does dairy farming. With time, the fertility of her land has started to dwindle and whenever she plants maize the yields go down with each cropping season. Judith has also been affected with weeds. At some point she could not be assured of harvesting anything at all.

Today, Judith is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds so as to expand her farming business. Through this loan Judith is going to increase her crop production and this will translate to an improved income level. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Judith; there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in farming.

Change the life of this farmer, make a loan

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Greetings from Nyahururu, Kenya! This is Lucy.

When speaking with Lucy, it becomes obvious that she is a very dynamic, hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Nyahururu, along with her husband and their child. She has always strived to give her child a decent life and a good education.

Lucy has been in agriculture for seven years. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through her training from Juhudi Kilimo, Lucy has learned about the culture of saving, and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming.

Lucy has the firm intention to advance her farming business. She wants to become a successful businesswoman and ensure a better quality of life and welfare for her family. She knows that, with help from Kiva lenders and Juhudi Kilimo, she can achieve all that and more.

Lend to this enterprising Kenyan woman farmer!

loans.use: To buy good quality seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
There is always a reason to smile, but today Winnie has a big reason, and it is that she is only one step away from being able to start her own cereal selling business, thanks to Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva lenders.

Winnie is an amazing woman who is a smallholder farmer based in Wekhoye village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Winnie has been practicing livestock farming for ten years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise cows and poultry on the farm.

Winnie is seeking a loan to stock her cereals business. She plans to use the money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred plus profit. Winnie is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard-working and financially disciplined.

Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her sibling’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a wife and mother dedicated to her work. At age 55, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, on her mixed farm, tirelessly working. Pauline is one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Ngoina, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. Pauline and her husband are blessed with a lovely family.

Pauline has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs and cows for milk and grows maize and vegetables to sell. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Pauline is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Pauline is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm inputs. This move is quite a big deal for her. With the loan she will be able to buy farm inputs such as animal feeds and fertilizers that will help in increasing production in her farm.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane, a 45-year-old woman who is full of smiles.

She is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her four children. She is very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kagumo, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Jane has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 15 years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Jane is contented with the farming way of life.

Jane is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family a decent meal. The Kagumo, Kerugoya area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Being an older woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Jane feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Jane is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children, who are in primary school and high school.

As the December season is approaching, Jane wants to close the year on a high note. Please help Jane so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her four children.

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 56 años de edad, separada, tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 21 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por reunir la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera.
Mirian es de tez morena, cabello negro lo usa tipo melena y baja estatura (la primera de la derecha, lleva una cartera negra en el brazo), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla con sus familiares y sabe español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de las marcas; Avon, Ética y Jafra, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante durante toda la semana en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad. Los productos más vendidos son; lápiz labial, cremas anti edad, tratamientos faciales, perfumes y otros, “antes vendía desodorantes e implementos de aseo, al tener la oportunidad de vender por catálogo inicie mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas las realiza a pedido, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar cosméticos para ofertar. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y distribuir cosméticos, ella desea comprar un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Mirian solicita un préstamo para comprar un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 56-year-old woman. She is separated and has two children aged 19 and 21. She works selling cosmetics.

She is an independent, enterprising, and persistent woman. She works in a southern part of the city, in an area known for its high population density and for its industrial production.

Mirian has dark skin and is short. She wears her dark hair loose (she is the first one standing on the right and has a black purse). Her mother tongue is Guaraní. She speaks it at home, but knows Spanish for cultural and professional reasons.

This time, she is the leader of the communal bank. She sells cosmetics of different brands from a catalogue: Avon, Ética, and Jafra. She works as a street vendor the whole week, visiting different fairs and commercial establishments in the city. The products she sells the most are lipsticks, anti-aging creams, facial treatments, and perfumes, among other things. "I used to sell deodorants and other hygiene products. When the opportunity to sell from a catalogue arose, I started my own business," she says. The advantage is that her customers order the products she sells, the disadvantage is the lack of funding to buy cosmetics to sell.

She dreams of improving her business and deliver cosmetics. She wants to buy cosmetics in bulk. This is her second loan from the institution since she started her business fifteen years ago. This is why Mirian is requesting a loan to buy seasonal cosmetics in bulk.

loans.use: to buy seasonal cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a smiling woman who enjoys her life. She is 37 years old and is a married mother of two children. She conducts dairy and crop farming on her 0.1 acre piece of land. She was born to a poor family, but this does not mean that she was destined for a life with scarce resources. She believes that she has what it takes to move forward and be successful.

To earn a better income, she does a side hustle business (motorbike or tuktuk business) and also engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

As Beatrice can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Your loan will help Beatrice's clients to focus on production, rather than sales. Beatrice's family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

Beatrice has hopes of being able to progress as a farmer and hopes to have a more stable income. Her positive attitude and the desires to get ahead demonstrate in this individual a great willingness to improve herself, and she hopes for a favorable response to her request. Be inspired and loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a very organized mum who is focused on her goals, her family and her work.This lovely and exceptional lady is from Nandihills, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. One thing you will notice when visiting Nandihills is that the place is all green! Expansive tea and maize plantations stretch 360 degrees to the horizon. Maize, tea, and dairy farming are the most dominant activities in the area.

For five years, Esther has been banking on dairy farming to provide for her five children. Her primary income source is milk, poultry, and crops.

Esther is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo because the microfinance institution has an exclusive focus on farmers. With the money, she will buy more poultry. This move not only increases her income, but also helps her to manage various risks that may befall dairy farming in the future. Esther is aware that the Christmas season is coming and she wants to have her business well stocked to meet demand.

Esther is the type of mother who places a greater premium on education than an average parent. She believes that if she does her part and lays a proper foundation for her children, through education, she will have afforded them a shot at being anything they want to be in the future.

Be kind to this mother who wants to create an impact!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Cordillera-2015 Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera que se realiza en el lugar, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Claudia es de tez morena, cabello castaño y baja estatura (al centro viste polera negra que dice ‘i love roma’), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de micro y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. El deseo de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura y cerrajería. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior masculina como, calzoncillos y boxer del tipo; sexy, elegante, sport, elite y otros, “Para todo hay cliente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas segmentadas, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería variada. Su sueño es convertirse en vendedora mayorista, ella desea comprar mercadería por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa interior masculina por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 29-year-old woman. She lives with her partner, and has two children aged 5 and 8. She sells underwear. She is a good mother, and an independent and enterprising woman. She works in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, known for its high population density and its industrial production. It has warm and humid tropical weather.

Claudia has dark skin, light brown hair, and is short (she is standing in the middle, and is wearing a black shirt that says "I love Roma"). Her mother tongue is Guaraní. She speaks it at home, and speaks Spanish due to cultural and professional reasons. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a bus driver, and her children, who go to school. They live in a rented room, built with bricks and served with drinking water, electricity and sewage.

She wanted to improve her business, so she became the leader of the communal bank. The members have different activities. They sell silverware, cell phones, chicken, flowers, and tea, and have tailor and locksmith workshops.

She sells men's underwear, such as underpants and boxers in different styles, such as sexy, elegant, sport, and elite. "There are customers for all kinds of products," she says. The advantage is that she has different marketing strategies for different customers, the disadvantage is the lack of assorted products.

She dreams of becoming a wholesaler. She wants to buy products in bulk. This is her first loan from the institution since she started her business, three years ago.This is why Claudia is requesting a loan to buy men's underwear in bulk to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy men's underwear in bulk to stock her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a youthful 31-year-old farmer from Ndanai, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver.

Kiva lenders, meet Joseph, the man credited with the success story of his farm. He is a loving husband and father to three children and has been farming for the past 10 years.

Joseph passionately loves dairy farming, and this can be attested to by the fact that he knows each of his cows individually, because he works with them twice a day, 365 days a year. He and his wife have even named one of them. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business that he engages in to make ends meet.

The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve it. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow.

Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses.

Through this loan from Kiva lenders, Joseph will buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions.

The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and will also go toward the education of his children. He will also benefit from the cow manure, which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan, he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy.

This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Joseph waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow and to build a bio-gas digester.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de  venta de veneno para plagas, roedores, antenas entre otros, el socio es una persona responsable y espera poder obtener más ganancias en su negocio para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia, él socio desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de veneno para ratas, antenas  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to "Santa Rosita de Lima" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

The member continues earning a living in the business of selling poisons for pests, rodents, and insects, among others. The member is a responsible person and hopes to be able to obtain more profits in his business, and in this way to be able to continue supporting his family. The member wishes to be able to keep working to continue supporting his family.

The member requests the loan in order to purchase poison for rats and insects, among others.

loans.use: to buy rat and insect poison, among others.

loans.name: Sur Y Chilchi Group

texts.es:
Celinda es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘proboste’ distante a 62 kilómetros de la ciudad, área rural dónde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
Celinda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico robusto (sentada a la derecha, viste polera blanca manga larga estampada), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de madera con piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica no existe el agua potable ni alcantarillado. El deseo de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; artesanía en cuero, tejido de sombreros de sao, llantería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de helados, venta de comida, servicio de moto taxi y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos como ‘el somó’ este se realiza en una olla alimentada por fuego de leña, colgada sobre un palo horizontal,  gracias a dos gruesas ramas clavadas a la tierra, “el aroma del Somó es atrayente y es parte de la tradición diaria…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende toda su producción diaria, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar gaseosas. Su sueño es tener una tienda, ella desea comprar gaseosas para mejorar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Celinda solicita un préstamo para comprar gaseosas para vender mayor variedad de refrescos.
texts.en:
Celinda is a 28-year-old woman. She is single and has two children, aged 1 and 3. She sells beverages. She is a good mother, and a strong and hardworking woman. She works in "Proboste," a community located 62 km [38.5 miles] from town. It is a rural area, where most locals work growing vegetables and raising animals.

Celinda has dark skin and long black hair, and is a bit chubby (she is sitting to the right, and is wearing a long-sleeve printed white shirt). Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks it at home. She speaks Spanish for cultural and professional reasons. She shares her life with her children, who are not of school age yet. The family owns the room where they live, which is built with wood and has an earthen floor, and is served with electricity, but not with drinking water nor sewage.

She became the leader of this communal bank thinking of improving her business. The members have different activities: they sell leather handicrafts, make hats from palm leaves, have a tire repair workshop, sell second-hand clothing, sell ice creams, sell food, have a mototaxi, and have a grocery store.

She sells beverages such as "somó," which is made in a pot heated by firewood, hanged on an horizontal stick held by two thick branches stuck in the ground. "The smell of Somó attracts people, and is part of the daily traditions," she says. The advantage is that she sells everything she produces every day. The disadvantage is the lack of funding to buy sodas.

She dreams of having a store. She wants to buy sodas to improve her business. This is her first loan from the institution since she started her business, three years ago. This is why Celinda is requesting a loan to buy sodas and be able to offer a wider variety of beverages.

loans.use: to buy sodas in order to sell a wider variety of beverages.

loans.name: Joycelyne

texts.en:
Despite her youth, Joycelyne, 27, has shown a lot of maturity in taking on the role of the mother of the house. She is a mother of two who is a hard worker. She normally gets up before the first light of the day to go to her farm, milk her cows and tend to her vegetable garden. She is a truly working mother who has established a path and hopes that at the end she will be able to achieve her dreams.

Joycelyne was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation in her family. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

She has always had an affinity for farming. She has even nicknamed one of her cows and is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day which helps her support her family. Joycelyne also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seed, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits.

Joycelyne is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Joycelyne believes that through the loan, she will be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will lift Joycelyne out of poverty.

Make a $25 loan or more, and push Joycelyne’s dream closer to reality!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
Ella es Imelda, una dulce y carismática mujer de 65 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, felizmente casada y con un negocio de confección a terceros en el cual trabaja diariamente 7 horas al día.
Imelda cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en la profesión, sigue trabajando arduamente para alcanzar su sueño de comprar una casa y consolidar un negocio firme el cual pueda heredar  a sus hijos.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de confección, aumentara la capacidad de producción y generará un empleo
texts.en:
This is Imelda, a sweet and charismatic woman. She is 65 years old and a mother to four children. She is happily married and has a dressmaking business. She works seven hours every day.

Imelda has 20 years' experience in her work. She continues to work hard in order to achieve her dream of buying a house and consolidating her business so that she may leave it to her children.

Imelda is applying for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine; she can thus increase production capacity and generate a job for another person.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and increase production capacity.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor en pequeño, juntos tienen cinco hijos de los cuales 4 de ellos ya se acompañaron y solo uno vive con ella y es empleado de una peluquería.

Carmela, tiene una tienda desde hace 6 años, ella aprendió a manejar este negocio porque ella era la encargada de la tienda de una escuela; después de eso decidió colocar su propio negocio porque consideró que era más rentable; su horario de atención es de 8:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. 

Carmela, necesita el préstamo para comprar acetite, pastas, huevos, gaseosa, golosinas, carnes y pollo para su tienda.

El sueño de Carmela, es que su negocio siga prosperando y además desea construir un lugar más adecuado para sus productos.
texts.en:
Carmela is 53 years old and has a fourth-grade education. She is married; her husband is a farmer. The couple has five children. Four of the children are married, while one still lives at home while working at a hairdressing salon.

Carmela has had a shop for six years. She learned to manage this business when she was manager of a shop in a school. Following this work, she decided to open her own business because she thought it would be more profitable. Carmela's business is open from 8am to 7pm.

Carmela needs this loan in order to buy oil, pasta, eggs, fizzy drinks, sweets, meat and chicken for her shop.

Carmela's dream is for her business to continue to prosper, and to build a better shop for her products.

loans.use: to buy oil, pasta, eggs, fizzy drinks, sweets, meat and chicken for her shop.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is an enterprising young woman, smart and creative. She knows how to overcome the problems that life presents and despite having no formal employment, she has never given up looking for ways to support herself through practicing mixed farming. Phanice is a rural smallholder farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. She is married to a fellow farmer and has three children. Her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm and crop farming. However, they are involved in other agricultural activities such as growing maize, vegetables, fruits, and cereals. 

The biggest problem being faced by farmers from Kitale is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmer’s yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from Kitale like Phanice now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms. 

Phanice is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Gonzalo Natividad

texts.es:
Gonzalo, cuenta que gracias  al otorgamiento del crédito anterior pudo tener los recursos para equipar su taller de reparación de vehículos, actualmente  él y su familia se han visto beneficiados, ya que ahora tienen una mejor calidad de vida gracias a que sus ingresos han cambiado de una manera muy satisfactoria.
Nuevamente Gonzalo solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en repuestos para su vehículo y para ofrecerle a sus clientes comprara: empaques, bugías, soportes, aceite, etc., con esto busca continuar atendiendo de la mejor manera a sus clientes y recibiendo los ingresos necesarios para continuar dando una vida más estable a su familia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is grateful for the previous loan that he received. It provided him with the necessary resources to equip his auto repair shop. Currently, he and his family have seen benefits, so that they already have a better quality of life thanks to the increase in his income.
Now, Gonzalo is requesting a loan to be able to invest in spare parts for his vehicle and to offer them to his cusotmers to buy: gaskets, plugs, engine mounts, oil, etc. With this he is looking to continue providing the best service to his customers and receiving the income necessary to continue giving his family a more stable life.

loans.use: to buy: gaskets, plugs, engine mounts, oil, etc. With this he is looking to continue providing the best service to his customers and receiving the needed income.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 38, is quite a mrembo (good-looking) lady: polite, responsible, organized and a go-getter. She is a smallholder farmer practicing livestock and crop farming to make a living. Her husband is a also a farmer and together they are blessed with six children. She enjoys farming for it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya, where Ruth is from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers in Kitale now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Ruth is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has 3 children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, horticulture, and tree farming to provide for her family. In the Nkubu area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Nkubu can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Lucy is seeking a 30,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.
You can help Lucy with all these dreams and goals so she can achieve them all; a loan will get her so much closer.

loans.use: to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a 53-year-old woman, a warrior, and a fighter. All her life she has had to work a lot and endure long work days to put food on the table. Julia is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kathita Nkubu, which is in the central region of Kenya. Julia is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Julia has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: “I have to do something for my family.“ Julia joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Julia is from a remote village(Kathita) that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Julia to achieve her dream and reach her goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Julia feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Julia will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. Julia is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Julia will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her 3 children of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a farm vehicle to transport products to market

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, es una mujer muy trabajadora y que gracias al apoyo proporcionado con el crédito anterior pudo capitalizar su negocio de atoles y manualidades, sus ventas han mejorado y la situación económica de su familia va mejorando poco a poco.
María nuevamente solicita un crédito para realizar la compra de materiales como: papel, listón, cera y otros para la elaboración de flores y coronas para vender en el día de los difuntos, con esto María considera que obtendrá mayores ingresos y podrá continuar dando una estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a very hard-working woman and thanks to the support provided by her previous loan could capitalize her business of handcrafts and "atoles" (hot beverages). Her sales have improved and her family's economic situation is gradually getting better.

Maria once again requests a loan to purchase materials such as: paper, ribbon, wax, and others to make flowers and wreaths to sell on the Day of the Dead. With this, María believes that she will have greater revenues and may continue to provide economic stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as: paper, ribbon, wax, and other items to make flowers and wreaths to sell on the Day of the Dead

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Albeiro es un hombre decidido, comprometido, un amante del campo, toda su vida ha estado rodeado por las verdes montañas, aprendió todo acerca de las actividades agrícolas gracias a sus padres, desde joven ha dedicado su vida al trabajo, no tiene pareja ni hijos, solo sus campos.
El principal objetivo de Albeiro es generar los recursos suficientes para mantener su hogar, pero es un hombre con ambición que quiere más, que quiere progresar, busca ganarse el título de mejor agricultor, trabajando honestamente.
Albeiro quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual le permitirá expandir sus terrenos, el dinero será usado en la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos.
texts.en:
Albeiro is a decided and committed man who loves the countryside. He has all his life been surrounded by green mountains. He learned everything he knows about agriculture thanks to his parents. He has been working since he was a young man, and does not have a partner, nor children; only his land.

Albeiro's main goal is to generate enough resources to maintain his home. However, he has great plans for the future, so he wants to achieve more than that. He wants to earn the "Best Farmer" title by working honestly.

Albeiro wants to request a loan, with which he will enlarge his plantations. He will use the money to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other agricultural supplies.

loans.use: to enlarge his plantations, by buying seeds, fertilizer, and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maria Fanny

texts.es:
María es una tendera de 55 años de edad, una persona de admirar, mujer luchadora, toda una guerrera combativa que con su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar.
Es madre de 4 hijos, 3 de ellos mayores de edad y vive con la menor la cual tiene 15 años, separa de su esposo pero con un gran espíritu emprendedor y sentido de pertenencia con su familia y trabajo.
La cliente se encuentra trabajando para alcanzar un sueño, tener una vivienda propia, está cansada de pagar arrendamientos costosos, solo le queda mejorar como tendera, vender más productos para que su sueño se materialice.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para abastecerse principalmente de víveres, abarrotes y verduras.
texts.en:
María, 55, has a grocery store. She is an admirable person. She is a hardworking woman, a fighter. She sells essential products.

She is the mother of four children, three of them are adults. She lives with the youngest one, who is fifteen. She separated from her husband, but has a great entrepreneurial spirit and loves her family and her job.

She is working to achieve her dream of having her own house. She is tired of paying an expensive rent. She has to improve her business, and sell more product in order to realize her dream.

She is currently requesting a loan to stock her store with groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is happily married, and together with his wife, they are blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years Paul has been involved in mixed farming. He has identified free space on his farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices have been going up in the recent past. So Paul, being a visionary and entrepreneurial farmer, wants to take full advantage of this. 

He has chosen the breed of cow that he will keep and he knows that he will get not only milk from the cow, but also manure that will boost the fertility of his farm. Selling his milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and he will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

He underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Paul hopes that through the accumulated profit he will be able to add value to his milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change his life and will secure the future of his children and aging parents.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old farmer from a remote village in Kipsaina in the Kitale area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Mary passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that lay more eggs and are resistant to diseases.

Mary is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Mary will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Mary will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Most Kenyans living in Nkubu struggle to make their way in this world because they lack employment and money. This was true for Priscilla, 61, who is based in the remote village of Kabuke.

But now she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Priscilla has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said.

Priscilla mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Priscilla is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan, Priscilla is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Priscilla feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that helps women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Priscilla will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market.

She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her children and of a secure future.

The difficult times this woman is going through and her drive to overcome them makes her worthy of the support she is requesting. Be inspired make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years of age, and very passionate and diligent about farming. Having done mixed farming for the past eight years, he has gained much experience and offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers.

Kagutu is a remote village in Nkubu area of Kenya where people live in mud houses made from soil. But within the remote village of Kagutu John is working hard to pull himself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view John as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that he has despite personal challenges, and his passion to support his three children as a primary caregiver.

John started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of his wife, he has grown the business dramatically. He has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. He keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize, fruits and vegetables. He takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

John is seeking a loan to purchase more land. His operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. The money from the investment will be plowed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable him to repay the loan, buy food for his family, and pay fees for his three children who are in public schools. Make a $25 loan, and push John’s dream closer to reality. John can buy more land and succeed with your help!
Be inspired, and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy more land and expand his farming.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, who is a 69-year-old shosho (grand mum), is a charismatic woman and a strong example of hard work. She is a farmer who keeps dairy animals and has a small cash crop garden and trees. She is also a salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business.

To earn additional income, Sabina makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Sabina can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Sabina’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

The work this mother and grandmother does to survive with her loved ones is commendably dignified, and it is well worthwhile to provide her the benefit of the support she needs and is asking for. Be inspired and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Eusephia

texts.en: This how to describe Eusephia: a hardworking woman, honest, humble, and full of life. She is a rural farmer in Chuka, Kenya, an area known for having bad terrain and a lack of proper infrastructure. She is blessed with a lovely family and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm, she grows maize and she raises a dairy goat, cow, and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. However, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction, despite meager earnings. Eusephia says, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge is lack of capital. Because of this challenge, she formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy goat. The goat produces milk daily, which Eusephia sells to a co-operative. The money Eusephia got from selling the milk was adequate to repay the loan. Today, Eusephia is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy goat because she is planning to become a full-fledged dairy goat farmer. With this loan, Eusephia is going to grow into a very successful dairy goat farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Her only dream is to continue growing her business and in the future to leave it to her children. Eusephia patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy goat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 52-year-old, charismatic young woman who is a strong example of hard work. Beatrice is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm, she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Beatrice makes a commission on sales for which she helps to arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Beatrice can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal from local farmers at fair prices and to use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Beatrice’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Beatrice a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereal from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Esther Julia

texts.es:
Esther es una dulce y muy trabajadora mujer, la cual tiene 65 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de mercancía, accesorios, pañales, artículos varios, es casada muy aplicada, responsable, la cual solicita un apoyo para iniciar una actividad paralela a su negocio de venta de mercancía, venta de comidas rápidas.
Esther quiere trabajar y trabajar, por mejorar su situación económica, por gozar de una calidad de vida, por tener trabajo para vivir tranquila y sin preocupaciones.
Solicita un apoyo para comprar el puesto de venta de alimentos y surtido de productos para preparar comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Esther is a sweet and very hard-working woman. She is 65 years old and makes a living selling merchandise: accessories, nappies, and various other items. Esther is married. She is very dedicated and responsible.

Esther is applying for a loan in order to start a new business alongside her work selling merchandise. Esther wants to sell fast food. She wants to work and work more to improve her financial situation and to enjoy a higher quality of life; she wants a worry-free life.

Esther is applying for a loan in order to buy a stall for selling foods and to buy products for preparing fast food.

loans.use: to buy a stall for selling foods and to buy products for preparing fast food.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana, es una joven acompañada, aún no tiene hijos, se dedica a vender artículos varios como medicina natural, cosméticos, bisutería, etc., su pareja también se dedica a vender otro tipo de productos, aprendió el oficio cuando ayudaba a su madre hacerlo, posteriormente su madre le cedió el negocio y en la actualidad es su fuente de subsistencia, lo administra desde hace 4 años y lo atiende de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
En vista de aproximarse fechas muy importantes en las que las ventas aumentan ha decidido solicitar un crédito, con el que comprara medicinas y variedad de ropa para ambos sexos, incluirá nuevos productos para tener más clientes satisfechos, ella piensa administrar de la mejor manera el capital de trabajo para obtener resultados positivos y resarcir su deuda sin dificultades.
Sus sueños son expandir su negocio, tener estabilidad económica, ser una persona reconocida en la sociedad y lograr tener una vida familiar más digna.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman who has a partner but has no children. She earns a living selling various products such as natural medicines, cosmetics and and jewellery etc.

Her partner also earns a living selling other products, he learned about this when he helped his mother to do it. Previously his mother handed over her business to him and at the moment it is his source of income. He has run it for 5 years and works from 6 in the morning until 5 in the evening. 

With some very important dates in sight during which the sales increase, she has asked for a loan, with which she will buy medicines and a variety of clothes for both sexes, including new products in order to satisfy more clients. She thinks of managing in the best way the working capital in order to obtain positive results and pay off her debt without problems. 

Her dreams are to expand her business, to have economic stability, to be a known person within society and be able to achieve a more respectable family life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and a variety of clothes for both sexes, including new products to satisfy more clients

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, es una mujer que esta soltera, de ella únicamente dependen sus padres, ella se dedica a atender una tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad.
Rosa solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en mercadería como: papel higiénico, azúcar, sal, harina, boquitas, entre otros productos, para poder abastecer su tienda y de esa manera tener más clientes satisfechos, por ende esto le permitirá poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos para poderle dar una vida de calidad a sus padres.
El sueño de Rosa es poder hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and only her parents depend on her. Rosa makes a living running a shop where she sells basic, staple goods.

Rosa is applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as lavatory paper, sugar, salt, flour, snacks and other products to stock up her shop. By doing so, Rosa can have more satisfied customers. This will allow her to increase her income and give her parents a better quality of life.

Rosa's dream is to expand her business and to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as lavatory paper, sugar, salt, flour, snacks and other products to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Edison Andres

texts.es:
En la foto se ve al joven Edison trabajando por su futuro, el un hombre de tan solo 21 años de edad, se esfuerza diariamente para consolidar un negocio de venta de peces, no tiene recursos solo esas manos que la vida le regalo para trabajar y convertirse en un hombre exitoso.
Actualmente el cliente se encuentra solicitando u crédito para adecuar la alberga para cría de peces que está cavando, además comprara alimento, hileras y contenedores para transportar y vender en las  veredas y pueblos,
texts.en:
The young man Edison can be seen in the photo working for his future, he is only 21 years of ages. He puts in effort daily to strengthen a business selling fish, his hands are his only resource which life has given him to  work and he is becoming a successful man.

At the moment the partner finds himself asking for a loan to fix up the pond to raise fish, also to buy feed, lining and containers to transport and sell in the towns.

loans.use: to fix up the dug-out shelter to raise fish , also to buy feed, lining and containers

loans.name: Omar  Chavez Group

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 47 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida. 
Ella es emprendedora, decidida y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘El Pari’ zona periurbana donde recientemente terminaron de instalar el agua potable, sus calles son de tierra y debido a que es un lugar plano cuando llueve se inunda.
Miriam es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado y físico robusto (al centro, viste blusa marrón), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como maestro constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de poleras, venta de materiales de librería, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, esta comida presenta alimentos del lugar principalmente a base de arroz, yuca, maíz, carne de gallina, vaca y cerdo, “mi comida preferida es ‘el majao’ porque es fácil de preparar se puede comer frio o caliente…” comenta. El majao es una comida tradicional a base de charque de res, arroz, cebolla,  tomate, urucú, plátanos, huevos y especias. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mayoría de las comidas se pueden comer frías o calientes, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina para cocinar a diario. Su sueño es darle bienestar a su familia, ella desea comprar carne, arroz, fideo, verduras y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar comida caliente y fría.
texts.en:
Miriam is 47 years old. She lives with her partner and has a 17-year-old son. Miriam has a business selling meals.

Miriam is enterprising, determined and hard-working. Her business is in the El Pari neighborhood, where running water was recently made available. The streets are of mud and, because the area is flat, when it rains, it floods.

Miriam is of dark complexion, has long, black, plaited hair, and has a robust physique. (In the photo, she is in the middle, wearing a brown shirt). Miriam's native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, but she also speaks Spanish in everyday life and at her business.

Miriam shares her life with her partner, a builder, and son, who attends school. The family lives in a rented house built of bricks. The house has running water, electricity and is connected to the sewage system.

Miriam's desire to improve her business has led her to start a communal bank. The members have various business, such as selling t-shirts, a bookshop, knitting baby clothes, selling chips, selling sportswear, a neighborhood grocery shop and a butcher. Miriam herself has a business selling typical meals, which include rice, cassava, corn, chicken, beef and pork.

She says, "My favorite food is 'majao' because it is easy to make. You can eat it hot or cold." ("Majao" is a traditional dish comprising beef jerky, rice, onion, tomato, urucu, bananas, eggs and spices.)

The advantage of Miriam's business is that most of her meals can be eaten hot or cold; the disadvantage is her lack of cooking supplies.

Miriam's dream is to provide her family with well-being. Miriam wants to buy meat, rice, noodles, vegetables and other products. This is her first loan with Emprender in the three years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Miriam is applying for a loan to buy supplies for cooking hot and cold food.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies for preparing hot and cold meals.

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hace tres años y por necesidad económica la señora Lucila inicio con la venta de mercancía por catálogo, ella es una mujer casada de 53 años de edad, tiene un hijo y trabaja por la sencilla razón de completar los recursos que se necesitan para el sostenimiento de su hogar y la satisfacción de sus necesidades y deseos.
La señora Lucila trabaja con mucho empeño pues busca juntar los recursos suficientes, para montar un local comercial y trabajar con mayor tranquilidad pues para vender un producto en ocasiones debe realizar largos recorridos.
Pensando en la temporada de fin de año que es la más provechosa económicamente para la cliente, quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de promociones de revista en ropa, lociones, pijamas, accesorios y cosméticos.
Si las venta salen bien podrá pagar la matrícula de su hijo.
texts.en:
Owing to a financial need, three years ago Lucila opened a business selling merchandise from catalogues. Lucila is 53 years old and married. She has one son. She works for the simple reason that she wants to supplement her household income in order to support her home and pay for necessities and items that her family wants.

Lucila is very determined and wants to earn enough money to open a shop. She can then work more peacefully as currently she has to travel long distances in order to sell products.

In planning for the end-of-year festivities, a very good time for the borrower, Lucila wants to apply for a loan in order to buy products such as clothes, lotions, pyjamas, accessories, and cosmetics.

If sales are good, Lucila will be able to pay for her son's matriculation fees.

loans.use: to buy products such as clothes, lotions, pyjamas, accessories, and cosmetics.

loans.name: A'i Markus

texts.en:
A'I Markus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, A'I Markus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, A'I Markus would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, A'I Markus can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
