As a Babban Gona member, A'I Markus will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. A'I Markus is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Nuhu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Nuhu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Nuhu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Nuhu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Genes Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, una persona de un gran corazón la cual se dedica a prestar servicios de hospedaje, es muy reconocida por la amabilidad y cordialidad con la que atiende a sus clientes.
Actualmente la cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para construir y acondicionar una habitación para albergar pensionados, personas de la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Eufemia is a 47 year old woman, with a big heart who spends her time providing hospitality services. She is very well known for her friendly nature and warmth with which she treats her clients.

At the moment she is asking for a loan to build and air condition a room to house pensioners, and people of an old age.

loans.use: to build and air condition a room to house pensioners and old age people

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lucelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lucelly es una mujer cabeza de familia de 51 años de edad, madre soltera la cual genera ingresos gracias a  su negocio de venta de ropa.
Desde que es mayor de edad ha luchado incansablemente pro valerse por sí misma, se siente feliz y agradecida porque ni a ella ni a su hija le ha faltado nada, comen bien, tienen un techo, ella estudia y gran parte de ese crédito se lo lleva Lucelly quien sale diariamente a vender sus poR abastecerse de mercancía para la temporada de fin de año, comprara principalmente pantalones para hombre y mujeres.
Productos.
La cliente quiere solicita un crédito con un monto considerable, pues busca
texts.en:
Lucelly is a 51 year old woman who is head of a family, she is a single mother who generates an income thanks to her business selling clothes.

Since she was of age she has fought tirelessly to make the most of herself, she feels happy and grateful because neither her or her daughter are lacking anything, they eat well, have a roof and she studies which is mostly thanks to Lucelly who has gone out daily to sell her products to supply merchandise for the end of year season, she will mainly buy trousers for men and women. 

The partner wants to ask for a loan of a considerable amount.

loans.use: to supply merchandise for the end of year season

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a maize farmer from Shukau village. As a Babban Gona member, Rahab is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahab would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Rahab can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rahab no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Rahab hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using her additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from the Gwani village. This season, Ibrahim anticipates good yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the national average in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member however, Ibrahim can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressures to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is a maize farmer from Shukau village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land. This is five and half times higher than that of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Laazarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Laazarus will be able to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for it at a premium of up to 37% higher than market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Laazarus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare, he hopes to realize better yields. Laazarus plans to use his additional income to purchase a motorbike to help him do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, vive con sus 2 padres que ya son de avanzada edad y su hermana se encarga de cuidarlos.

José, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace varios años y fue su padre quien le enseño todo acerca de este trabajo, porque ellos dependen de los cultivos de maíz, maicillo y frijol.- Él tiene una parcela cerca de su casa en la cual trabaja todos los días por las mañanas y en las tarde algunas veces trabaja como ayudante de albañil. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono e insecticidas para los cultivos de maíz y mancillo y frijol, para poder obtener buenas cosechas.

El principal sueño de José, es obtener cultivos buenos y de calidad y que sus padres tengan buena salud.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and has an eighth-grade education. He lives with his two parents, now of an advanced age, and his sister, who looks after their parents.

José has been working in farming for a number of years. His father taught him everything about this trade as the family depends on corn, sorghum and bean crops. José has a plot of land near his home where he works every morning. On some afternoons, José works as a building labourer.

José needs this loan in order to buy manure and insecticides for corn, sorghum and bean crops and to have good harvests.

José biggest dreams are to grow good, quality crops and for his parents to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticides for corn, sorghum and bean crops.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr:
Jacques a 40 ans, il est marié et sa femme travaille avec dans l'exploitation de l'activité génératrice de revenu familial. Le couple se soutienne mutuellement pour le bien-être de leur trois enfants. Ces derniers qui sont âgés de 6, 12 et 15 ans sont tous scolarisés.
Le couple travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche confectionnant des chapeaux auparavant. Celle-ci a dû fermer sa porte en 2000 et ils ont décidé d'exploiter l'activité pour leur propre compte. Jacques confectionne les chapeaux et sa femme confectionne des vêtements.
Pour améliorer la qualité des produits et pour pouvoir augmenter le volume de production, il voudrait acquérir une machine piqueuse industrielle d'occasion. L'objectif est de fidéliser les clients existant et d'en attirer d'autres.
texts.en:
Jacques is 40 years old and married; his wife works in operations in the family's business. The couple supports themselves for the well-being of their three children, who are six, 12 and 15 years old and all attend school.

The couple previously worked in a business in the free zone making hats. This business had to close its doors in 2000 and they decided to operate the business on their own. Jacques makes the hats and his wife makes clothing.

In order to improve the quality of their products and be able to increase their production volumes, Jacques would like to purchase a secondhand industrial sewing machine. The goal is to win the loyalty of their current customers and attract others.

loans.use: to purchase supplies: lining, raffia, ribbon, etc. and a secondhand industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Topister

texts.en:
Topister is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her seven children.

Kiva lenders! Meet one of the most hardworking women on planet earth. She is 39 years of age, very hardworking, and a go-getter. She hails from Kwanza, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming.

Topister is contented with the farming way of life. She is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal.

The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Being a woman from a marginalized community and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Topister feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her.

Topister is well disciplined with finances, and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dreams are to build a modern house and move from the mud house that she currently stays in.

Please help Topister so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her seven children.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 50, a farmer, has been practicing crop farming and sheep farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques. Therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Christine is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and to be able to get more crop output than in the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Come on: go ahead and support this business woman.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Rudha

texts.en:
Rudha, 66, is a go-getter. She is a humble and loving mom and a hardworking farmer, committed to building a better life for her family. She hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, a rural town in the Rift valley area of Kenya. Rudha’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mom has been making great strides.

Rudha and her husband support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past twenty years. She also uses her motorbike in a side hustle business to support her family. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her eight children.

Lately Rudha has been facing financial challenges, so because the Kitale area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking a 40,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo loan to buy and sell cereals so as to improve her income level. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Rudha has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Rudha is visionary and hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop which will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

You can help Rudha to accomplish this. A little trust and a loan will make a big difference in her and her family's lives.

loans.use: to buy and sell cereals so as to improve her income level.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for, and harvesting, to earning income from her crops as well.

Janet lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with her husband and their four children.

She has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling products from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity.

With the loan, she plans to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving, and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the lives of Janet and her family

loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Harisoa Claire

texts.fr:
Harisoa a 37 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari est un chauffeur de taxi brousse. Le nombre d’enfants est de quatre dont trois scolarisés dans des écoles privées.
Avant, Harisoa exerçait comme activité une gargote ambulante. Les prêts obtenus lui ont permis de développer cette activité. Actuellement, elle dispose d’un local fixe pour l’activité ( paiement d’un loyer) . Le prêt lui permettra de diversifier les menus offerts par la gargote: plat de riz et accompagnements et composé. 
Les bénéfices tirés de l’activité ont permis au couple de couvrir les dépenses de scolarisation des enfants qui suivent tous leurs études dans des écoles privées, l’un travaille déjà. Le projet du couple est de pouvoir acquérir un terrain et y construire leur propre maison afin d’éviter le paiement d’un loyer.
texts.en:
Harisoa is 37 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a bush taxi driver. They have four children, three of whom attend private school.

Before, Harisoa ran a mobile food stall. Her [previous] loans allowed her to build this business. At the moment, Harisoa has a fixed venue for her business ([for which she] pays rent). Th[is] loan will allow her to provide a more varied menu: rice plates, sides, and combinations.

The profits from the business have allowed Harisoa and her husband to pay the fees for their children's education in private schools. [One of their children] is already employed. The couple's goal is to be able to purchase land on which to build their own house in order to [be able to] stop paying rent.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Marie Joëline

texts.fr:
Marie Joëline a 23 ans, elle est encore célibataire. L’expérience dans l’activité de diriger un magasin général date de deux ans. C'est à dire depuis qu'elle a arrêté ses études. Les revenus tirés de l’activité lui ont permis d’appuyer ses parents. C’est elle seule qui s’occupe de l’activité : approvisionnement et vente. Elle est à son cinquième prêt pour développer l’activité : augmentation de stock et diversification des produits.
Elle a créé cette activité pour pouvoir apporter des appuis financiers à ses parents. Elle habite avec eux. Elle est prévoyante. Son rêve est de pouvoir vivre dans des meilleures conditions : préparer son avenir par la construction d’une maison.
texts.en:
Marie Joëline is 23 years old and is still single. She has been managing a general store for two years, which is how long ago she left school. The income from the business has allowed her to support her parents. She is the only one who sees to the business, both procurement and sales. She is on her fifth loan to expand the business, increasing her stock and diversifying her products.

Marie Joëline established this business in order to be able to offer her parents financial support. She lives with them. Marie Joëline is far-sighted: Her dream is to be able to live in better conditions and to prepare for her future by building a house.

loans.use: to purchase health drinks, school supplies, and staples like rice, sugar, candles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nelis Patricia

texts.es:
Nelis es una mujer del campo, una persona activa que se dedica a  las actividades agrícolas, aquellas que una vez su madre le heredó y le enseño en su infancia y gracias a  ellos y los ingresos que genera su esposo mantiene un hogar en cual lo termina de conformar su hija adolescente. Ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y necesita un apoyo para comprar cuido para aves, animales, y mallas, plásticos, bebederos, comederos con los cuales adecuara sus galpones.
Se encuentra realizando un gran esfuerzo económico, partiendo de la idea que ella es humilde, ya que quiere finalizar y empezar el año de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Nelis is a country woman. She is an active woman who works in agricultural activities that she inherited from her mother who taught her when she was very young. Thanks to these activities and the revenue her husband generates she maintains a household which includes her adolescent daughter.

She works raising chickens and needs help to buy products to care for her poultry, animals and mesh, plastic, water dispensers and feeders to fix up her sheds.

She is carrying out a large economic effort, starting from the idea that she is humble and she wants to finish the year and start the next in the best manner.

loans.use: to buy products to care for poultry, animals and mesh, plastics, water dispensers and feeders.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She resides in Keanthu, a remote village in the lush hills of Chuka in the central area of Kenya.

As the key breadwinner of her family with three children, Nancy has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and bananas. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Because of her immense farming knowledge, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. While she has been making a living from farming, she has identified a niche market for cereals. The only challenge she faces is a lack of funds.

Nancy is now requesting a 50,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy different varieties of cereals to sell in the local market. The market for cereals is never a problem because the demand is high, and she plans to take advantage of that. Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market share by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets.

Nancy is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. Through accumulated profits she will then be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. With this loan Nancy’s life will take a positive turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of cereals to sell in the local market.
